74#define MAX_IO_MSRS 256
75#define KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS 32
76u64 __read_mostly kvm_mce_cap_supported = MCG_CTL_P | MCG_SER_P;
77EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_mce_cap_supported);

79#define emul_to_vcpu(ctxt) \
80 container_of(ctxt, struct kvm_vcpu, arch.emulate_ctxt)
81
82/* EFER defaults:
83 * - enable syscall per default because its emulated by KVM
84 * - enable LME and LMA per default on 64 bit KVM
85 */
86#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
87static
88u64 __read_mostly efer_reserved_bits = ~((u64)(EFER_SCE | EFER_LME | EFER_LMA));
89#else
90static u64 __read_mostly efer_reserved_bits = ~((u64)EFER_SCE);
91#endif

93#define VM_STAT(x) offsetof(struct kvm, stat.x), KVM_STAT_VM
94#define VCPU_STAT(x) offsetof(struct kvm_vcpu, stat.x), KVM_STAT_VCPU

96#define KVM_X2APIC_API_VALID_FLAGS (KVM_X2APIC_API_USE_32BIT_IDS | \
97 KVM_X2APIC_API_DISABLE_BROADCAST_QUIRK)

100static void process_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu);
101static void enter_smm(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu);
102static void __kvm_set_rflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long rflags);

108module_param(ignore_msrs, bool, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR);

114module_param(kvmclock_periodic_sync, bool, S_IRUGO);

119EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_max_guest_tsc_khz);

121EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_tsc_scaling_ratio_frac_bits);

123EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_max_tsc_scaling_ratio);

127/* tsc tolerance in parts per million - default to 1/2 of the NTP threshold */
128static u32 __read_mostly tsc_tolerance_ppm = 250;
129module_param(tsc_tolerance_ppm, uint, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR);
130
131/* lapic timer advance (tscdeadline mode only) in nanoseconds */
132unsigned int __read_mostly lapic_timer_advance_ns = 0;
133module_param(lapic_timer_advance_ns, uint, S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR);

135static bool __read_mostly vector_hashing = true;
136module_param(vector_hashing, bool, S_IRUGO);
137
138#define KVM_NR_SHARED_MSRS 16
139
140struct kvm_shared_msrs_global {
141 int nr;
142 u32 msrs[KVM_NR_SHARED_MSRS];
143};
144
145struct kvm_shared_msrs {
146 struct user_return_notifier urn;
147 bool registered;
148 struct kvm_shared_msr_values {
149 u64 host;
150 u64 curr;
151 } values[KVM_NR_SHARED_MSRS];
152};
153
154static struct kvm_shared_msrs_global __read_mostly shared_msrs_global;
155static struct kvm_shared_msrs __percpu *shared_msrs;
156
157struct kvm_stats_debugfs_item debugfs_entries[] = {
158 { "pf_fixed", VCPU_STAT(pf_fixed) },
159 { "pf_guest", VCPU_STAT(pf_guest) },
160 { "tlb_flush", VCPU_STAT(tlb_flush) },
161 { "invlpg", VCPU_STAT(invlpg) },
162 { "exits", VCPU_STAT(exits) },
163 { "io_exits", VCPU_STAT(io_exits) },
164 { "mmio_exits", VCPU_STAT(mmio_exits) },
165 { "signal_exits", VCPU_STAT(signal_exits) },
166 { "irq_window", VCPU_STAT(irq_window_exits) },
167 { "nmi_window", VCPU_STAT(nmi_window_exits) },
168 { "halt_exits", VCPU_STAT(halt_exits) },
169 { "halt_successful_poll", VCPU_STAT(halt_successful_poll) },
170 { "halt_attempted_poll", VCPU_STAT(halt_attempted_poll) },
171 { "halt_poll_invalid", VCPU_STAT(halt_poll_invalid) },
172 { "halt_wakeup", VCPU_STAT(halt_wakeup) },
173 { "hypercalls", VCPU_STAT(hypercalls) },
174 { "request_irq", VCPU_STAT(request_irq_exits) },
175 { "irq_exits", VCPU_STAT(irq_exits) },
176 { "host_state_reload", VCPU_STAT(host_state_reload) },
177 { "efer_reload", VCPU_STAT(efer_reload) },
178 { "fpu_reload", VCPU_STAT(fpu_reload) },
179 { "insn_emulation", VCPU_STAT(insn_emulation) },
180 { "insn_emulation_fail", VCPU_STAT(insn_emulation_fail) },
181 { "irq_injections", VCPU_STAT(irq_injections) },
182 { "nmi_injections", VCPU_STAT(nmi_injections) },
183 { "req_event", VCPU_STAT(req_event) },
184 { "mmu_shadow_zapped", VM_STAT(mmu_shadow_zapped) },
185 { "mmu_pte_write", VM_STAT(mmu_pte_write) },
186 { "mmu_pte_updated", VM_STAT(mmu_pte_updated) },
187 { "mmu_pde_zapped", VM_STAT(mmu_pde_zapped) },
188 { "mmu_flooded", VM_STAT(mmu_flooded) },
189 { "mmu_recycled", VM_STAT(mmu_recycled) },
190 { "mmu_cache_miss", VM_STAT(mmu_cache_miss) },
191 { "mmu_unsync", VM_STAT(mmu_unsync) },
192 { "remote_tlb_flush", VM_STAT(remote_tlb_flush) },
193 { "largepages", VM_STAT(lpages) },
194 { "max_mmu_page_hash_collisions",
195 VM_STAT(max_mmu_page_hash_collisions) },
196 { NULL }
197};
198
199u64 __read_mostly host_xcr0;
200
201static int emulator_fix_hypercall(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt);
202
203static inline void kvm_async_pf_hash_reset(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
204{
205 int i;
206 for (i = 0; i < roundup_pow_of_two(ASYNC_PF_PER_VCPU); i++)
207 vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[i] = ~0;
208}
209
210static void kvm_on_user_return(struct user_return_notifier *urn)
211{
212 unsigned slot;
213 struct kvm_shared_msrs *locals
214 = container_of(urn, struct kvm_shared_msrs, urn);
215 struct kvm_shared_msr_values *values;
216 unsigned long flags;
217
218 /*
219 * Disabling irqs at this point since the following code could be
220 * interrupted and executed through kvm_arch_hardware_disable()
221 */
222 local_irq_save(flags);
223 if (locals->registered) {
224 locals->registered = false;
225 user_return_notifier_unregister(urn);
226 }
227 local_irq_restore(flags);
228 for (slot = 0; slot < shared_msrs_global.nr; ++slot) {
229 values = &locals->values[slot];
230 if (values->host != values->curr) {
231 wrmsrl(shared_msrs_global.msrs[slot], values->host);
232 values->curr = values->host;
233 }
234 }
235}
236
237static void shared_msr_update(unsigned slot, u32 msr)
238{
239 u64 value;
240 unsigned int cpu = smp_processor_id();
241 struct kvm_shared_msrs *smsr = per_cpu_ptr(shared_msrs, cpu);
242
243 /* only read, and nobody should modify it at this time,
244 * so don't need lock */
245 if (slot >= shared_msrs_global.nr) {
246 printk(KERN_ERR "kvm: invalid MSR slot!");
247 return;
248 }
249 rdmsrl_safe(msr, &value);
250 smsr->values[slot].host = value;
251 smsr->values[slot].curr = value;
252}
253
254void kvm_define_shared_msr(unsigned slot, u32 msr)
255{
256 BUG_ON(slot >= KVM_NR_SHARED_MSRS);
257 shared_msrs_global.msrs[slot] = msr;
258 if (slot >= shared_msrs_global.nr)
259 shared_msrs_global.nr = slot + 1;
260}
261EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_define_shared_msr);
262
263static void kvm_shared_msr_cpu_online(void)
264{
265 unsigned i;
266
267 for (i = 0; i < shared_msrs_global.nr; ++i)
268 shared_msr_update(i, shared_msrs_global.msrs[i]);
269}
270
271int kvm_set_shared_msr(unsigned slot, u64 value, u64 mask)
272{
273 unsigned int cpu = smp_processor_id();
274 struct kvm_shared_msrs *smsr = per_cpu_ptr(shared_msrs, cpu);
275 int err;
276
277 if (((value ^ smsr->values[slot].curr) & mask) == 0)
278 return 0;
279 smsr->values[slot].curr = value;
280 err = wrmsrl_safe(shared_msrs_global.msrs[slot], value);
281 if (err)
282 return 1;
283
284 if (!smsr->registered) {
285 smsr->urn.on_user_return = kvm_on_user_return;
286 user_return_notifier_register(&smsr->urn);
287 smsr->registered = true;
288 }
289 return 0;
290}
291EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_shared_msr);
292
293static void drop_user_return_notifiers(void)
294{
295 unsigned int cpu = smp_processor_id();
296 struct kvm_shared_msrs *smsr = per_cpu_ptr(shared_msrs, cpu);
297
298 if (smsr->registered)
299 kvm_on_user_return(&smsr->urn);
300}
301
302u64 kvm_get_apic_base(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
303{
304 return vcpu->arch.apic_base;
305}
306EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_apic_base);
307
308int kvm_set_apic_base(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr_info)
309{
310 u64 old_state = vcpu->arch.apic_base &
311 (MSR_IA32_APICBASE_ENABLE | X2APIC_ENABLE);
312 u64 new_state = msr_info->data &
313 (MSR_IA32_APICBASE_ENABLE | X2APIC_ENABLE);
314 u64 reserved_bits = ((~0ULL) << cpuid_maxphyaddr(vcpu)) | 0x2ff |
315 (guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_X2APIC) ? 0 : X2APIC_ENABLE);
316
317 if ((msr_info->data & reserved_bits) || new_state == X2APIC_ENABLE)
318 return 1;
319 if (!msr_info->host_initiated &&
320 ((new_state == MSR_IA32_APICBASE_ENABLE &&
321 old_state == (MSR_IA32_APICBASE_ENABLE | X2APIC_ENABLE)) ||
322 (new_state == (MSR_IA32_APICBASE_ENABLE | X2APIC_ENABLE) &&
323 old_state == 0)))
324 return 1;
325
326 kvm_lapic_set_base(vcpu, msr_info->data);
327 return 0;
328}
329EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_apic_base);
330
331asmlinkage __visible void kvm_spurious_fault(void)
332{
333 /* Fault while not rebooting. We want the trace. */
334 BUG();
335}
336EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_spurious_fault);
337
338#define EXCPT_BENIGN 0
339#define EXCPT_CONTRIBUTORY 1
340#define EXCPT_PF 2
341
342static int exception_class(int vector)
343{
344 switch (vector) {
345 case PF_VECTOR:
346 return EXCPT_PF;
347 case DE_VECTOR:
348 case TS_VECTOR:
349 case NP_VECTOR:
350 case SS_VECTOR:
351 case GP_VECTOR:
352 return EXCPT_CONTRIBUTORY;
353 default:
354 break;
355 }
356 return EXCPT_BENIGN;
357}
358
359#define EXCPT_FAULT 0
360#define EXCPT_TRAP 1
361#define EXCPT_ABORT 2
362#define EXCPT_INTERRUPT 3
363
364static int exception_type(int vector)
365{
366 unsigned int mask;
367
368 if (WARN_ON(vector > 31 || vector == NMI_VECTOR))
369 return EXCPT_INTERRUPT;
370
371 mask = 1 << vector;
372
373 /* #DB is trap, as instruction watchpoints are handled elsewhere */
374 if (mask & ((1 << DB_VECTOR) | (1 << BP_VECTOR) | (1 << OF_VECTOR)))
375 return EXCPT_TRAP;
376
377 if (mask & ((1 << DF_VECTOR) | (1 << MC_VECTOR)))
378 return EXCPT_ABORT;
379
380 /* Reserved exceptions will result in fault */
381 return EXCPT_FAULT;
382}
383
384static void kvm_multiple_exception(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
385 unsigned nr, bool has_error, u32 error_code,
386 bool reinject)
387{
388 u32 prev_nr;
389 int class1, class2;
390
391 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
392
393 if (!vcpu->arch.exception.pending && !vcpu->arch.exception.injected) {
394 queue:
395 if (has_error && !is_protmode(vcpu))
396 has_error = false;
397 if (reinject) {
398 /*
399 * On vmentry, vcpu->arch.exception.pending is only
400 * true if an event injection was blocked by
401 * nested_run_pending. In that case, however,
402 * vcpu_enter_guest requests an immediate exit,
403 * and the guest shouldn't proceed far enough to
404 * need reinjection.
405 */
406 WARN_ON_ONCE(vcpu->arch.exception.pending);
407 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = true;
408 } else {
409 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = true;
410 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = false;
411 }
412 vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code = has_error;
413 vcpu->arch.exception.nr = nr;
414 vcpu->arch.exception.error_code = error_code;
415 return;
416 }
417
418 /* to check exception */
419 prev_nr = vcpu->arch.exception.nr;
420 if (prev_nr == DF_VECTOR) {
421 /* triple fault -> shutdown */
422 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TRIPLE_FAULT, vcpu);
423 return;
424 }
425 class1 = exception_class(prev_nr);
426 class2 = exception_class(nr);
427 if ((class1 == EXCPT_CONTRIBUTORY && class2 == EXCPT_CONTRIBUTORY)
428 || (class1 == EXCPT_PF && class2 != EXCPT_BENIGN)) {
429 /*
430 * Generate double fault per SDM Table 5-5. Set
431 * exception.pending = true so that the double fault
432 * can trigger a nested vmexit.
433 */
434 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = true;
435 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = false;
436 vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code = true;
437 vcpu->arch.exception.nr = DF_VECTOR;
438 vcpu->arch.exception.error_code = 0;
439 } else
440 /* replace previous exception with a new one in a hope
441 that instruction re-execution will regenerate lost
442 exception */
443 goto queue;
444}
445
446void kvm_queue_exception(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned nr)
447{
448 kvm_multiple_exception(vcpu, nr, false, 0, false);
449}
450EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_queue_exception);
451
452void kvm_requeue_exception(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned nr)
453{
454 kvm_multiple_exception(vcpu, nr, false, 0, true);
455}
456EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_requeue_exception);
457
458int kvm_complete_insn_gp(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int err)
459{
460 if (err)
461 kvm_inject_gp(vcpu, 0);
462 else
463 return kvm_skip_emulated_instruction(vcpu);
464
465 return 1;
466}
467EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_complete_insn_gp);
468
469void kvm_inject_page_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct x86_exception *fault)
470{
471 ++vcpu->stat.pf_guest;
472 vcpu->arch.exception.nested_apf =
473 is_guest_mode(vcpu) && fault->async_page_fault;
474 if (vcpu->arch.exception.nested_apf)
475 vcpu->arch.apf.nested_apf_token = fault->address;
476 else
477 vcpu->arch.cr2 = fault->address;
478 kvm_queue_exception_e(vcpu, PF_VECTOR, fault->error_code);
479}
480EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_inject_page_fault);
481
482static bool kvm_propagate_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct x86_exception *fault)
483{
484 if (mmu_is_nested(vcpu) && !fault->nested_page_fault)
485 vcpu->arch.nested_mmu.inject_page_fault(vcpu, fault);
486 else
487 vcpu->arch.mmu.inject_page_fault(vcpu, fault);
488
489 return fault->nested_page_fault;
490}
491
492void kvm_inject_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
493{
494 atomic_inc(&vcpu->arch.nmi_queued);
495 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_NMI, vcpu);
496}
497EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_inject_nmi);
498
499void kvm_queue_exception_e(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned nr, u32 error_code)
500{
501 kvm_multiple_exception(vcpu, nr, true, error_code, false);
502}
503EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_queue_exception_e);
504
505void kvm_requeue_exception_e(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned nr, u32 error_code)
506{
507 kvm_multiple_exception(vcpu, nr, true, error_code, true);
508}
509EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_requeue_exception_e);
510
511/*
512 * Checks if cpl <= required_cpl; if true, return true. Otherwise queue
513 * a #GP and return false.
514 */
515bool kvm_require_cpl(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int required_cpl)
516{
517 if (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) <= required_cpl)
518 return true;
519 kvm_queue_exception_e(vcpu, GP_VECTOR, 0);
520 return false;
521}
522EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_require_cpl);
523
524bool kvm_require_dr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int dr)
525{
526 if ((dr != 4 && dr != 5) || !kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_DE))
527 return true;
528
529 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, UD_VECTOR);
530 return false;
531}
532EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_require_dr);
533
534/*
535 * This function will be used to read from the physical memory of the currently
536 * running guest. The difference to kvm_vcpu_read_guest_page is that this function
537 * can read from guest physical or from the guest's guest physical memory.
538 */
539int kvm_read_guest_page_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu *mmu,
540 gfn_t ngfn, void *data, int offset, int len,
541 u32 access)
542{
543 struct x86_exception exception;
544 gfn_t real_gfn;
545 gpa_t ngpa;
546
547 ngpa = gfn_to_gpa(ngfn);
548 real_gfn = mmu->translate_gpa(vcpu, ngpa, access, &exception);
549 if (real_gfn == UNMAPPED_GVA)
550 return -EFAULT;
551
552 real_gfn = gpa_to_gfn(real_gfn);
553
554 return kvm_vcpu_read_guest_page(vcpu, real_gfn, data, offset, len);
555}
556EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_read_guest_page_mmu);
557
558static int kvm_read_nested_guest_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn,
559 void *data, int offset, int len, u32 access)
560{
561 return kvm_read_guest_page_mmu(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu, gfn,
562 data, offset, len, access);
563}
564
565/*
566 * Load the pae pdptrs. Return true is they are all valid.
567 */
568int load_pdptrs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_mmu *mmu, unsigned long cr3)
569{
570 gfn_t pdpt_gfn = cr3 >> PAGE_SHIFT;
571 unsigned offset = ((cr3 & (PAGE_SIZE-1)) >> 5) << 2;
572 int i;
573 int ret;
574 u64 pdpte[ARRAY_SIZE(mmu->pdptrs)];
575
576 ret = kvm_read_guest_page_mmu(vcpu, mmu, pdpt_gfn, pdpte,
577 offset * sizeof(u64), sizeof(pdpte),
578 PFERR_USER_MASK|PFERR_WRITE_MASK);
579 if (ret < 0) {
580 ret = 0;
581 goto out;
582 }
583 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(pdpte); ++i) {
584 if ((pdpte[i] & PT_PRESENT_MASK) &&
585 (pdpte[i] &
586 vcpu->arch.mmu.guest_rsvd_check.rsvd_bits_mask[0][2])) {
587 ret = 0;
588 goto out;
589 }
590 }
591 ret = 1;
592
593 memcpy(mmu->pdptrs, pdpte, sizeof(mmu->pdptrs));
594 __set_bit(VCPU_EXREG_PDPTR,
595 (unsigned long *)&vcpu->arch.regs_avail);
596 __set_bit(VCPU_EXREG_PDPTR,
597 (unsigned long *)&vcpu->arch.regs_dirty);
598out:
599
600 return ret;
601}
602EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(load_pdptrs);
603
604bool pdptrs_changed(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
605{
606 u64 pdpte[ARRAY_SIZE(vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->pdptrs)];
607 bool changed = true;
608 int offset;
609 gfn_t gfn;
610 int r;
611
612 if (is_long_mode(vcpu) || !is_pae(vcpu))
613 return false;
614
615 if (!test_bit(VCPU_EXREG_PDPTR,
616 (unsigned long *)&vcpu->arch.regs_avail))
617 return true;
618
619 gfn = (kvm_read_cr3(vcpu) & 0xffffffe0ul) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
620 offset = (kvm_read_cr3(vcpu) & 0xffffffe0ul) & (PAGE_SIZE - 1);
621 r = kvm_read_nested_guest_page(vcpu, gfn, pdpte, offset, sizeof(pdpte),
622 PFERR_USER_MASK | PFERR_WRITE_MASK);
623 if (r < 0)
624 goto out;
625 changed = memcmp(pdpte, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->pdptrs, sizeof(pdpte)) != 0;
626out:
627
628 return changed;
629}
630EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(pdptrs_changed);
631
632int kvm_set_cr0(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long cr0)
633{
634 unsigned long old_cr0 = kvm_read_cr0(vcpu);
635 unsigned long update_bits = X86_CR0_PG | X86_CR0_WP;
636
637 cr0 |= X86_CR0_ET;
638
639#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
640 if (cr0 & 0xffffffff00000000UL)
641 return 1;
642#endif
643
644 cr0 &= ~CR0_RESERVED_BITS;
645
646 if ((cr0 & X86_CR0_NW) && !(cr0 & X86_CR0_CD))
647 return 1;
648
649 if ((cr0 & X86_CR0_PG) && !(cr0 & X86_CR0_PE))
650 return 1;
651
652 if (!is_paging(vcpu) && (cr0 & X86_CR0_PG)) {
653#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
654 if ((vcpu->arch.efer & EFER_LME)) {
655 int cs_db, cs_l;
656
657 if (!is_pae(vcpu))
658 return 1;
659 kvm_x86_ops->get_cs_db_l_bits(vcpu, &cs_db, &cs_l);
660 if (cs_l)
661 return 1;
662 } else
663#endif
664 if (is_pae(vcpu) && !load_pdptrs(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu,
665 kvm_read_cr3(vcpu)))
666 return 1;
667 }
668
669 if (!(cr0 & X86_CR0_PG) && kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_PCIDE))
670 return 1;
671
672 kvm_x86_ops->set_cr0(vcpu, cr0);
673
674 if ((cr0 ^ old_cr0) & X86_CR0_PG) {
675 kvm_clear_async_pf_completion_queue(vcpu);
676 kvm_async_pf_hash_reset(vcpu);
677 }
678
679 if ((cr0 ^ old_cr0) & update_bits)
680 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
681
682 if (((cr0 ^ old_cr0) & X86_CR0_CD) &&
683 kvm_arch_has_noncoherent_dma(vcpu->kvm) &&
684 !kvm_check_has_quirk(vcpu->kvm, KVM_X86_QUIRK_CD_NW_CLEARED))
685 kvm_zap_gfn_range(vcpu->kvm, 0, ~0ULL);
686
687 return 0;
688}
689EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_cr0);
690
691void kvm_lmsw(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long msw)
692{
693 (void)kvm_set_cr0(vcpu, kvm_read_cr0_bits(vcpu, ~0x0eul) | (msw & 0x0f));
694}
695EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_lmsw);
696
697static void kvm_load_guest_xcr0(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
698{
699 if (kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_OSXSAVE) &&
700 !vcpu->guest_xcr0_loaded) {
701 /* kvm_set_xcr() also depends on this */
702 xsetbv(XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK, vcpu->arch.xcr0);
703 vcpu->guest_xcr0_loaded = 1;
704 }
705}
706
707static void kvm_put_guest_xcr0(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
708{
709 if (vcpu->guest_xcr0_loaded) {
710 if (vcpu->arch.xcr0 != host_xcr0)
711 xsetbv(XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK, host_xcr0);
712 vcpu->guest_xcr0_loaded = 0;
713 }
714}
715
716static int __kvm_set_xcr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 index, u64 xcr)
717{
718 u64 xcr0 = xcr;
719 u64 old_xcr0 = vcpu->arch.xcr0;
720 u64 valid_bits;
721
722 /* Only support XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK(xcr0) now */
723 if (index != XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK)
724 return 1;
725 if (!(xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_FP))
726 return 1;
727 if ((xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_YMM) && !(xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_SSE))
728 return 1;
729
730 /*
731 * Do not allow the guest to set bits that we do not support
732 * saving. However, xcr0 bit 0 is always set, even if the
733 * emulated CPU does not support XSAVE (see fx_init).
734 */
735 valid_bits = vcpu->arch.guest_supported_xcr0 | XFEATURE_MASK_FP;
736 if (xcr0 & ~valid_bits)
737 return 1;
738
739 if ((!(xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_BNDREGS)) !=
740 (!(xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_BNDCSR)))
741 return 1;
742
743 if (xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_AVX512) {
744 if (!(xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_YMM))
745 return 1;
746 if ((xcr0 & XFEATURE_MASK_AVX512) != XFEATURE_MASK_AVX512)
747 return 1;
748 }
749 vcpu->arch.xcr0 = xcr0;
750
751 if ((xcr0 ^ old_xcr0) & XFEATURE_MASK_EXTEND)
752 kvm_update_cpuid(vcpu);
753 return 0;
754}
755
756int kvm_set_xcr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 index, u64 xcr)
757{
758 if (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) != 0 ||
759 __kvm_set_xcr(vcpu, index, xcr)) {
760 kvm_inject_gp(vcpu, 0);
761 return 1;
762 }
763 return 0;
764}
765EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_xcr);
766
767int kvm_set_cr4(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long cr4)
768{
769 unsigned long old_cr4 = kvm_read_cr4(vcpu);
770 unsigned long pdptr_bits = X86_CR4_PGE | X86_CR4_PSE | X86_CR4_PAE |
771 X86_CR4_SMEP | X86_CR4_SMAP | X86_CR4_PKE;
772
773 if (cr4 & CR4_RESERVED_BITS)
774 return 1;
775
776 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_XSAVE) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_OSXSAVE))
777 return 1;
778
779 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_SMEP) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_SMEP))
780 return 1;
781
782 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_SMAP) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_SMAP))
783 return 1;
784
785 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_FSGSBASE) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_FSGSBASE))
786 return 1;
787
788 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_PKU) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_PKE))
789 return 1;
790
791 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_LA57) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_LA57))
792 return 1;
793
794 if (is_long_mode(vcpu)) {
795 if (!(cr4 & X86_CR4_PAE))
796 return 1;
797 } else if (is_paging(vcpu) && (cr4 & X86_CR4_PAE)
798 && ((cr4 ^ old_cr4) & pdptr_bits)
799 && !load_pdptrs(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu,
800 kvm_read_cr3(vcpu)))
801 return 1;
802
803 if ((cr4 & X86_CR4_PCIDE) && !(old_cr4 & X86_CR4_PCIDE)) {
804 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_PCID))
805 return 1;
806
807 /* PCID can not be enabled when cr3[11:0]!=000H or EFER.LMA=0 */
808 if ((kvm_read_cr3(vcpu) & X86_CR3_PCID_MASK) || !is_long_mode(vcpu))
809 return 1;
810 }
811
812 if (kvm_x86_ops->set_cr4(vcpu, cr4))
813 return 1;
814
815 if (((cr4 ^ old_cr4) & pdptr_bits) ||
816 (!(cr4 & X86_CR4_PCIDE) && (old_cr4 & X86_CR4_PCIDE)))
817 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
818
819 if ((cr4 ^ old_cr4) & (X86_CR4_OSXSAVE | X86_CR4_PKE))
820 kvm_update_cpuid(vcpu);
821
822 return 0;
823}
824EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_cr4);
825
826int kvm_set_cr3(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long cr3)
827{
828#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
829 cr3 &= ~CR3_PCID_INVD;
830#endif
831
832 if (cr3 == kvm_read_cr3(vcpu) && !pdptrs_changed(vcpu)) {
833 kvm_mmu_sync_roots(vcpu);
834 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TLB_FLUSH, vcpu);
835 return 0;
836 }
837
838 if (is_long_mode(vcpu) &&
839 (cr3 & rsvd_bits(cpuid_maxphyaddr(vcpu), 63)))
840 return 1;
841 else if (is_pae(vcpu) && is_paging(vcpu) &&
842 !load_pdptrs(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu, cr3))
843 return 1;
844
845 vcpu->arch.cr3 = cr3;
846 __set_bit(VCPU_EXREG_CR3, (ulong *)&vcpu->arch.regs_avail);
847 kvm_mmu_new_cr3(vcpu);
848 return 0;
849}
850EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_cr3);
851
852int kvm_set_cr8(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long cr8)
853{
854 if (cr8 & CR8_RESERVED_BITS)
855 return 1;
856 if (lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
857 kvm_lapic_set_tpr(vcpu, cr8);
858 else
859 vcpu->arch.cr8 = cr8;
860 return 0;
861}
862EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_cr8);
863
864unsigned long kvm_get_cr8(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
865{
866 if (lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
867 return kvm_lapic_get_cr8(vcpu);
868 else
869 return vcpu->arch.cr8;
870}
871EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_cr8);
872
873static void kvm_update_dr0123(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
874{
875 int i;
876
877 if (!(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP)) {
878 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_DB_REGS; i++)
879 vcpu->arch.eff_db[i] = vcpu->arch.db[i];
880 vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs |= KVM_DEBUGREG_RELOAD;
881 }
882}
883
884static void kvm_update_dr6(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
885{
886 if (!(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP))
887 kvm_x86_ops->set_dr6(vcpu, vcpu->arch.dr6);
888}
889
890static void kvm_update_dr7(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
891{
892 unsigned long dr7;
893
894 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP)
895 dr7 = vcpu->arch.guest_debug_dr7;
896 else
897 dr7 = vcpu->arch.dr7;
898 kvm_x86_ops->set_dr7(vcpu, dr7);
899 vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs &= ~KVM_DEBUGREG_BP_ENABLED;
900 if (dr7 & DR7_BP_EN_MASK)
901 vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs |= KVM_DEBUGREG_BP_ENABLED;
902}
903
904static u64 kvm_dr6_fixed(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
905{
906 u64 fixed = DR6_FIXED_1;
907
908 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_RTM))
909 fixed |= DR6_RTM;
910 return fixed;
911}
912
913static int __kvm_set_dr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int dr, unsigned long val)
914{
915 switch (dr) {
916 case 0 ... 3:
917 vcpu->arch.db[dr] = val;
918 if (!(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP))
919 vcpu->arch.eff_db[dr] = val;
920 break;
921 case 4:
922 /* fall through */
923 case 6:
924 if (val & 0xffffffff00000000ULL)
925 return -1; /* #GP */
926 vcpu->arch.dr6 = (val & DR6_VOLATILE) | kvm_dr6_fixed(vcpu);
927 kvm_update_dr6(vcpu);
928 break;
929 case 5:
930 /* fall through */
931 default: /* 7 */
932 if (val & 0xffffffff00000000ULL)
933 return -1; /* #GP */
934 vcpu->arch.dr7 = (val & DR7_VOLATILE) | DR7_FIXED_1;
935 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
936 break;
937 }
938
939 return 0;
940}
941
942int kvm_set_dr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int dr, unsigned long val)
943{
944 if (__kvm_set_dr(vcpu, dr, val)) {
945 kvm_inject_gp(vcpu, 0);
946 return 1;
947 }
948 return 0;
949}
950EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_dr);
951
952int kvm_get_dr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int dr, unsigned long *val)
953{
954 switch (dr) {
955 case 0 ... 3:
956 *val = vcpu->arch.db[dr];
957 break;
958 case 4:
959 /* fall through */
960 case 6:
961 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP)
962 *val = vcpu->arch.dr6;
963 else
964 *val = kvm_x86_ops->get_dr6(vcpu);
965 break;
966 case 5:
967 /* fall through */
968 default: /* 7 */
969 *val = vcpu->arch.dr7;
970 break;
971 }
972 return 0;
973}
974EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_dr);
975
976bool kvm_rdpmc(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
977{
978 u32 ecx = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RCX);
979 u64 data;
980 int err;
981
982 err = kvm_pmu_rdpmc(vcpu, ecx, &data);
983 if (err)
984 return err;
985 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX, (u32)data);
986 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDX, data >> 32);
987 return err;
988}
989EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_rdpmc);
990
991/*
992 * List of msr numbers which we expose to userspace through KVM_GET_MSRS
993 * and KVM_SET_MSRS, and KVM_GET_MSR_INDEX_LIST.
994 *
995 * This list is modified at module load time to reflect the
996 * capabilities of the host cpu. This capabilities test skips MSRs that are
997 * kvm-specific. Those are put in emulated_msrs; filtering of emulated_msrs
998 * may depend on host virtualization features rather than host cpu features.
999 */
1000
1001static u32 msrs_to_save[] = {
1002 MSR_IA32_SYSENTER_CS, MSR_IA32_SYSENTER_ESP, MSR_IA32_SYSENTER_EIP,
1003 MSR_STAR,
1004#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1005 MSR_CSTAR, MSR_KERNEL_GS_BASE, MSR_SYSCALL_MASK, MSR_LSTAR,
1006#endif
1007 MSR_IA32_TSC, MSR_IA32_CR_PAT, MSR_VM_HSAVE_PA,
1008 MSR_IA32_FEATURE_CONTROL, MSR_IA32_BNDCFGS, MSR_TSC_AUX,
1009 MSR_IA32_SPEC_CTRL, MSR_IA32_ARCH_CAPABILITIES
1010};
1011
1012static unsigned num_msrs_to_save;
1013
1014static u32 emulated_msrs[] = {
1015 MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME, MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK,
1016 MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME_NEW, MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK_NEW,
1017 HV_X64_MSR_GUEST_OS_ID, HV_X64_MSR_HYPERCALL,
1018 HV_X64_MSR_TIME_REF_COUNT, HV_X64_MSR_REFERENCE_TSC,
1019 HV_X64_MSR_TSC_FREQUENCY, HV_X64_MSR_APIC_FREQUENCY,
1020 HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P0, HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P1, HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P2,
1021 HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P3, HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P4, HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_CTL,
1022 HV_X64_MSR_RESET,
1023 HV_X64_MSR_VP_INDEX,
1024 HV_X64_MSR_VP_RUNTIME,
1025 HV_X64_MSR_SCONTROL,
1026 HV_X64_MSR_STIMER0_CONFIG,
1027 HV_X64_MSR_APIC_ASSIST_PAGE, MSR_KVM_ASYNC_PF_EN, MSR_KVM_STEAL_TIME,
1028 MSR_KVM_PV_EOI_EN,
1029
1030 MSR_IA32_TSC_ADJUST,
1031 MSR_IA32_TSCDEADLINE,
1032 MSR_IA32_MISC_ENABLE,
1033 MSR_IA32_MCG_STATUS,
1034 MSR_IA32_MCG_CTL,
1035 MSR_IA32_MCG_EXT_CTL,
1036 MSR_IA32_SMBASE,
1037 MSR_PLATFORM_INFO,
1038 MSR_MISC_FEATURES_ENABLES,
1039 MSR_AMD64_VIRT_SPEC_CTRL,
1040};
1041
1042static unsigned num_emulated_msrs;
1043
1044bool kvm_valid_efer(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 efer)
1045{
1046 if (efer & efer_reserved_bits)
1047 return false;
1048
1049 if (efer & EFER_FFXSR && !guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_FXSR_OPT))
1050 return false;
1051
1052 if (efer & EFER_SVME && !guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_SVM))
1053 return false;
1054
1055 return true;
1056}
1057EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_valid_efer);
1058
1059static int set_efer(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 efer)
1060{
1061 u64 old_efer = vcpu->arch.efer;
1062
1063 if (!kvm_valid_efer(vcpu, efer))
1064 return 1;
1065
1066 if (is_paging(vcpu)
1067 && (vcpu->arch.efer & EFER_LME) != (efer & EFER_LME))
1068 return 1;
1069
1070 efer &= ~EFER_LMA;
1071 efer |= vcpu->arch.efer & EFER_LMA;
1072
1073 kvm_x86_ops->set_efer(vcpu, efer);
1074
1075 /* Update reserved bits */
1076 if ((efer ^ old_efer) & EFER_NX)
1077 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
1078
1079 return 0;
1080}
1081
1082void kvm_enable_efer_bits(u64 mask)
1083{
1084 efer_reserved_bits &= ~mask;
1085}
1086EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_enable_efer_bits);
1087
1088/*
1089 * Writes msr value into into the appropriate "register".
1090 * Returns 0 on success, non-0 otherwise.
1091 * Assumes vcpu_load() was already called.
1092 */
1093int kvm_set_msr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr)
1094{
1095 switch (msr->index) {
1096 case MSR_FS_BASE:
1097 case MSR_GS_BASE:
1098 case MSR_KERNEL_GS_BASE:
1099 case MSR_CSTAR:
1100 case MSR_LSTAR:
1101 if (is_noncanonical_address(msr->data, vcpu))
1102 return 1;
1103 break;
1104 case MSR_IA32_SYSENTER_EIP:
1105 case MSR_IA32_SYSENTER_ESP:
1106 /*
1107 * IA32_SYSENTER_ESP and IA32_SYSENTER_EIP cause #GP if
1108 * non-canonical address is written on Intel but not on
1109 * AMD (which ignores the top 32-bits, because it does
1110 * not implement 64-bit SYSENTER).
1111 *
1112 * 64-bit code should hence be able to write a non-canonical
1113 * value on AMD. Making the address canonical ensures that
1114 * vmentry does not fail on Intel after writing a non-canonical
1115 * value, and that something deterministic happens if the guest
1116 * invokes 64-bit SYSENTER.
1117 */
1118 msr->data = get_canonical(msr->data, vcpu_virt_addr_bits(vcpu));
1119 }
1120 return kvm_x86_ops->set_msr(vcpu, msr);
1121}
1122EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_msr);
1123
1124/*
1125 * Adapt set_msr() to msr_io()'s calling convention
1126 */
1127static int do_get_msr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned index, u64 *data)
1128{
1129 struct msr_data msr;
1130 int r;
1131
1132 msr.index = index;
1133 msr.host_initiated = true;
1134 r = kvm_get_msr(vcpu, &msr);
1135 if (r)
1136 return r;
1137
1138 *data = msr.data;
1139 return 0;
1140}
1141
1142static int do_set_msr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned index, u64 *data)
1143{
1144 struct msr_data msr;
1145
1146 msr.data = *data;
1147 msr.index = index;
1148 msr.host_initiated = true;
1149 return kvm_set_msr(vcpu, &msr);
1150}
1151
1152#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1153struct pvclock_gtod_data {
1154 seqcount_t seq;
1155
1156 struct { /* extract of a clocksource struct */
1157 int vclock_mode;
1158 u64 cycle_last;
1159 u64 mask;
1160 u32 mult;
1161 u32 shift;
1162 } clock;
1163
1164 u64 boot_ns;
1165 u64 nsec_base;
1166 u64 wall_time_sec;
1167};
1168
1169static struct pvclock_gtod_data pvclock_gtod_data;
1170
1171static void update_pvclock_gtod(struct timekeeper *tk)
1172{
1173 struct pvclock_gtod_data *vdata = &pvclock_gtod_data;
1174 u64 boot_ns;
1175
1176 boot_ns = ktime_to_ns(ktime_add(tk->tkr_mono.base, tk->offs_boot));
1177
1178 write_seqcount_begin(&vdata->seq);
1179
1180 /* copy pvclock gtod data */
1181 vdata->clock.vclock_mode = tk->tkr_mono.clock->archdata.vclock_mode;
1182 vdata->clock.cycle_last = tk->tkr_mono.cycle_last;
1183 vdata->clock.mask = tk->tkr_mono.mask;
1184 vdata->clock.mult = tk->tkr_mono.mult;
1185 vdata->clock.shift = tk->tkr_mono.shift;
1186
1187 vdata->boot_ns = boot_ns;
1188 vdata->nsec_base = tk->tkr_mono.xtime_nsec;
1189
1190 vdata->wall_time_sec = tk->xtime_sec;
1191
1192 write_seqcount_end(&vdata->seq);
1193}
1194#endif
1195
1196void kvm_set_pending_timer(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
1197{
1198 /*
1199 * Note: KVM_REQ_PENDING_TIMER is implicitly checked in
1200 * vcpu_enter_guest. This function is only called from
1201 * the physical CPU that is running vcpu.
1202 */
1203 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_PENDING_TIMER, vcpu);
1204}
1205
1206static void kvm_write_wall_clock(struct kvm *kvm, gpa_t wall_clock)
1207{
1208 int version;
1209 int r;
1210 struct pvclock_wall_clock wc;
1211 struct timespec64 boot;
1212
1213 if (!wall_clock)
1214 return;
1215
1216 r = kvm_read_guest(kvm, wall_clock, &version, sizeof(version));
1217 if (r)
1218 return;
1219
1220 if (version & 1)
1221 ++version; /* first time write, random junk */
1222
1223 ++version;
1224
1225 if (kvm_write_guest(kvm, wall_clock, &version, sizeof(version)))
1226 return;
1227
1228 /*
1229 * The guest calculates current wall clock time by adding
1230 * system time (updated by kvm_guest_time_update below) to the
1231 * wall clock specified here. guest system time equals host
1232 * system time for us, thus we must fill in host boot time here.
1233 */
1234 getboottime64(&boot);
1235
1236 if (kvm->arch.kvmclock_offset) {
1237 struct timespec64 ts = ns_to_timespec64(kvm->arch.kvmclock_offset);
1238 boot = timespec64_sub(boot, ts);
1239 }
1240 wc.sec = (u32)boot.tv_sec; /* overflow in 2106 guest time */
1241 wc.nsec = boot.tv_nsec;
1242 wc.version = version;
1243
1244 kvm_write_guest(kvm, wall_clock, &wc, sizeof(wc));
1245
1246 version++;
1247 kvm_write_guest(kvm, wall_clock, &version, sizeof(version));
1248}
1249
1250static uint32_t div_frac(uint32_t dividend, uint32_t divisor)
1251{
1252 do_shl32_div32(dividend, divisor);
1253 return dividend;
1254}
1255
1256static void kvm_get_time_scale(uint64_t scaled_hz, uint64_t base_hz,
1257 s8 *pshift, u32 *pmultiplier)
1258{
1259 uint64_t scaled64;
1260 int32_t shift = 0;
1261 uint64_t tps64;
1262 uint32_t tps32;
1263
1264 tps64 = base_hz;
1265 scaled64 = scaled_hz;
1266 while (tps64 > scaled64*2 || tps64 & 0xffffffff00000000ULL) {
1267 tps64 >>= 1;
1268 shift--;
1269 }
1270
1271 tps32 = (uint32_t)tps64;
1272 while (tps32 <= scaled64 || scaled64 & 0xffffffff00000000ULL) {
1273 if (scaled64 & 0xffffffff00000000ULL || tps32 & 0x80000000)
1274 scaled64 >>= 1;
1275 else
1276 tps32 <<= 1;
1277 shift++;
1278 }
1279
1280 *pshift = shift;
1281 *pmultiplier = div_frac(scaled64, tps32);
1282
1283 pr_debug("%s: base_hz %llu => %llu, shift %d, mul %u\n",
1284 __func__, base_hz, scaled_hz, shift, *pmultiplier);
1285}
1286
1287#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1288static atomic_t kvm_guest_has_master_clock = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
1289#endif
1290
1291static DEFINE_PER_CPU(unsigned long, cpu_tsc_khz);
1292static unsigned long max_tsc_khz;
1293
1294static u32 adjust_tsc_khz(u32 khz, s32 ppm)
1295{
1296 u64 v = (u64)khz * (1000000 + ppm);
1297 do_div(v, 1000000);
1298 return v;
1299}
1300
1301static int set_tsc_khz(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 user_tsc_khz, bool scale)
1302{
1303 u64 ratio;
1304
1305 /* Guest TSC same frequency as host TSC? */
1306 if (!scale) {
1307 vcpu->arch.tsc_scaling_ratio = kvm_default_tsc_scaling_ratio;
1308 return 0;
1309 }
1310
1311 /* TSC scaling supported? */
1312 if (!kvm_has_tsc_control) {
1313 if (user_tsc_khz > tsc_khz) {
1314 vcpu->arch.tsc_catchup = 1;
1315 vcpu->arch.tsc_always_catchup = 1;
1316 return 0;
1317 } else {
1318 WARN(1, "user requested TSC rate below hardware speed\n");
1319 return -1;
1320 }
1321 }
1322
1323 /* TSC scaling required - calculate ratio */
1324 ratio = mul_u64_u32_div(1ULL << kvm_tsc_scaling_ratio_frac_bits,
1325 user_tsc_khz, tsc_khz);
1326
1327 if (ratio == 0 || ratio >= kvm_max_tsc_scaling_ratio) {
1328 WARN_ONCE(1, "Invalid TSC scaling ratio - virtual-tsc-khz=%u\n",
1329 user_tsc_khz);
1330 return -1;
1331 }
1332
1333 vcpu->arch.tsc_scaling_ratio = ratio;
1334 return 0;
1335}
1336
1337static int kvm_set_tsc_khz(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 user_tsc_khz)
1338{
1339 u32 thresh_lo, thresh_hi;
1340 int use_scaling = 0;
1341
1342 /* tsc_khz can be zero if TSC calibration fails */
1343 if (user_tsc_khz == 0) {
1344 /* set tsc_scaling_ratio to a safe value */
1345 vcpu->arch.tsc_scaling_ratio = kvm_default_tsc_scaling_ratio;
1346 return -1;
1347 }
1348
1349 /* Compute a scale to convert nanoseconds in TSC cycles */
1350 kvm_get_time_scale(user_tsc_khz * 1000LL, NSEC_PER_SEC,
1351 &vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_shift,
1352 &vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_mult);
1353 vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz = user_tsc_khz;
1354
1355 /*
1356 * Compute the variation in TSC rate which is acceptable
1357 * within the range of tolerance and decide if the
1358 * rate being applied is within that bounds of the hardware
1359 * rate. If so, no scaling or compensation need be done.
1360 */
1361 thresh_lo = adjust_tsc_khz(tsc_khz, -tsc_tolerance_ppm);
1362 thresh_hi = adjust_tsc_khz(tsc_khz, tsc_tolerance_ppm);
1363 if (user_tsc_khz < thresh_lo || user_tsc_khz > thresh_hi) {
1364 pr_debug("kvm: requested TSC rate %u falls outside tolerance [%u,%u]\n", user_tsc_khz, thresh_lo, thresh_hi);
1365 use_scaling = 1;
1366 }
1367 return set_tsc_khz(vcpu, user_tsc_khz, use_scaling);
1368}
1369
1370static u64 compute_guest_tsc(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, s64 kernel_ns)
1371{
1372 u64 tsc = pvclock_scale_delta(kernel_ns-vcpu->arch.this_tsc_nsec,
1373 vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_mult,
1374 vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_shift);
1375 tsc += vcpu->arch.this_tsc_write;
1376 return tsc;
1377}
1378
1379static void kvm_track_tsc_matching(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
1380{
1381#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1382 bool vcpus_matched;
1383 struct kvm_arch *ka = &vcpu->kvm->arch;
1384 struct pvclock_gtod_data *gtod = &pvclock_gtod_data;
1385
1386 vcpus_matched = (ka->nr_vcpus_matched_tsc + 1 ==
1387 atomic_read(&vcpu->kvm->online_vcpus));
1388
1389 /*
1390 * Once the masterclock is enabled, always perform request in
1391 * order to update it.
1392 *
1393 * In order to enable masterclock, the host clocksource must be TSC
1394 * and the vcpus need to have matched TSCs. When that happens,
1395 * perform request to enable masterclock.
1396 */
1397 if (ka->use_master_clock ||
1398 (gtod->clock.vclock_mode == VCLOCK_TSC && vcpus_matched))
1399 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MASTERCLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
1400
1401 trace_kvm_track_tsc(vcpu->vcpu_id, ka->nr_vcpus_matched_tsc,
1402 atomic_read(&vcpu->kvm->online_vcpus),
1403 ka->use_master_clock, gtod->clock.vclock_mode);
1404#endif
1405}
1406
1407static void update_ia32_tsc_adjust_msr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, s64 offset)
1408{
1409 u64 curr_offset = vcpu->arch.tsc_offset;
1410 vcpu->arch.ia32_tsc_adjust_msr += offset - curr_offset;
1411}
1412
1413/*
1414 * Multiply tsc by a fixed point number represented by ratio.
1415 *
1416 * The most significant 64-N bits (mult) of ratio represent the
1417 * integral part of the fixed point number; the remaining N bits
1418 * (frac) represent the fractional part, ie. ratio represents a fixed
1419 * point number (mult + frac * 2^(-N)).
1420 *
1421 * N equals to kvm_tsc_scaling_ratio_frac_bits.
1422 */
1423static inline u64 __scale_tsc(u64 ratio, u64 tsc)
1424{
1425 return mul_u64_u64_shr(tsc, ratio, kvm_tsc_scaling_ratio_frac_bits);
1426}
1427
1428u64 kvm_scale_tsc(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 tsc)
1429{
1430 u64 _tsc = tsc;
1431 u64 ratio = vcpu->arch.tsc_scaling_ratio;
1432
1433 if (ratio != kvm_default_tsc_scaling_ratio)
1434 _tsc = __scale_tsc(ratio, tsc);
1435
1436 return _tsc;
1437}
1438EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_scale_tsc);
1439
1440static u64 kvm_compute_tsc_offset(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 target_tsc)
1441{
1442 u64 tsc;
1443
1444 tsc = kvm_scale_tsc(vcpu, rdtsc());
1445
1446 return target_tsc - tsc;
1447}
1448
1449u64 kvm_read_l1_tsc(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 host_tsc)
1450{
1451 return vcpu->arch.tsc_offset + kvm_scale_tsc(vcpu, host_tsc);
1452}
1453EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_read_l1_tsc);
1454
1455static void kvm_vcpu_write_tsc_offset(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 offset)
1456{
1457 kvm_x86_ops->write_tsc_offset(vcpu, offset);
1458 vcpu->arch.tsc_offset = offset;
1459}
1460
1461void kvm_write_tsc(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr)
1462{
1463 struct kvm *kvm = vcpu->kvm;
1464 u64 offset, ns, elapsed;
1465 unsigned long flags;
1466 bool matched;
1467 bool already_matched;
1468 u64 data = msr->data;
1469 bool synchronizing = false;
1470
1471 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&kvm->arch.tsc_write_lock, flags);
1472 offset = kvm_compute_tsc_offset(vcpu, data);
1473 ns = ktime_get_boot_ns();
1474 elapsed = ns - kvm->arch.last_tsc_nsec;
1475
1476 if (vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz) {
1477 if (data == 0 && msr->host_initiated) {
1478 /*
1479 * detection of vcpu initialization -- need to sync
1480 * with other vCPUs. This particularly helps to keep
1481 * kvm_clock stable after CPU hotplug
1482 */
1483 synchronizing = true;
1484 } else {
1485 u64 tsc_exp = kvm->arch.last_tsc_write +
1486 nsec_to_cycles(vcpu, elapsed);
1487 u64 tsc_hz = vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz * 1000LL;
1488 /*
1489 * Special case: TSC write with a small delta (1 second)
1490 * of virtual cycle time against real time is
1491 * interpreted as an attempt to synchronize the CPU.
1492 */
1493 synchronizing = data < tsc_exp + tsc_hz &&
1494 data + tsc_hz > tsc_exp;
1495 }
1496 }
1497
1498 /*
1499 * For a reliable TSC, we can match TSC offsets, and for an unstable
1500 * TSC, we add elapsed time in this computation. We could let the
1501 * compensation code attempt to catch up if we fall behind, but
1502 * it's better to try to match offsets from the beginning.
1503 */
1504 if (synchronizing &&
1505 vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz == kvm->arch.last_tsc_khz) {
1506 if (!check_tsc_unstable()) {
1507 offset = kvm->arch.cur_tsc_offset;
1508 pr_debug("kvm: matched tsc offset for %llu\n", data);
1509 } else {
1510 u64 delta = nsec_to_cycles(vcpu, elapsed);
1511 data += delta;
1512 offset = kvm_compute_tsc_offset(vcpu, data);
1513 pr_debug("kvm: adjusted tsc offset by %llu\n", delta);
1514 }
1515 matched = true;
1516 already_matched = (vcpu->arch.this_tsc_generation == kvm->arch.cur_tsc_generation);
1517 } else {
1518 /*
1519 * We split periods of matched TSC writes into generations.
1520 * For each generation, we track the original measured
1521 * nanosecond time, offset, and write, so if TSCs are in
1522 * sync, we can match exact offset, and if not, we can match
1523 * exact software computation in compute_guest_tsc()
1524 *
1525 * These values are tracked in kvm->arch.cur_xxx variables.
1526 */
1527 kvm->arch.cur_tsc_generation++;
1528 kvm->arch.cur_tsc_nsec = ns;
1529 kvm->arch.cur_tsc_write = data;
1530 kvm->arch.cur_tsc_offset = offset;
1531 matched = false;
1532 pr_debug("kvm: new tsc generation %llu, clock %llu\n",
1533 kvm->arch.cur_tsc_generation, data);
1534 }
1535
1536 /*
1537 * We also track th most recent recorded KHZ, write and time to
1538 * allow the matching interval to be extended at each write.
1539 */
1540 kvm->arch.last_tsc_nsec = ns;
1541 kvm->arch.last_tsc_write = data;
1542 kvm->arch.last_tsc_khz = vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz;
1543
1544 vcpu->arch.last_guest_tsc = data;
1545
1546 /* Keep track of which generation this VCPU has synchronized to */
1547 vcpu->arch.this_tsc_generation = kvm->arch.cur_tsc_generation;
1548 vcpu->arch.this_tsc_nsec = kvm->arch.cur_tsc_nsec;
1549 vcpu->arch.this_tsc_write = kvm->arch.cur_tsc_write;
1550
1551 if (!msr->host_initiated && guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_TSC_ADJUST))
1552 update_ia32_tsc_adjust_msr(vcpu, offset);
1553
1554 kvm_vcpu_write_tsc_offset(vcpu, offset);
1555 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&kvm->arch.tsc_write_lock, flags);
1556
1557 spin_lock(&kvm->arch.pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1558 if (!matched) {
1559 kvm->arch.nr_vcpus_matched_tsc = 0;
1560 } else if (!already_matched) {
1561 kvm->arch.nr_vcpus_matched_tsc++;
1562 }
1563
1564 kvm_track_tsc_matching(vcpu);
1565 spin_unlock(&kvm->arch.pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1566}
1567
1568EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_write_tsc);
1569
1570static inline void adjust_tsc_offset_guest(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
1571 s64 adjustment)
1572{
1573 kvm_vcpu_write_tsc_offset(vcpu, vcpu->arch.tsc_offset + adjustment);
1574}
1575
1576static inline void adjust_tsc_offset_host(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, s64 adjustment)
1577{
1578 if (vcpu->arch.tsc_scaling_ratio != kvm_default_tsc_scaling_ratio)
1579 WARN_ON(adjustment < 0);
1580 adjustment = kvm_scale_tsc(vcpu, (u64) adjustment);
1581 adjust_tsc_offset_guest(vcpu, adjustment);
1582}
1583
1584#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1585
1586static u64 read_tsc(void)
1587{
1588 u64 ret = (u64)rdtsc_ordered();
1589 u64 last = pvclock_gtod_data.clock.cycle_last;
1590
1591 if (likely(ret >= last))
1592 return ret;
1593
1594 /*
1595 * GCC likes to generate cmov here, but this branch is extremely
1596 * predictable (it's just a function of time and the likely is
1597 * very likely) and there's a data dependence, so force GCC
1598 * to generate a branch instead. I don't barrier() because
1599 * we don't actually need a barrier, and if this function
1600 * ever gets inlined it will generate worse code.
1601 */
1602 asm volatile ("");
1603 return last;
1604}
1605
1606static inline u64 vgettsc(u64 *cycle_now)
1607{
1608 long v;
1609 struct pvclock_gtod_data *gtod = &pvclock_gtod_data;
1610
1611 *cycle_now = read_tsc();
1612
1613 v = (*cycle_now - gtod->clock.cycle_last) & gtod->clock.mask;
1614 return v * gtod->clock.mult;
1615}
1616
1617static int do_monotonic_boot(s64 *t, u64 *cycle_now)
1618{
1619 struct pvclock_gtod_data *gtod = &pvclock_gtod_data;
1620 unsigned long seq;
1621 int mode;
1622 u64 ns;
1623
1624 do {
1625 seq = read_seqcount_begin(&gtod->seq);
1626 mode = gtod->clock.vclock_mode;
1627 ns = gtod->nsec_base;
1628 ns += vgettsc(cycle_now);
1629 ns >>= gtod->clock.shift;
1630 ns += gtod->boot_ns;
1631 } while (unlikely(read_seqcount_retry(&gtod->seq, seq)));
1632 *t = ns;
1633
1634 return mode;
1635}
1636
1637static int do_realtime(struct timespec *ts, u64 *cycle_now)
1638{
1639 struct pvclock_gtod_data *gtod = &pvclock_gtod_data;
1640 unsigned long seq;
1641 int mode;
1642 u64 ns;
1643
1644 do {
1645 seq = read_seqcount_begin(&gtod->seq);
1646 mode = gtod->clock.vclock_mode;
1647 ts->tv_sec = gtod->wall_time_sec;
1648 ns = gtod->nsec_base;
1649 ns += vgettsc(cycle_now);
1650 ns >>= gtod->clock.shift;
1651 } while (unlikely(read_seqcount_retry(&gtod->seq, seq)));
1652
1653 ts->tv_sec += __iter_div_u64_rem(ns, NSEC_PER_SEC, &ns);
1654 ts->tv_nsec = ns;
1655
1656 return mode;
1657}
1658
1659/* returns true if host is using tsc clocksource */
1660static bool kvm_get_time_and_clockread(s64 *kernel_ns, u64 *cycle_now)
1661{
1662 /* checked again under seqlock below */
1663 if (pvclock_gtod_data.clock.vclock_mode != VCLOCK_TSC)
1664 return false;
1665
1666 return do_monotonic_boot(kernel_ns, cycle_now) == VCLOCK_TSC;
1667}
1668
1669/* returns true if host is using tsc clocksource */
1670static bool kvm_get_walltime_and_clockread(struct timespec *ts,
1671 u64 *cycle_now)
1672{
1673 /* checked again under seqlock below */
1674 if (pvclock_gtod_data.clock.vclock_mode != VCLOCK_TSC)
1675 return false;
1676
1677 return do_realtime(ts, cycle_now) == VCLOCK_TSC;
1678}
1679#endif
1680
1681/*
1682 *
1683 * Assuming a stable TSC across physical CPUS, and a stable TSC
1684 * across virtual CPUs, the following condition is possible.
1685 * Each numbered line represents an event visible to both
1686 * CPUs at the next numbered event.
1687 *
1688 * "timespecX" represents host monotonic time. "tscX" represents
1689 * RDTSC value.
1690 *
1691 * VCPU0 on CPU0 | VCPU1 on CPU1
1692 *
1693 * 1. read timespec0,tsc0
1694 * 2. | timespec1 = timespec0 + N
1695 * | tsc1 = tsc0 + M
1696 * 3. transition to guest | transition to guest
1697 * 4. ret0 = timespec0 + (rdtsc - tsc0) |
1698 * 5. | ret1 = timespec1 + (rdtsc - tsc1)
1699 * | ret1 = timespec0 + N + (rdtsc - (tsc0 + M))
1700 *
1701 * Since ret0 update is visible to VCPU1 at time 5, to obey monotonicity:
1702 *
1703 * - ret0 < ret1
1704 * - timespec0 + (rdtsc - tsc0) < timespec0 + N + (rdtsc - (tsc0 + M))
1705 * ...
1706 * - 0 < N - M => M < N
1707 *
1708 * That is, when timespec0 != timespec1, M < N. Unfortunately that is not
1709 * always the case (the difference between two distinct xtime instances
1710 * might be smaller then the difference between corresponding TSC reads,
1711 * when updating guest vcpus pvclock areas).
1712 *
1713 * To avoid that problem, do not allow visibility of distinct
1714 * system_timestamp/tsc_timestamp values simultaneously: use a master
1715 * copy of host monotonic time values. Update that master copy
1716 * in lockstep.
1717 *
1718 * Rely on synchronization of host TSCs and guest TSCs for monotonicity.
1719 *
1720 */
1721
1722static void pvclock_update_vm_gtod_copy(struct kvm *kvm)
1723{
1724#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1725 struct kvm_arch *ka = &kvm->arch;
1726 int vclock_mode;
1727 bool host_tsc_clocksource, vcpus_matched;
1728
1729 vcpus_matched = (ka->nr_vcpus_matched_tsc + 1 ==
1730 atomic_read(&kvm->online_vcpus));
1731
1732 /*
1733 * If the host uses TSC clock, then passthrough TSC as stable
1734 * to the guest.
1735 */
1736 host_tsc_clocksource = kvm_get_time_and_clockread(
1737 &ka->master_kernel_ns,
1738 &ka->master_cycle_now);
1739
1740 ka->use_master_clock = host_tsc_clocksource && vcpus_matched
1741 && !ka->backwards_tsc_observed
1742 && !ka->boot_vcpu_runs_old_kvmclock;
1743
1744 if (ka->use_master_clock)
1745 atomic_set(&kvm_guest_has_master_clock, 1);
1746
1747 vclock_mode = pvclock_gtod_data.clock.vclock_mode;
1748 trace_kvm_update_master_clock(ka->use_master_clock, vclock_mode,
1749 vcpus_matched);
1750#endif
1751}
1752
1753void kvm_make_mclock_inprogress_request(struct kvm *kvm)
1754{
1755 kvm_make_all_cpus_request(kvm, KVM_REQ_MCLOCK_INPROGRESS);
1756}
1757
1758static void kvm_gen_update_masterclock(struct kvm *kvm)
1759{
1760#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
1761 int i;
1762 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
1763 struct kvm_arch *ka = &kvm->arch;
1764
1765 spin_lock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1766 kvm_make_mclock_inprogress_request(kvm);
1767 /* no guest entries from this point */
1768 pvclock_update_vm_gtod_copy(kvm);
1769
1770 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm)
1771 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
1772
1773 /* guest entries allowed */
1774 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm)
1775 kvm_clear_request(KVM_REQ_MCLOCK_INPROGRESS, vcpu);
1776
1777 spin_unlock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1778#endif
1779}
1780
1781u64 get_kvmclock_ns(struct kvm *kvm)
1782{
1783 struct kvm_arch *ka = &kvm->arch;
1784 struct pvclock_vcpu_time_info hv_clock;
1785 u64 ret;
1786
1787 spin_lock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1788 if (!ka->use_master_clock) {
1789 spin_unlock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1790 return ktime_get_boot_ns() + ka->kvmclock_offset;
1791 }
1792
1793 hv_clock.tsc_timestamp = ka->master_cycle_now;
1794 hv_clock.system_time = ka->master_kernel_ns + ka->kvmclock_offset;
1795 spin_unlock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1796
1797 /* both __this_cpu_read() and rdtsc() should be on the same cpu */
1798 get_cpu();
1799
1800 if (__this_cpu_read(cpu_tsc_khz)) {
1801 kvm_get_time_scale(NSEC_PER_SEC, __this_cpu_read(cpu_tsc_khz) * 1000LL,
1802 &hv_clock.tsc_shift,
1803 &hv_clock.tsc_to_system_mul);
1804 ret = __pvclock_read_cycles(&hv_clock, rdtsc());
1805 } else
1806 ret = ktime_get_boot_ns() + ka->kvmclock_offset;
1807
1808 put_cpu();
1809
1810 return ret;
1811}
1812
1813static void kvm_setup_pvclock_page(struct kvm_vcpu *v)
1814{
1815 struct kvm_vcpu_arch *vcpu = &v->arch;
1816 struct pvclock_vcpu_time_info guest_hv_clock;
1817
1818 if (unlikely(kvm_read_guest_cached(v->kvm, &vcpu->pv_time,
1819 &guest_hv_clock, sizeof(guest_hv_clock))))
1820 return;
1821
1822 /* This VCPU is paused, but it's legal for a guest to read another
1823 * VCPU's kvmclock, so we really have to follow the specification where
1824 * it says that version is odd if data is being modified, and even after
1825 * it is consistent.
1826 *
1827 * Version field updates must be kept separate. This is because
1828 * kvm_write_guest_cached might use a "rep movs" instruction, and
1829 * writes within a string instruction are weakly ordered. So there
1830 * are three writes overall.
1831 *
1832 * As a small optimization, only write the version field in the first
1833 * and third write. The vcpu->pv_time cache is still valid, because the
1834 * version field is the first in the struct.
1835 */
1836 BUILD_BUG_ON(offsetof(struct pvclock_vcpu_time_info, version) != 0);
1837
1838 if (guest_hv_clock.version & 1)
1839 ++guest_hv_clock.version; /* first time write, random junk */
1840
1841 vcpu->hv_clock.version = guest_hv_clock.version + 1;
1842 kvm_write_guest_cached(v->kvm, &vcpu->pv_time,
1843 &vcpu->hv_clock,
1844 sizeof(vcpu->hv_clock.version));
1845
1846 smp_wmb();
1847
1848 /* retain PVCLOCK_GUEST_STOPPED if set in guest copy */
1849 vcpu->hv_clock.flags |= (guest_hv_clock.flags & PVCLOCK_GUEST_STOPPED);
1850
1851 if (vcpu->pvclock_set_guest_stopped_request) {
1852 vcpu->hv_clock.flags |= PVCLOCK_GUEST_STOPPED;
1853 vcpu->pvclock_set_guest_stopped_request = false;
1854 }
1855
1856 trace_kvm_pvclock_update(v->vcpu_id, &vcpu->hv_clock);
1857
1858 kvm_write_guest_cached(v->kvm, &vcpu->pv_time,
1859 &vcpu->hv_clock,
1860 sizeof(vcpu->hv_clock));
1861
1862 smp_wmb();
1863
1864 vcpu->hv_clock.version++;
1865 kvm_write_guest_cached(v->kvm, &vcpu->pv_time,
1866 &vcpu->hv_clock,
1867 sizeof(vcpu->hv_clock.version));
1868}
1869
1870static int kvm_guest_time_update(struct kvm_vcpu *v)
1871{
1872 unsigned long flags, tgt_tsc_khz;
1873 struct kvm_vcpu_arch *vcpu = &v->arch;
1874 struct kvm_arch *ka = &v->kvm->arch;
1875 s64 kernel_ns;
1876 u64 tsc_timestamp, host_tsc;
1877 u8 pvclock_flags;
1878 bool use_master_clock;
1879
1880 kernel_ns = 0;
1881 host_tsc = 0;
1882
1883 /*
1884 * If the host uses TSC clock, then passthrough TSC as stable
1885 * to the guest.
1886 */
1887 spin_lock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1888 use_master_clock = ka->use_master_clock;
1889 if (use_master_clock) {
1890 host_tsc = ka->master_cycle_now;
1891 kernel_ns = ka->master_kernel_ns;
1892 }
1893 spin_unlock(&ka->pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
1894
1895 /* Keep irq disabled to prevent changes to the clock */
1896 local_irq_save(flags);
1897 tgt_tsc_khz = __this_cpu_read(cpu_tsc_khz);
1898 if (unlikely(tgt_tsc_khz == 0)) {
1899 local_irq_restore(flags);
1900 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, v);
1901 return 1;
1902 }
1903 if (!use_master_clock) {
1904 host_tsc = rdtsc();
1905 kernel_ns = ktime_get_boot_ns();
1906 }
1907
1908 tsc_timestamp = kvm_read_l1_tsc(v, host_tsc);
1909
1910 /*
1911 * We may have to catch up the TSC to match elapsed wall clock
1912 * time for two reasons, even if kvmclock is used.
1913 * 1) CPU could have been running below the maximum TSC rate
1914 * 2) Broken TSC compensation resets the base at each VCPU
1915 * entry to avoid unknown leaps of TSC even when running
1916 * again on the same CPU. This may cause apparent elapsed
1917 * time to disappear, and the guest to stand still or run
1918 * very slowly.
1919 */
1920 if (vcpu->tsc_catchup) {
1921 u64 tsc = compute_guest_tsc(v, kernel_ns);
1922 if (tsc > tsc_timestamp) {
1923 adjust_tsc_offset_guest(v, tsc - tsc_timestamp);
1924 tsc_timestamp = tsc;
1925 }
1926 }
1927
1928 local_irq_restore(flags);
1929
1930 /* With all the info we got, fill in the values */
1931
1932 if (kvm_has_tsc_control)
1933 tgt_tsc_khz = kvm_scale_tsc(v, tgt_tsc_khz);
1934
1935 if (unlikely(vcpu->hw_tsc_khz != tgt_tsc_khz)) {
1936 kvm_get_time_scale(NSEC_PER_SEC, tgt_tsc_khz * 1000LL,
1937 &vcpu->hv_clock.tsc_shift,
1938 &vcpu->hv_clock.tsc_to_system_mul);
1939 vcpu->hw_tsc_khz = tgt_tsc_khz;
1940 }
1941
1942 vcpu->hv_clock.tsc_timestamp = tsc_timestamp;
1943 vcpu->hv_clock.system_time = kernel_ns + v->kvm->arch.kvmclock_offset;
1944 vcpu->last_guest_tsc = tsc_timestamp;
1945
1946 /* If the host uses TSC clocksource, then it is stable */
1947 pvclock_flags = 0;
1948 if (use_master_clock)
1949 pvclock_flags |= PVCLOCK_TSC_STABLE_BIT;
1950
1951 vcpu->hv_clock.flags = pvclock_flags;
1952
1953 if (vcpu->pv_time_enabled)
1954 kvm_setup_pvclock_page(v);
1955 if (v == kvm_get_vcpu(v->kvm, 0))
1956 kvm_hv_setup_tsc_page(v->kvm, &vcpu->hv_clock);
1957 return 0;
1958}
1959
1960/*
1961 * kvmclock updates which are isolated to a given vcpu, such as
1962 * vcpu->cpu migration, should not allow system_timestamp from
1963 * the rest of the vcpus to remain static. Otherwise ntp frequency
1964 * correction applies to one vcpu's system_timestamp but not
1965 * the others.
1966 *
1967 * So in those cases, request a kvmclock update for all vcpus.
1968 * We need to rate-limit these requests though, as they can
1969 * considerably slow guests that have a large number of vcpus.
1970 * The time for a remote vcpu to update its kvmclock is bound
1971 * by the delay we use to rate-limit the updates.
1972 */
1973
1974#define KVMCLOCK_UPDATE_DELAY msecs_to_jiffies(100)
1975
1976static void kvmclock_update_fn(struct work_struct *work)
1977{
1978 int i;
1979 struct delayed_work *dwork = to_delayed_work(work);
1980 struct kvm_arch *ka = container_of(dwork, struct kvm_arch,
1981 kvmclock_update_work);
1982 struct kvm *kvm = container_of(ka, struct kvm, arch);
1983 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
1984
1985 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm) {
1986 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
1987 kvm_vcpu_kick(vcpu);
1988 }
1989}
1990
1991static void kvm_gen_kvmclock_update(struct kvm_vcpu *v)
1992{
1993 struct kvm *kvm = v->kvm;
1994
1995 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, v);
1996 schedule_delayed_work(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_update_work,
1997 KVMCLOCK_UPDATE_DELAY);
1998}
1999
2000#define KVMCLOCK_SYNC_PERIOD (300 * HZ)
2001
2002static void kvmclock_sync_fn(struct work_struct *work)
2003{
2004 struct delayed_work *dwork = to_delayed_work(work);
2005 struct kvm_arch *ka = container_of(dwork, struct kvm_arch,
2006 kvmclock_sync_work);
2007 struct kvm *kvm = container_of(ka, struct kvm, arch);
2008
2009 if (!kvmclock_periodic_sync)
2010 return;
2011
2012 schedule_delayed_work(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_update_work, 0);
2013 schedule_delayed_work(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_sync_work,
2014 KVMCLOCK_SYNC_PERIOD);
2015}
2016
2017static int set_msr_mce(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 msr, u64 data)
2018{
2019 u64 mcg_cap = vcpu->arch.mcg_cap;
2020 unsigned bank_num = mcg_cap & 0xff;
2021
2022 switch (msr) {
2023 case MSR_IA32_MCG_STATUS:
2024 vcpu->arch.mcg_status = data;
2025 break;
2026 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CTL:
2027 if (!(mcg_cap & MCG_CTL_P))
2028 return 1;
2029 if (data != 0 && data != ~(u64)0)
2030 return -1;
2031 vcpu->arch.mcg_ctl = data;
2032 break;
2033 default:
2034 if (msr >= MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL &&
2035 msr < MSR_IA32_MCx_CTL(bank_num)) {
2036 u32 offset = msr - MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL;
2037 /* only 0 or all 1s can be written to IA32_MCi_CTL
2038 * some Linux kernels though clear bit 10 in bank 4 to
2039 * workaround a BIOS/GART TBL issue on AMD K8s, ignore
2040 * this to avoid an uncatched #GP in the guest
2041 */
2042 if ((offset & 0x3) == 0 &&
2043 data != 0 && (data | (1 << 10)) != ~(u64)0)
2044 return -1;
2045 vcpu->arch.mce_banks[offset] = data;
2046 break;
2047 }
2048 return 1;
2049 }
2050 return 0;
2051}
2052
2053static int xen_hvm_config(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 data)
2054{
2055 struct kvm *kvm = vcpu->kvm;
2056 int lm = is_long_mode(vcpu);
2057 u8 *blob_addr = lm ? (u8 *)(long)kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config.blob_addr_64
2058 : (u8 *)(long)kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config.blob_addr_32;
2059 u8 blob_size = lm ? kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config.blob_size_64
2060 : kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config.blob_size_32;
2061 u32 page_num = data & ~PAGE_MASK;
2062 u64 page_addr = data & PAGE_MASK;
2063 u8 *page;
2064 int r;
2065
2066 r = -E2BIG;
2067 if (page_num >= blob_size)
2068 goto out;
2069 r = -ENOMEM;
2070 page = memdup_user(blob_addr + (page_num * PAGE_SIZE), PAGE_SIZE);
2071 if (IS_ERR(page)) {
2072 r = PTR_ERR(page);
2073 goto out;
2074 }
2075 if (kvm_vcpu_write_guest(vcpu, page_addr, page, PAGE_SIZE))
2076 goto out_free;
2077 r = 0;
2078out_free:
2079 kfree(page);
2080out:
2081 return r;
2082}
2083
2084static int kvm_pv_enable_async_pf(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u64 data)
2085{
2086 gpa_t gpa = data & ~0x3f;
2087
2088 /* Bits 3:5 are reserved, Should be zero */
2089 if (data & 0x38)
2090 return 1;
2091
2092 vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val = data;
2093
2094 if (!(data & KVM_ASYNC_PF_ENABLED)) {
2095 kvm_clear_async_pf_completion_queue(vcpu);
2096 kvm_async_pf_hash_reset(vcpu);
2097 return 0;
2098 }
2099
2100 if (kvm_gfn_to_hva_cache_init(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.apf.data, gpa,
2101 sizeof(u32)))
2102 return 1;
2103
2104 vcpu->arch.apf.send_user_only = !(data & KVM_ASYNC_PF_SEND_ALWAYS);
2105 vcpu->arch.apf.delivery_as_pf_vmexit = data & KVM_ASYNC_PF_DELIVERY_AS_PF_VMEXIT;
2106 kvm_async_pf_wakeup_all(vcpu);
2107 return 0;
2108}
2109
2110static void kvmclock_reset(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2111{
2112 vcpu->arch.pv_time_enabled = false;
2113}
2114
2115static void record_steal_time(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2116{
2117 if (!(vcpu->arch.st.msr_val & KVM_MSR_ENABLED))
2118 return;
2119
2120 if (unlikely(kvm_read_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2121 &vcpu->arch.st.steal, sizeof(struct kvm_steal_time))))
2122 return;
2123
2124 vcpu->arch.st.steal.preempted = 0;
2125
2126 if (vcpu->arch.st.steal.version & 1)
2127 vcpu->arch.st.steal.version += 1; /* first time write, random junk */
2128
2129 vcpu->arch.st.steal.version += 1;
2130
2131 kvm_write_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2132 &vcpu->arch.st.steal, sizeof(struct kvm_steal_time));
2133
2134 smp_wmb();
2135
2136 vcpu->arch.st.steal.steal += current->sched_info.run_delay -
2137 vcpu->arch.st.last_steal;
2138 vcpu->arch.st.last_steal = current->sched_info.run_delay;
2139
2140 kvm_write_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2141 &vcpu->arch.st.steal, sizeof(struct kvm_steal_time));
2142
2143 smp_wmb();
2144
2145 vcpu->arch.st.steal.version += 1;
2146
2147 kvm_write_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2148 &vcpu->arch.st.steal, sizeof(struct kvm_steal_time));
2149}
2150
2151int kvm_set_msr_common(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr_info)
2152{
2153 bool pr = false;
2154 u32 msr = msr_info->index;
2155 u64 data = msr_info->data;
2156
2157 switch (msr) {
2158 case MSR_AMD64_NB_CFG:
2159 case MSR_IA32_UCODE_REV:
2160 case MSR_IA32_UCODE_WRITE:
2161 case MSR_VM_HSAVE_PA:
2162 case MSR_AMD64_PATCH_LOADER:
2163 case MSR_AMD64_BU_CFG2:
2164 case MSR_AMD64_DC_CFG:
2165 break;
2166
2167 case MSR_EFER:
2168 return set_efer(vcpu, data);
2169 case MSR_K7_HWCR:
2170 data &= ~(u64)0x40; /* ignore flush filter disable */
2171 data &= ~(u64)0x100; /* ignore ignne emulation enable */
2172 data &= ~(u64)0x8; /* ignore TLB cache disable */
2173 data &= ~(u64)0x40000; /* ignore Mc status write enable */
2174 if (data != 0) {
2175 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "unimplemented HWCR wrmsr: 0x%llx\n",
2176 data);
2177 return 1;
2178 }
2179 break;
2180 case MSR_FAM10H_MMIO_CONF_BASE:
2181 if (data != 0) {
2182 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "unimplemented MMIO_CONF_BASE wrmsr: "
2183 "0x%llx\n", data);
2184 return 1;
2185 }
2186 break;
2187 case MSR_IA32_DEBUGCTLMSR:
2188 if (!data) {
2189 /* We support the non-activated case already */
2190 break;
2191 } else if (data & ~(DEBUGCTLMSR_LBR | DEBUGCTLMSR_BTF)) {
2192 /* Values other than LBR and BTF are vendor-specific,
2193 thus reserved and should throw a #GP */
2194 return 1;
2195 }
2196 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "%s: MSR_IA32_DEBUGCTLMSR 0x%llx, nop\n",
2197 __func__, data);
2198 break;
2199 case 0x200 ... 0x2ff:
2200 return kvm_mtrr_set_msr(vcpu, msr, data);
2201 case MSR_IA32_APICBASE:
2202 return kvm_set_apic_base(vcpu, msr_info);
2203 case APIC_BASE_MSR ... APIC_BASE_MSR + 0x3ff:
2204 return kvm_x2apic_msr_write(vcpu, msr, data);
2205 case MSR_IA32_TSCDEADLINE:
2206 kvm_set_lapic_tscdeadline_msr(vcpu, data);
2207 break;
2208 case MSR_IA32_TSC_ADJUST:
2209 if (guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_TSC_ADJUST)) {
2210 if (!msr_info->host_initiated) {
2211 s64 adj = data - vcpu->arch.ia32_tsc_adjust_msr;
2212 adjust_tsc_offset_guest(vcpu, adj);
2213 }
2214 vcpu->arch.ia32_tsc_adjust_msr = data;
2215 }
2216 break;
2217 case MSR_IA32_MISC_ENABLE:
2218 vcpu->arch.ia32_misc_enable_msr = data;
2219 break;
2220 case MSR_IA32_SMBASE:
2221 if (!msr_info->host_initiated)
2222 return 1;
2223 vcpu->arch.smbase = data;
2224 break;
2225 case MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK_NEW:
2226 case MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK:
2227 vcpu->kvm->arch.wall_clock = data;
2228 kvm_write_wall_clock(vcpu->kvm, data);
2229 break;
2230 case MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME_NEW:
2231 case MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME: {
2232 struct kvm_arch *ka = &vcpu->kvm->arch;
2233
2234 kvmclock_reset(vcpu);
2235
2236 if (vcpu->vcpu_id == 0 && !msr_info->host_initiated) {
2237 bool tmp = (msr == MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME);
2238
2239 if (ka->boot_vcpu_runs_old_kvmclock != tmp)
2240 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MASTERCLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
2241
2242 ka->boot_vcpu_runs_old_kvmclock = tmp;
2243 }
2244
2245 vcpu->arch.time = data;
2246 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_GLOBAL_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
2247
2248 /* we verify if the enable bit is set... */
2249 if (!(data & 1))
2250 break;
2251
2252 if (kvm_gfn_to_hva_cache_init(vcpu->kvm,
2253 &vcpu->arch.pv_time, data & ~1ULL,
2254 sizeof(struct pvclock_vcpu_time_info)))
2255 vcpu->arch.pv_time_enabled = false;
2256 else
2257 vcpu->arch.pv_time_enabled = true;
2258
2259 break;
2260 }
2261 case MSR_KVM_ASYNC_PF_EN:
2262 if (kvm_pv_enable_async_pf(vcpu, data))
2263 return 1;
2264 break;
2265 case MSR_KVM_STEAL_TIME:
2266
2267 if (unlikely(!sched_info_on()))
2268 return 1;
2269
2270 if (data & KVM_STEAL_RESERVED_MASK)
2271 return 1;
2272
2273 if (kvm_gfn_to_hva_cache_init(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2274 data & KVM_STEAL_VALID_BITS,
2275 sizeof(struct kvm_steal_time)))
2276 return 1;
2277
2278 vcpu->arch.st.msr_val = data;
2279
2280 if (!(data & KVM_MSR_ENABLED))
2281 break;
2282
2283 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_STEAL_UPDATE, vcpu);
2284
2285 break;
2286 case MSR_KVM_PV_EOI_EN:
2287 if (kvm_lapic_enable_pv_eoi(vcpu, data))
2288 return 1;
2289 break;
2290
2291 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CTL:
2292 case MSR_IA32_MCG_STATUS:
2293 case MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL ... MSR_IA32_MCx_CTL(KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS) - 1:
2294 return set_msr_mce(vcpu, msr, data);
2295
2296 case MSR_K7_PERFCTR0 ... MSR_K7_PERFCTR3:
2297 case MSR_P6_PERFCTR0 ... MSR_P6_PERFCTR1:
2298 pr = true; /* fall through */
2299 case MSR_K7_EVNTSEL0 ... MSR_K7_EVNTSEL3:
2300 case MSR_P6_EVNTSEL0 ... MSR_P6_EVNTSEL1:
2301 if (kvm_pmu_is_valid_msr(vcpu, msr))
2302 return kvm_pmu_set_msr(vcpu, msr_info);
2303
2304 if (pr || data != 0)
2305 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "disabled perfctr wrmsr: "
2306 "0x%x data 0x%llx\n", msr, data);
2307 break;
2308 case MSR_K7_CLK_CTL:
2309 /*
2310 * Ignore all writes to this no longer documented MSR.
2311 * Writes are only relevant for old K7 processors,
2312 * all pre-dating SVM, but a recommended workaround from
2313 * AMD for these chips. It is possible to specify the
2314 * affected processor models on the command line, hence
2315 * the need to ignore the workaround.
2316 */
2317 break;
2318 case HV_X64_MSR_GUEST_OS_ID ... HV_X64_MSR_SINT15:
2319 case HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P0 ... HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P4:
2320 case HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_CTL:
2321 case HV_X64_MSR_STIMER0_CONFIG ... HV_X64_MSR_STIMER3_COUNT:
2322 return kvm_hv_set_msr_common(vcpu, msr, data,
2323 msr_info->host_initiated);
2324 case MSR_IA32_BBL_CR_CTL3:
2325 /* Drop writes to this legacy MSR -- see rdmsr
2326 * counterpart for further detail.
2327 */
2328 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "ignored wrmsr: 0x%x data 0x%llx\n", msr, data);
2329 break;
2330 case MSR_AMD64_OSVW_ID_LENGTH:
2331 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_OSVW))
2332 return 1;
2333 vcpu->arch.osvw.length = data;
2334 break;
2335 case MSR_AMD64_OSVW_STATUS:
2336 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_OSVW))
2337 return 1;
2338 vcpu->arch.osvw.status = data;
2339 break;
2340 case MSR_PLATFORM_INFO:
2341 if (!msr_info->host_initiated ||
2342 data & ~MSR_PLATFORM_INFO_CPUID_FAULT ||
2343 (!(data & MSR_PLATFORM_INFO_CPUID_FAULT) &&
2344 cpuid_fault_enabled(vcpu)))
2345 return 1;
2346 vcpu->arch.msr_platform_info = data;
2347 break;
2348 case MSR_MISC_FEATURES_ENABLES:
2349 if (data & ~MSR_MISC_FEATURES_ENABLES_CPUID_FAULT ||
2350 (data & MSR_MISC_FEATURES_ENABLES_CPUID_FAULT &&
2351 !supports_cpuid_fault(vcpu)))
2352 return 1;
2353 vcpu->arch.msr_misc_features_enables = data;
2354 break;
2355 default:
2356 if (msr && (msr == vcpu->kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config.msr))
2357 return xen_hvm_config(vcpu, data);
2358 if (kvm_pmu_is_valid_msr(vcpu, msr))
2359 return kvm_pmu_set_msr(vcpu, msr_info);
2360 if (!ignore_msrs) {
2361 vcpu_debug_ratelimited(vcpu, "unhandled wrmsr: 0x%x data 0x%llx\n",
2362 msr, data);
2363 return 1;
2364 } else {
2365 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "ignored wrmsr: 0x%x data 0x%llx\n",
2366 msr, data);
2367 break;
2368 }
2369 }
2370 return 0;
2371}
2372EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_msr_common);
2373
2374
2375/*
2376 * Reads an msr value (of 'msr_index') into 'pdata'.
2377 * Returns 0 on success, non-0 otherwise.
2378 * Assumes vcpu_load() was already called.
2379 */
2380int kvm_get_msr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr)
2381{
2382 return kvm_x86_ops->get_msr(vcpu, msr);
2383}
2384EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_msr);
2385
2386static int get_msr_mce(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 msr, u64 *pdata)
2387{
2388 u64 data;
2389 u64 mcg_cap = vcpu->arch.mcg_cap;
2390 unsigned bank_num = mcg_cap & 0xff;
2391
2392 switch (msr) {
2393 case MSR_IA32_P5_MC_ADDR:
2394 case MSR_IA32_P5_MC_TYPE:
2395 data = 0;
2396 break;
2397 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CAP:
2398 data = vcpu->arch.mcg_cap;
2399 break;
2400 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CTL:
2401 if (!(mcg_cap & MCG_CTL_P))
2402 return 1;
2403 data = vcpu->arch.mcg_ctl;
2404 break;
2405 case MSR_IA32_MCG_STATUS:
2406 data = vcpu->arch.mcg_status;
2407 break;
2408 default:
2409 if (msr >= MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL &&
2410 msr < MSR_IA32_MCx_CTL(bank_num)) {
2411 u32 offset = msr - MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL;
2412 data = vcpu->arch.mce_banks[offset];
2413 break;
2414 }
2415 return 1;
2416 }
2417 *pdata = data;
2418 return 0;
2419}
2420
2421int kvm_get_msr_common(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct msr_data *msr_info)
2422{
2423 switch (msr_info->index) {
2424 case MSR_IA32_PLATFORM_ID:
2425 case MSR_IA32_EBL_CR_POWERON:
2426 case MSR_IA32_DEBUGCTLMSR:
2427 case MSR_IA32_LASTBRANCHFROMIP:
2428 case MSR_IA32_LASTBRANCHTOIP:
2429 case MSR_IA32_LASTINTFROMIP:
2430 case MSR_IA32_LASTINTTOIP:
2431 case MSR_K8_SYSCFG:
2432 case MSR_K8_TSEG_ADDR:
2433 case MSR_K8_TSEG_MASK:
2434 case MSR_K7_HWCR:
2435 case MSR_VM_HSAVE_PA:
2436 case MSR_K8_INT_PENDING_MSG:
2437 case MSR_AMD64_NB_CFG:
2438 case MSR_FAM10H_MMIO_CONF_BASE:
2439 case MSR_AMD64_BU_CFG2:
2440 case MSR_IA32_PERF_CTL:
2441 case MSR_AMD64_DC_CFG:
2442 msr_info->data = 0;
2443 break;
2444 case MSR_K7_EVNTSEL0 ... MSR_K7_EVNTSEL3:
2445 case MSR_K7_PERFCTR0 ... MSR_K7_PERFCTR3:
2446 case MSR_P6_PERFCTR0 ... MSR_P6_PERFCTR1:
2447 case MSR_P6_EVNTSEL0 ... MSR_P6_EVNTSEL1:
2448 if (kvm_pmu_is_valid_msr(vcpu, msr_info->index))
2449 return kvm_pmu_get_msr(vcpu, msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2450 msr_info->data = 0;
2451 break;
2452 case MSR_IA32_UCODE_REV:
2453 msr_info->data = 0x100000000ULL;
2454 break;
2455 case MSR_MTRRcap:
2456 case 0x200 ... 0x2ff:
2457 return kvm_mtrr_get_msr(vcpu, msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2458 case 0xcd: /* fsb frequency */
2459 msr_info->data = 3;
2460 break;
2461 /*
2462 * MSR_EBC_FREQUENCY_ID
2463 * Conservative value valid for even the basic CPU models.
2464 * Models 0,1: 000 in bits 23:21 indicating a bus speed of
2465 * 100MHz, model 2 000 in bits 18:16 indicating 100MHz,
2466 * and 266MHz for model 3, or 4. Set Core Clock
2467 * Frequency to System Bus Frequency Ratio to 1 (bits
2468 * 31:24) even though these are only valid for CPU
2469 * models > 2, however guests may end up dividing or
2470 * multiplying by zero otherwise.
2471 */
2472 case MSR_EBC_FREQUENCY_ID:
2473 msr_info->data = 1 << 24;
2474 break;
2475 case MSR_IA32_APICBASE:
2476 msr_info->data = kvm_get_apic_base(vcpu);
2477 break;
2478 case APIC_BASE_MSR ... APIC_BASE_MSR + 0x3ff:
2479 return kvm_x2apic_msr_read(vcpu, msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2480 break;
2481 case MSR_IA32_TSCDEADLINE:
2482 msr_info->data = kvm_get_lapic_tscdeadline_msr(vcpu);
2483 break;
2484 case MSR_IA32_TSC_ADJUST:
2485 msr_info->data = (u64)vcpu->arch.ia32_tsc_adjust_msr;
2486 break;
2487 case MSR_IA32_MISC_ENABLE:
2488 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.ia32_misc_enable_msr;
2489 break;
2490 case MSR_IA32_SMBASE:
2491 if (!msr_info->host_initiated)
2492 return 1;
2493 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.smbase;
2494 break;
2495 case MSR_IA32_PERF_STATUS:
2496 /* TSC increment by tick */
2497 msr_info->data = 1000ULL;
2498 /* CPU multiplier */
2499 msr_info->data |= (((uint64_t)4ULL) << 40);
2500 break;
2501 case MSR_EFER:
2502 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.efer;
2503 break;
2504 case MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK:
2505 case MSR_KVM_WALL_CLOCK_NEW:
2506 msr_info->data = vcpu->kvm->arch.wall_clock;
2507 break;
2508 case MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME:
2509 case MSR_KVM_SYSTEM_TIME_NEW:
2510 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.time;
2511 break;
2512 case MSR_KVM_ASYNC_PF_EN:
2513 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val;
2514 break;
2515 case MSR_KVM_STEAL_TIME:
2516 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.st.msr_val;
2517 break;
2518 case MSR_KVM_PV_EOI_EN:
2519 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.pv_eoi.msr_val;
2520 break;
2521 case MSR_IA32_P5_MC_ADDR:
2522 case MSR_IA32_P5_MC_TYPE:
2523 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CAP:
2524 case MSR_IA32_MCG_CTL:
2525 case MSR_IA32_MCG_STATUS:
2526 case MSR_IA32_MC0_CTL ... MSR_IA32_MCx_CTL(KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS) - 1:
2527 return get_msr_mce(vcpu, msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2528 case MSR_K7_CLK_CTL:
2529 /*
2530 * Provide expected ramp-up count for K7. All other
2531 * are set to zero, indicating minimum divisors for
2532 * every field.
2533 *
2534 * This prevents guest kernels on AMD host with CPU
2535 * type 6, model 8 and higher from exploding due to
2536 * the rdmsr failing.
2537 */
2538 msr_info->data = 0x20000000;
2539 break;
2540 case HV_X64_MSR_GUEST_OS_ID ... HV_X64_MSR_SINT15:
2541 case HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P0 ... HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_P4:
2542 case HV_X64_MSR_CRASH_CTL:
2543 case HV_X64_MSR_STIMER0_CONFIG ... HV_X64_MSR_STIMER3_COUNT:
2544 return kvm_hv_get_msr_common(vcpu,
2545 msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2546 break;
2547 case MSR_IA32_BBL_CR_CTL3:
2548 /* This legacy MSR exists but isn't fully documented in current
2549 * silicon. It is however accessed by winxp in very narrow
2550 * scenarios where it sets bit #19, itself documented as
2551 * a "reserved" bit. Best effort attempt to source coherent
2552 * read data here should the balance of the register be
2553 * interpreted by the guest:
2554 *
2555 * L2 cache control register 3: 64GB range, 256KB size,
2556 * enabled, latency 0x1, configured
2557 */
2558 msr_info->data = 0xbe702111;
2559 break;
2560 case MSR_AMD64_OSVW_ID_LENGTH:
2561 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_OSVW))
2562 return 1;
2563 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.osvw.length;
2564 break;
2565 case MSR_AMD64_OSVW_STATUS:
2566 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_OSVW))
2567 return 1;
2568 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.osvw.status;
2569 break;
2570 case MSR_PLATFORM_INFO:
2571 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.msr_platform_info;
2572 break;
2573 case MSR_MISC_FEATURES_ENABLES:
2574 msr_info->data = vcpu->arch.msr_misc_features_enables;
2575 break;
2576 default:
2577 if (kvm_pmu_is_valid_msr(vcpu, msr_info->index))
2578 return kvm_pmu_get_msr(vcpu, msr_info->index, &msr_info->data);
2579 if (!ignore_msrs) {
2580 vcpu_debug_ratelimited(vcpu, "unhandled rdmsr: 0x%x\n",
2581 msr_info->index);
2582 return 1;
2583 } else {
2584 vcpu_unimpl(vcpu, "ignored rdmsr: 0x%x\n", msr_info->index);
2585 msr_info->data = 0;
2586 }
2587 break;
2588 }
2589 return 0;
2590}
2591EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_msr_common);
2592
2593/*
2594 * Read or write a bunch of msrs. All parameters are kernel addresses.
2595 *
2596 * @return number of msrs set successfully.
2597 */
2598static int __msr_io(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_msrs *msrs,
2599 struct kvm_msr_entry *entries,
2600 int (*do_msr)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2601 unsigned index, u64 *data))
2602{
2603 int i, idx;
2604
2605 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
2606 for (i = 0; i < msrs->nmsrs; ++i)
2607 if (do_msr(vcpu, entries[i].index, &entries[i].data))
2608 break;
2609 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
2610
2611 return i;
2612}
2613
2614/*
2615 * Read or write a bunch of msrs. Parameters are user addresses.
2616 *
2617 * @return number of msrs set successfully.
2618 */
2619static int msr_io(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_msrs __user *user_msrs,
2620 int (*do_msr)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2621 unsigned index, u64 *data),
2622 int writeback)
2623{
2624 struct kvm_msrs msrs;
2625 struct kvm_msr_entry *entries;
2626 int r, n;
2627 unsigned size;
2628
2629 r = -EFAULT;
2630 if (copy_from_user(&msrs, user_msrs, sizeof msrs))
2631 goto out;
2632
2633 r = -E2BIG;
2634 if (msrs.nmsrs >= MAX_IO_MSRS)
2635 goto out;
2636
2637 size = sizeof(struct kvm_msr_entry) * msrs.nmsrs;
2638 entries = memdup_user(user_msrs->entries, size);
2639 if (IS_ERR(entries)) {
2640 r = PTR_ERR(entries);
2641 goto out;
2642 }
2643
2644 r = n = __msr_io(vcpu, &msrs, entries, do_msr);
2645 if (r < 0)
2646 goto out_free;
2647
2648 r = -EFAULT;
2649 if (writeback && copy_to_user(user_msrs->entries, entries, size))
2650 goto out_free;
2651
2652 r = n;
2653
2654out_free:
2655 kfree(entries);
2656out:
2657 return r;
2658}
2659
2660int kvm_vm_ioctl_check_extension(struct kvm *kvm, long ext)
2661{
2662 int r;
2663
2664 switch (ext) {
2665 case KVM_CAP_IRQCHIP:
2666 case KVM_CAP_HLT:
2667 case KVM_CAP_MMU_SHADOW_CACHE_CONTROL:
2668 case KVM_CAP_SET_TSS_ADDR:
2669 case KVM_CAP_EXT_CPUID:
2670 case KVM_CAP_EXT_EMUL_CPUID:
2671 case KVM_CAP_CLOCKSOURCE:
2672 case KVM_CAP_PIT:
2673 case KVM_CAP_NOP_IO_DELAY:
2674 case KVM_CAP_MP_STATE:
2675 case KVM_CAP_SYNC_MMU:
2676 case KVM_CAP_USER_NMI:
2677 case KVM_CAP_REINJECT_CONTROL:
2678 case KVM_CAP_IRQ_INJECT_STATUS:
2679 case KVM_CAP_IOEVENTFD:
2680 case KVM_CAP_IOEVENTFD_NO_LENGTH:
2681 case KVM_CAP_PIT2:
2682 case KVM_CAP_PIT_STATE2:
2683 case KVM_CAP_SET_IDENTITY_MAP_ADDR:
2684 case KVM_CAP_XEN_HVM:
2685 case KVM_CAP_VCPU_EVENTS:
2686 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV:
2687 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_VAPIC:
2688 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SPIN:
2689 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SYNIC:
2690 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SYNIC2:
2691 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_VP_INDEX:
2692 case KVM_CAP_PCI_SEGMENT:
2693 case KVM_CAP_DEBUGREGS:
2694 case KVM_CAP_X86_ROBUST_SINGLESTEP:
2695 case KVM_CAP_XSAVE:
2696 case KVM_CAP_ASYNC_PF:
2697 case KVM_CAP_GET_TSC_KHZ:
2698 case KVM_CAP_KVMCLOCK_CTRL:
2699 case KVM_CAP_READONLY_MEM:
2700 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_TIME:
2701 case KVM_CAP_IOAPIC_POLARITY_IGNORED:
2702 case KVM_CAP_TSC_DEADLINE_TIMER:
2703 case KVM_CAP_ENABLE_CAP_VM:
2704 case KVM_CAP_DISABLE_QUIRKS:
2705 case KVM_CAP_SET_BOOT_CPU_ID:
2706 case KVM_CAP_SPLIT_IRQCHIP:
2707 case KVM_CAP_IMMEDIATE_EXIT:
2708 r = 1;
2709 break;
2710 case KVM_CAP_ADJUST_CLOCK:
2711 r = KVM_CLOCK_TSC_STABLE;
2712 break;
2713 case KVM_CAP_X86_GUEST_MWAIT:
2714 r = kvm_mwait_in_guest();
2715 break;
2716 case KVM_CAP_X86_SMM:
2717 /* SMBASE is usually relocated above 1M on modern chipsets,
2718 * and SMM handlers might indeed rely on 4G segment limits,
2719 * so do not report SMM to be available if real mode is
2720 * emulated via vm86 mode. Still, do not go to great lengths
2721 * to avoid userspace's usage of the feature, because it is a
2722 * fringe case that is not enabled except via specific settings
2723 * of the module parameters.
2724 */
2725 r = kvm_x86_ops->has_emulated_msr(MSR_IA32_SMBASE);
2726 break;
2727 case KVM_CAP_VAPIC:
2728 r = !kvm_x86_ops->cpu_has_accelerated_tpr();
2729 break;
2730 case KVM_CAP_NR_VCPUS:
2731 r = KVM_SOFT_MAX_VCPUS;
2732 break;
2733 case KVM_CAP_MAX_VCPUS:
2734 r = KVM_MAX_VCPUS;
2735 break;
2736 case KVM_CAP_NR_MEMSLOTS:
2737 r = KVM_USER_MEM_SLOTS;
2738 break;
2739 case KVM_CAP_PV_MMU: /* obsolete */
2740 r = 0;
2741 break;
2742 case KVM_CAP_MCE:
2743 r = KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS;
2744 break;
2745 case KVM_CAP_XCRS:
2746 r = boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE);
2747 break;
2748 case KVM_CAP_TSC_CONTROL:
2749 r = kvm_has_tsc_control;
