2750 break;
2751 case KVM_CAP_X2APIC_API:
2752 r = KVM_X2APIC_API_VALID_FLAGS;
2753 break;
2754 default:
2755 r = 0;
2756 break;
2757 }
2758 return r;
2759
2760}
2761
2762long kvm_arch_dev_ioctl(struct file *filp,
2763 unsigned int ioctl, unsigned long arg)
2764{
2765 void __user *argp = (void __user *)arg;
2766 long r;
2767
2768 switch (ioctl) {
2769 case KVM_GET_MSR_INDEX_LIST: {
2770 struct kvm_msr_list __user *user_msr_list = argp;
2771 struct kvm_msr_list msr_list;
2772 unsigned n;
2773
2774 r = -EFAULT;
2775 if (copy_from_user(&msr_list, user_msr_list, sizeof msr_list))
2776 goto out;
2777 n = msr_list.nmsrs;
2778 msr_list.nmsrs = num_msrs_to_save + num_emulated_msrs;
2779 if (copy_to_user(user_msr_list, &msr_list, sizeof msr_list))
2780 goto out;
2781 r = -E2BIG;
2782 if (n < msr_list.nmsrs)
2783 goto out;
2784 r = -EFAULT;
2785 if (copy_to_user(user_msr_list->indices, &msrs_to_save,
2786 num_msrs_to_save * sizeof(u32)))
2787 goto out;
2788 if (copy_to_user(user_msr_list->indices + num_msrs_to_save,
2789 &emulated_msrs,
2790 num_emulated_msrs * sizeof(u32)))
2791 goto out;
2792 r = 0;
2793 break;
2794 }
2795 case KVM_GET_SUPPORTED_CPUID:
2796 case KVM_GET_EMULATED_CPUID: {
2797 struct kvm_cpuid2 __user *cpuid_arg = argp;
2798 struct kvm_cpuid2 cpuid;
2799
2800 r = -EFAULT;
2801 if (copy_from_user(&cpuid, cpuid_arg, sizeof cpuid))
2802 goto out;
2803
2804 r = kvm_dev_ioctl_get_cpuid(&cpuid, cpuid_arg->entries,
2805 ioctl);
2806 if (r)
2807 goto out;
2808
2809 r = -EFAULT;
2810 if (copy_to_user(cpuid_arg, &cpuid, sizeof cpuid))
2811 goto out;
2812 r = 0;
2813 break;
2814 }
2815 case KVM_X86_GET_MCE_CAP_SUPPORTED: {
2816 r = -EFAULT;
2817 if (copy_to_user(argp, &kvm_mce_cap_supported,
2818 sizeof(kvm_mce_cap_supported)))
2819 goto out;
2820 r = 0;
2821 break;
2822 }
2823 default:
2824 r = -EINVAL;
2825 }
2826out:
2827 return r;
2828}
2829
2830static void wbinvd_ipi(void *garbage)
2831{
2832 wbinvd();
2833}
2834
2835static bool need_emulate_wbinvd(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2836{
2837 return kvm_arch_has_noncoherent_dma(vcpu->kvm);
2838}
2839
2840void kvm_arch_vcpu_load(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int cpu)
2841{
2842 /* Address WBINVD may be executed by guest */
2843 if (need_emulate_wbinvd(vcpu)) {
2844 if (kvm_x86_ops->has_wbinvd_exit())
2845 cpumask_set_cpu(cpu, vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask);
2846 else if (vcpu->cpu != -1 && vcpu->cpu != cpu)
2847 smp_call_function_single(vcpu->cpu,
2848 wbinvd_ipi, NULL, 1);
2849 }
2850
2851 kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_load(vcpu, cpu);
2852
2853 /* Apply any externally detected TSC adjustments (due to suspend) */
2854 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.tsc_offset_adjustment)) {
2855 adjust_tsc_offset_host(vcpu, vcpu->arch.tsc_offset_adjustment);
2856 vcpu->arch.tsc_offset_adjustment = 0;
2857 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
2858 }
2859
2860 if (unlikely(vcpu->cpu != cpu) || check_tsc_unstable()) {
2861 s64 tsc_delta = !vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc ? 0 :
2862 rdtsc() - vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc;
2863 if (tsc_delta < 0)
2864 mark_tsc_unstable("KVM discovered backwards TSC");
2865
2866 if (check_tsc_unstable()) {
2867 u64 offset = kvm_compute_tsc_offset(vcpu,
2868 vcpu->arch.last_guest_tsc);
2869 kvm_vcpu_write_tsc_offset(vcpu, offset);
2870 vcpu->arch.tsc_catchup = 1;
2871 }
2872
2873 if (kvm_lapic_hv_timer_in_use(vcpu))
2874 kvm_lapic_restart_hv_timer(vcpu);
2875
2876 /*
2877 * On a host with synchronized TSC, there is no need to update
2878 * kvmclock on vcpu->cpu migration
2879 */
2880 if (!vcpu->kvm->arch.use_master_clock || vcpu->cpu == -1)
2881 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_GLOBAL_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
2882 if (vcpu->cpu != cpu)
2883 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MIGRATE_TIMER, vcpu);
2884 vcpu->cpu = cpu;
2885 }
2886
2887 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_STEAL_UPDATE, vcpu);
2888}
2889
2890static void kvm_steal_time_set_preempted(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2891{
2892 if (!(vcpu->arch.st.msr_val & KVM_MSR_ENABLED))
2893 return;
2894
2895 vcpu->arch.st.steal.preempted = 1;
2896
2897 kvm_write_guest_offset_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.st.stime,
2898 &vcpu->arch.st.steal.preempted,
2899 offsetof(struct kvm_steal_time, preempted),
2900 sizeof(vcpu->arch.st.steal.preempted));
2901}
2902
2903void kvm_arch_vcpu_put(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2904{
2905 int idx;
2906
2907 if (vcpu->preempted)
2908 vcpu->arch.preempted_in_kernel = !kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu);
2909
2910 /*
2911 * Disable page faults because we're in atomic context here.
2912 * kvm_write_guest_offset_cached() would call might_fault()
2913 * that relies on pagefault_disable() to tell if there's a
2914 * bug. NOTE: the write to guest memory may not go through if
2915 * during postcopy live migration or if there's heavy guest
2916 * paging.
2917 */
2918 pagefault_disable();
2919 /*
2920 * kvm_memslots() will be called by
2921 * kvm_write_guest_offset_cached() so take the srcu lock.
2922 */
2923 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
2924 kvm_steal_time_set_preempted(vcpu);
2925 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
2926 pagefault_enable();
2927 kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_put(vcpu);
2928 kvm_put_guest_fpu(vcpu);
2929 vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc = rdtsc();
2930 /*
2931 * If userspace has set any breakpoints or watchpoints, dr6 is restored
2932 * on every vmexit, but if not, we might have a stale dr6 from the
2933 * guest. do_debug expects dr6 to be cleared after it runs, do the same.
2934 */
2935 set_debugreg(0, 6);
2936}
2937
2938static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_get_lapic(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2939 struct kvm_lapic_state *s)
2940{
2941 if (kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr && vcpu->arch.apicv_active)
2942 kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr(vcpu);
2943
2944 return kvm_apic_get_state(vcpu, s);
2945}
2946
2947static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_set_lapic(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2948 struct kvm_lapic_state *s)
2949{
2950 int r;
2951
2952 r = kvm_apic_set_state(vcpu, s);
2953 if (r)
2954 return r;
2955 update_cr8_intercept(vcpu);
2956
2957 return 0;
2958}
2959
2960static int kvm_cpu_accept_dm_intr(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2961{
2962 return (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu) ||
2963 kvm_apic_accept_pic_intr(vcpu));
2964}
2965
2966/*
2967 * if userspace requested an interrupt window, check that the
2968 * interrupt window is open.
2969 *
2970 * No need to exit to userspace if we already have an interrupt queued.
2971 */
2972static int kvm_vcpu_ready_for_interrupt_injection(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
2973{
2974 return kvm_arch_interrupt_allowed(vcpu) &&
2975 !kvm_cpu_has_interrupt(vcpu) &&
2976 !kvm_event_needs_reinjection(vcpu) &&
2977 kvm_cpu_accept_dm_intr(vcpu);
2978}
2979
2980static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_interrupt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
2981 struct kvm_interrupt *irq)
2982{
2983 if (irq->irq >= KVM_NR_INTERRUPTS)
2984 return -EINVAL;
2985
2986 if (!irqchip_in_kernel(vcpu->kvm)) {
2987 kvm_queue_interrupt(vcpu, irq->irq, false);
2988 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
2989 return 0;
2990 }
2991
2992 /*
2993 * With in-kernel LAPIC, we only use this to inject EXTINT, so
2994 * fail for in-kernel 8259.
2995 */
2996 if (pic_in_kernel(vcpu->kvm))
2997 return -ENXIO;
2998
2999 if (vcpu->arch.pending_external_vector != -1)
3000 return -EEXIST;
3001
3002 vcpu->arch.pending_external_vector = irq->irq;
3003 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
3004 return 0;
3005}
3006
3007static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3008{
3009 kvm_inject_nmi(vcpu);
3010
3011 return 0;
3012}
3013
3014static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_smi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3015{
3016 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_SMI, vcpu);
3017
3018 return 0;
3019}
3020
3021static int vcpu_ioctl_tpr_access_reporting(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3022 struct kvm_tpr_access_ctl *tac)
3023{
3024 if (tac->flags)
3025 return -EINVAL;
3026 vcpu->arch.tpr_access_reporting = !!tac->enabled;
3027 return 0;
3028}
3029
3030static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_setup_mce(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3031 u64 mcg_cap)
3032{
3033 int r;
3034 unsigned bank_num = mcg_cap & 0xff, bank;
3035
3036 r = -EINVAL;
3037 if (!bank_num || bank_num >= KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS)
3038 goto out;
3039 if (mcg_cap & ~(kvm_mce_cap_supported | 0xff | 0xff0000))
3040 goto out;
3041 r = 0;
3042 vcpu->arch.mcg_cap = mcg_cap;
3043 /* Init IA32_MCG_CTL to all 1s */
3044 if (mcg_cap & MCG_CTL_P)
3045 vcpu->arch.mcg_ctl = ~(u64)0;
3046 /* Init IA32_MCi_CTL to all 1s */
3047 for (bank = 0; bank < bank_num; bank++)
3048 vcpu->arch.mce_banks[bank*4] = ~(u64)0;
3049
3050 if (kvm_x86_ops->setup_mce)
3051 kvm_x86_ops->setup_mce(vcpu);
3052out:
3053 return r;
3054}
3055
3056static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_mce(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3057 struct kvm_x86_mce *mce)
3058{
3059 u64 mcg_cap = vcpu->arch.mcg_cap;
3060 unsigned bank_num = mcg_cap & 0xff;
3061 u64 *banks = vcpu->arch.mce_banks;
3062
3063 if (mce->bank >= bank_num || !(mce->status & MCI_STATUS_VAL))
3064 return -EINVAL;
3065 /*
3066 * if IA32_MCG_CTL is not all 1s, the uncorrected error
3067 * reporting is disabled
3068 */
3069 if ((mce->status & MCI_STATUS_UC) && (mcg_cap & MCG_CTL_P) &&
3070 vcpu->arch.mcg_ctl != ~(u64)0)
3071 return 0;
3072 banks += 4 * mce->bank;
3073 /*
3074 * if IA32_MCi_CTL is not all 1s, the uncorrected error
3075 * reporting is disabled for the bank
3076 */
3077 if ((mce->status & MCI_STATUS_UC) && banks[0] != ~(u64)0)
3078 return 0;
3079 if (mce->status & MCI_STATUS_UC) {
3080 if ((vcpu->arch.mcg_status & MCG_STATUS_MCIP) ||
3081 !kvm_read_cr4_bits(vcpu, X86_CR4_MCE)) {
3082 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_TRIPLE_FAULT, vcpu);
3083 return 0;
3084 }
3085 if (banks[1] & MCI_STATUS_VAL)
3086 mce->status |= MCI_STATUS_OVER;
3087 banks[2] = mce->addr;
3088 banks[3] = mce->misc;
3089 vcpu->arch.mcg_status = mce->mcg_status;
3090 banks[1] = mce->status;
3091 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, MC_VECTOR);
3092 } else if (!(banks[1] & MCI_STATUS_VAL)
3093 || !(banks[1] & MCI_STATUS_UC)) {
3094 if (banks[1] & MCI_STATUS_VAL)
3095 mce->status |= MCI_STATUS_OVER;
3096 banks[2] = mce->addr;
3097 banks[3] = mce->misc;
3098 banks[1] = mce->status;
3099 } else
3100 banks[1] |= MCI_STATUS_OVER;
3101 return 0;
3102}
3103
3104static void kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_vcpu_events(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3105 struct kvm_vcpu_events *events)
3106{
3107 process_nmi(vcpu);
3108 /*
3109 * FIXME: pass injected and pending separately. This is only
3110 * needed for nested virtualization, whose state cannot be
3111 * migrated yet. For now we can combine them.
3112 */
3113 events->exception.injected =
3114 (vcpu->arch.exception.pending ||
3115 vcpu->arch.exception.injected) &&
3116 !kvm_exception_is_soft(vcpu->arch.exception.nr);
3117 events->exception.nr = vcpu->arch.exception.nr;
3118 events->exception.has_error_code = vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code;
3119 events->exception.pad = 0;
3120 events->exception.error_code = vcpu->arch.exception.error_code;
3121
3122 events->interrupt.injected =
3123 vcpu->arch.interrupt.pending && !vcpu->arch.interrupt.soft;
3124 events->interrupt.nr = vcpu->arch.interrupt.nr;
3125 events->interrupt.soft = 0;
3126 events->interrupt.shadow = kvm_x86_ops->get_interrupt_shadow(vcpu);
3127
3128 events->nmi.injected = vcpu->arch.nmi_injected;
3129 events->nmi.pending = vcpu->arch.nmi_pending != 0;
3130 events->nmi.masked = kvm_x86_ops->get_nmi_mask(vcpu);
3131 events->nmi.pad = 0;
3132
3133 events->sipi_vector = 0; /* never valid when reporting to user space */
3134
3135 events->smi.smm = is_smm(vcpu);
3136 events->smi.pending = vcpu->arch.smi_pending;
3137 events->smi.smm_inside_nmi =
3138 !!(vcpu->arch.hflags & HF_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK);
3139 events->smi.latched_init = kvm_lapic_latched_init(vcpu);
3140
3141 events->flags = (KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_NMI_PENDING
3142 | KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SHADOW
3143 | KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SMM);
3144 memset(&events->reserved, 0, sizeof(events->reserved));
3145}
3146
3147static void kvm_set_hflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned emul_flags);
3148
3149static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_vcpu_events(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3150 struct kvm_vcpu_events *events)
3151{
3152 if (events->flags & ~(KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_NMI_PENDING
3153 | KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SIPI_VECTOR
3154 | KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SHADOW
3155 | KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SMM))
3156 return -EINVAL;
3157
3158 if (events->exception.injected &&
3159 (events->exception.nr > 31 || events->exception.nr == NMI_VECTOR ||
3160 is_guest_mode(vcpu)))
3161 return -EINVAL;
3162
3163 /* INITs are latched while in SMM */
3164 if (events->flags & KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SMM &&
3165 (events->smi.smm || events->smi.pending) &&
3166 vcpu->arch.mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_INIT_RECEIVED)
3167 return -EINVAL;
3168
3169 process_nmi(vcpu);
3170 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = false;
3171 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = events->exception.injected;
3172 vcpu->arch.exception.nr = events->exception.nr;
3173 vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code = events->exception.has_error_code;
3174 vcpu->arch.exception.error_code = events->exception.error_code;
3175
3176 vcpu->arch.interrupt.pending = events->interrupt.injected;
3177 vcpu->arch.interrupt.nr = events->interrupt.nr;
3178 vcpu->arch.interrupt.soft = events->interrupt.soft;
3179 if (events->flags & KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SHADOW)
3180 kvm_x86_ops->set_interrupt_shadow(vcpu,
3181 events->interrupt.shadow);
3182
3183 vcpu->arch.nmi_injected = events->nmi.injected;
3184 if (events->flags & KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_NMI_PENDING)
3185 vcpu->arch.nmi_pending = events->nmi.pending;
3186 kvm_x86_ops->set_nmi_mask(vcpu, events->nmi.masked);
3187
3188 if (events->flags & KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SIPI_VECTOR &&
3189 lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
3190 vcpu->arch.apic->sipi_vector = events->sipi_vector;
3191
3192 if (events->flags & KVM_VCPUEVENT_VALID_SMM) {
3193 u32 hflags = vcpu->arch.hflags;
3194 if (events->smi.smm)
3195 hflags |= HF_SMM_MASK;
3196 else
3197 hflags &= ~HF_SMM_MASK;
3198 kvm_set_hflags(vcpu, hflags);
3199
3200 vcpu->arch.smi_pending = events->smi.pending;
3201
3202 if (events->smi.smm) {
3203 if (events->smi.smm_inside_nmi)
3204 vcpu->arch.hflags |= HF_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK;
3205 else
3206 vcpu->arch.hflags &= ~HF_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK;
3207 if (lapic_in_kernel(vcpu)) {
3208 if (events->smi.latched_init)
3209 set_bit(KVM_APIC_INIT, &vcpu->arch.apic->pending_events);
3210 else
3211 clear_bit(KVM_APIC_INIT, &vcpu->arch.apic->pending_events);
3212 }
3213 }
3214 }
3215
3216 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
3217
3218 return 0;
3219}
3220
3221static void kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_debugregs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3222 struct kvm_debugregs *dbgregs)
3223{
3224 unsigned long val;
3225
3226 memcpy(dbgregs->db, vcpu->arch.db, sizeof(vcpu->arch.db));
3227 kvm_get_dr(vcpu, 6, &val);
3228 dbgregs->dr6 = val;
3229 dbgregs->dr7 = vcpu->arch.dr7;
3230 dbgregs->flags = 0;
3231 memset(&dbgregs->reserved, 0, sizeof(dbgregs->reserved));
3232}
3233
3234static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_debugregs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3235 struct kvm_debugregs *dbgregs)
3236{
3237 if (dbgregs->flags)
3238 return -EINVAL;
3239
3240 if (dbgregs->dr6 & ~0xffffffffull)
3241 return -EINVAL;
3242 if (dbgregs->dr7 & ~0xffffffffull)
3243 return -EINVAL;
3244
3245 memcpy(vcpu->arch.db, dbgregs->db, sizeof(vcpu->arch.db));
3246 kvm_update_dr0123(vcpu);
3247 vcpu->arch.dr6 = dbgregs->dr6;
3248 kvm_update_dr6(vcpu);
3249 vcpu->arch.dr7 = dbgregs->dr7;
3250 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
3251
3252 return 0;
3253}
3254
3255#define XSTATE_COMPACTION_ENABLED (1ULL << 63)
3256
3257static void fill_xsave(u8 *dest, struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3258{
3259 struct xregs_state *xsave = &vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.xsave;
3260 u64 xstate_bv = xsave->header.xfeatures;
3261 u64 valid;
3262
3263 /*
3264 * Copy legacy XSAVE area, to avoid complications with CPUID
3265 * leaves 0 and 1 in the loop below.
3266 */
3267 memcpy(dest, xsave, XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET);
3268
3269 /* Set XSTATE_BV */
3270 xstate_bv &= vcpu->arch.guest_supported_xcr0 | XFEATURE_MASK_FPSSE;
3271 *(u64 *)(dest + XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET) = xstate_bv;
3272
3273 /*
3274 * Copy each region from the possibly compacted offset to the
3275 * non-compacted offset.
3276 */
3277 valid = xstate_bv & ~XFEATURE_MASK_FPSSE;
3278 while (valid) {
3279 u64 feature = valid & -valid;
3280 int index = fls64(feature) - 1;
3281 void *src = get_xsave_addr(xsave, feature);
3282
3283 if (src) {
3284 u32 size, offset, ecx, edx;
3285 cpuid_count(XSTATE_CPUID, index,
3286 &size, &offset, &ecx, &edx);
3287 if (feature == XFEATURE_MASK_PKRU)
3288 memcpy(dest + offset, &vcpu->arch.pkru,
3289 sizeof(vcpu->arch.pkru));
3290 else
3291 memcpy(dest + offset, src, size);
3292
3293 }
3294
3295 valid -= feature;
3296 }
3297}
3298
3299static void load_xsave(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u8 *src)
3300{
3301 struct xregs_state *xsave = &vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.xsave;
3302 u64 xstate_bv = *(u64 *)(src + XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET);
3303 u64 valid;
3304
3305 /*
3306 * Copy legacy XSAVE area, to avoid complications with CPUID
3307 * leaves 0 and 1 in the loop below.
3308 */
3309 memcpy(xsave, src, XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET);
3310
3311 /* Set XSTATE_BV and possibly XCOMP_BV. */
3312 xsave->header.xfeatures = xstate_bv;
3313 if (boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVES))
3314 xsave->header.xcomp_bv = host_xcr0 | XSTATE_COMPACTION_ENABLED;
3315
3316 /*
3317 * Copy each region from the non-compacted offset to the
3318 * possibly compacted offset.
3319 */
3320 valid = xstate_bv & ~XFEATURE_MASK_FPSSE;
3321 while (valid) {
3322 u64 feature = valid & -valid;
3323 int index = fls64(feature) - 1;
3324 void *dest = get_xsave_addr(xsave, feature);
3325
3326 if (dest) {
3327 u32 size, offset, ecx, edx;
3328 cpuid_count(XSTATE_CPUID, index,
3329 &size, &offset, &ecx, &edx);
3330 if (feature == XFEATURE_MASK_PKRU)
3331 memcpy(&vcpu->arch.pkru, src + offset,
3332 sizeof(vcpu->arch.pkru));
3333 else
3334 memcpy(dest, src + offset, size);
3335 }
3336
3337 valid -= feature;
3338 }
3339}
3340
3341static void kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_xsave(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3342 struct kvm_xsave *guest_xsave)
3343{
3344 if (boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE)) {
3345 memset(guest_xsave, 0, sizeof(struct kvm_xsave));
3346 fill_xsave((u8 *) guest_xsave->region, vcpu);
3347 } else {
3348 memcpy(guest_xsave->region,
3349 &vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.fxsave,
3350 sizeof(struct fxregs_state));
3351 *(u64 *)&guest_xsave->region[XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET / sizeof(u32)] =
3352 XFEATURE_MASK_FPSSE;
3353 }
3354}
3355
3356#define XSAVE_MXCSR_OFFSET 24
3357
3358static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_xsave(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3359 struct kvm_xsave *guest_xsave)
3360{
3361 u64 xstate_bv =
3362 *(u64 *)&guest_xsave->region[XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET / sizeof(u32)];
3363 u32 mxcsr = *(u32 *)&guest_xsave->region[XSAVE_MXCSR_OFFSET / sizeof(u32)];
3364
3365 if (boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE)) {
3366 /*
3367 * Here we allow setting states that are not present in
3368 * CPUID leaf 0xD, index 0, EDX:EAX. This is for compatibility
3369 * with old userspace.
3370 */
3371 if (xstate_bv & ~kvm_supported_xcr0() ||
3372 mxcsr & ~mxcsr_feature_mask)
3373 return -EINVAL;
3374 load_xsave(vcpu, (u8 *)guest_xsave->region);
3375 } else {
3376 if (xstate_bv & ~XFEATURE_MASK_FPSSE ||
3377 mxcsr & ~mxcsr_feature_mask)
3378 return -EINVAL;
3379 memcpy(&vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.fxsave,
3380 guest_xsave->region, sizeof(struct fxregs_state));
3381 }
3382 return 0;
3383}
3384
3385static void kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_xcrs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3386 struct kvm_xcrs *guest_xcrs)
3387{
3388 if (!boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE)) {
3389 guest_xcrs->nr_xcrs = 0;
3390 return;
3391 }
3392
3393 guest_xcrs->nr_xcrs = 1;
3394 guest_xcrs->flags = 0;
3395 guest_xcrs->xcrs[0].xcr = XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK;
3396 guest_xcrs->xcrs[0].value = vcpu->arch.xcr0;
3397}
3398
3399static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_xcrs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3400 struct kvm_xcrs *guest_xcrs)
3401{
3402 int i, r = 0;
3403
3404 if (!boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE))
3405 return -EINVAL;
3406
3407 if (guest_xcrs->nr_xcrs > KVM_MAX_XCRS || guest_xcrs->flags)
3408 return -EINVAL;
3409
3410 for (i = 0; i < guest_xcrs->nr_xcrs; i++)
3411 /* Only support XCR0 currently */
3412 if (guest_xcrs->xcrs[i].xcr == XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK) {
3413 r = __kvm_set_xcr(vcpu, XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK,
3414 guest_xcrs->xcrs[i].value);
3415 break;
3416 }
3417 if (r)
3418 r = -EINVAL;
3419 return r;
3420}
3421
3422/*
3423 * kvm_set_guest_paused() indicates to the guest kernel that it has been
3424 * stopped by the hypervisor. This function will be called from the host only.
3425 * EINVAL is returned when the host attempts to set the flag for a guest that
3426 * does not support pv clocks.
3427 */
3428static int kvm_set_guest_paused(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
3429{
3430 if (!vcpu->arch.pv_time_enabled)
3431 return -EINVAL;
3432 vcpu->arch.pvclock_set_guest_stopped_request = true;
3433 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
3434 return 0;
3435}
3436
3437static int kvm_vcpu_ioctl_enable_cap(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
3438 struct kvm_enable_cap *cap)
3439{
3440 if (cap->flags)
3441 return -EINVAL;
3442
3443 switch (cap->cap) {
3444 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SYNIC2:
3445 if (cap->args[0])
3446 return -EINVAL;
3447 case KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SYNIC:
3448 if (!irqchip_in_kernel(vcpu->kvm))
3449 return -EINVAL;
3450 return kvm_hv_activate_synic(vcpu, cap->cap ==
3451 KVM_CAP_HYPERV_SYNIC2);
3452 default:
3453 return -EINVAL;
3454 }
3455}
3456
3457long kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl(struct file *filp,
3458 unsigned int ioctl, unsigned long arg)
3459{
3460 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = filp->private_data;
3461 void __user *argp = (void __user *)arg;
3462 int r;
3463 union {
3464 struct kvm_lapic_state *lapic;
3465 struct kvm_xsave *xsave;
3466 struct kvm_xcrs *xcrs;
3467 void *buffer;
3468 } u;
3469
3470 u.buffer = NULL;
3471 switch (ioctl) {
3472 case KVM_GET_LAPIC: {
3473 r = -EINVAL;
3474 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
3475 goto out;
3476 u.lapic = kzalloc(sizeof(struct kvm_lapic_state), GFP_KERNEL);
3477
3478 r = -ENOMEM;
3479 if (!u.lapic)
3480 goto out;
3481 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_get_lapic(vcpu, u.lapic);
3482 if (r)
3483 goto out;
3484 r = -EFAULT;
3485 if (copy_to_user(argp, u.lapic, sizeof(struct kvm_lapic_state)))
3486 goto out;
3487 r = 0;
3488 break;
3489 }
3490 case KVM_SET_LAPIC: {
3491 r = -EINVAL;
3492 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
3493 goto out;
3494 u.lapic = memdup_user(argp, sizeof(*u.lapic));
3495 if (IS_ERR(u.lapic))
3496 return PTR_ERR(u.lapic);
3497
3498 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_set_lapic(vcpu, u.lapic);
3499 break;
3500 }
3501 case KVM_INTERRUPT: {
3502 struct kvm_interrupt irq;
3503
3504 r = -EFAULT;
3505 if (copy_from_user(&irq, argp, sizeof irq))
3506 goto out;
3507 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_interrupt(vcpu, &irq);
3508 break;
3509 }
3510 case KVM_NMI: {
3511 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_nmi(vcpu);
3512 break;
3513 }
3514 case KVM_SMI: {
3515 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_smi(vcpu);
3516 break;
3517 }
3518 case KVM_SET_CPUID: {
3519 struct kvm_cpuid __user *cpuid_arg = argp;
3520 struct kvm_cpuid cpuid;
3521
3522 r = -EFAULT;
3523 if (copy_from_user(&cpuid, cpuid_arg, sizeof cpuid))
3524 goto out;
3525 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_set_cpuid(vcpu, &cpuid, cpuid_arg->entries);
3526 break;
3527 }
3528 case KVM_SET_CPUID2: {
3529 struct kvm_cpuid2 __user *cpuid_arg = argp;
3530 struct kvm_cpuid2 cpuid;
3531
3532 r = -EFAULT;
3533 if (copy_from_user(&cpuid, cpuid_arg, sizeof cpuid))
3534 goto out;
3535 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_set_cpuid2(vcpu, &cpuid,
3536 cpuid_arg->entries);
3537 break;
3538 }
3539 case KVM_GET_CPUID2: {
3540 struct kvm_cpuid2 __user *cpuid_arg = argp;
3541 struct kvm_cpuid2 cpuid;
3542
3543 r = -EFAULT;
3544 if (copy_from_user(&cpuid, cpuid_arg, sizeof cpuid))
3545 goto out;
3546 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_get_cpuid2(vcpu, &cpuid,
3547 cpuid_arg->entries);
3548 if (r)
3549 goto out;
3550 r = -EFAULT;
3551 if (copy_to_user(cpuid_arg, &cpuid, sizeof cpuid))
3552 goto out;
3553 r = 0;
3554 break;
3555 }
3556 case KVM_GET_MSRS:
3557 r = msr_io(vcpu, argp, do_get_msr, 1);
3558 break;
3559 case KVM_SET_MSRS:
3560 r = msr_io(vcpu, argp, do_set_msr, 0);
3561 break;
3562 case KVM_TPR_ACCESS_REPORTING: {
3563 struct kvm_tpr_access_ctl tac;
3564
3565 r = -EFAULT;
3566 if (copy_from_user(&tac, argp, sizeof tac))
3567 goto out;
3568 r = vcpu_ioctl_tpr_access_reporting(vcpu, &tac);
3569 if (r)
3570 goto out;
3571 r = -EFAULT;
3572 if (copy_to_user(argp, &tac, sizeof tac))
3573 goto out;
3574 r = 0;
3575 break;
3576 };
3577 case KVM_SET_VAPIC_ADDR: {
3578 struct kvm_vapic_addr va;
3579 int idx;
3580
3581 r = -EINVAL;
3582 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
3583 goto out;
3584 r = -EFAULT;
3585 if (copy_from_user(&va, argp, sizeof va))
3586 goto out;
3587 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
3588 r = kvm_lapic_set_vapic_addr(vcpu, va.vapic_addr);
3589 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
3590 break;
3591 }
3592 case KVM_X86_SETUP_MCE: {
3593 u64 mcg_cap;
3594
3595 r = -EFAULT;
3596 if (copy_from_user(&mcg_cap, argp, sizeof mcg_cap))
3597 goto out;
3598 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_setup_mce(vcpu, mcg_cap);
3599 break;
3600 }
3601 case KVM_X86_SET_MCE: {
3602 struct kvm_x86_mce mce;
3603
3604 r = -EFAULT;
3605 if (copy_from_user(&mce, argp, sizeof mce))
3606 goto out;
3607 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_mce(vcpu, &mce);
3608 break;
3609 }
3610 case KVM_GET_VCPU_EVENTS: {
3611 struct kvm_vcpu_events events;
3612
3613 kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_vcpu_events(vcpu, &events);
3614
3615 r = -EFAULT;
3616 if (copy_to_user(argp, &events, sizeof(struct kvm_vcpu_events)))
3617 break;
3618 r = 0;
3619 break;
3620 }
3621 case KVM_SET_VCPU_EVENTS: {
3622 struct kvm_vcpu_events events;
3623
3624 r = -EFAULT;
3625 if (copy_from_user(&events, argp, sizeof(struct kvm_vcpu_events)))
3626 break;
3627
3628 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_vcpu_events(vcpu, &events);
3629 break;
3630 }
3631 case KVM_GET_DEBUGREGS: {
3632 struct kvm_debugregs dbgregs;
3633
3634 kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_debugregs(vcpu, &dbgregs);
3635
3636 r = -EFAULT;
3637 if (copy_to_user(argp, &dbgregs,
3638 sizeof(struct kvm_debugregs)))
3639 break;
3640 r = 0;
3641 break;
3642 }
3643 case KVM_SET_DEBUGREGS: {
3644 struct kvm_debugregs dbgregs;
3645
3646 r = -EFAULT;
3647 if (copy_from_user(&dbgregs, argp,
3648 sizeof(struct kvm_debugregs)))
3649 break;
3650
3651 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_debugregs(vcpu, &dbgregs);
3652 break;
3653 }
3654 case KVM_GET_XSAVE: {
3655 u.xsave = kzalloc(sizeof(struct kvm_xsave), GFP_KERNEL);
3656 r = -ENOMEM;
3657 if (!u.xsave)
3658 break;
3659
3660 kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_xsave(vcpu, u.xsave);
3661
3662 r = -EFAULT;
3663 if (copy_to_user(argp, u.xsave, sizeof(struct kvm_xsave)))
3664 break;
3665 r = 0;
3666 break;
3667 }
3668 case KVM_SET_XSAVE: {
3669 u.xsave = memdup_user(argp, sizeof(*u.xsave));
3670 if (IS_ERR(u.xsave))
3671 return PTR_ERR(u.xsave);
3672
3673 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_xsave(vcpu, u.xsave);
3674 break;
3675 }
3676 case KVM_GET_XCRS: {
3677 u.xcrs = kzalloc(sizeof(struct kvm_xcrs), GFP_KERNEL);
3678 r = -ENOMEM;
3679 if (!u.xcrs)
3680 break;
3681
3682 kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_get_xcrs(vcpu, u.xcrs);
3683
3684 r = -EFAULT;
3685 if (copy_to_user(argp, u.xcrs,
3686 sizeof(struct kvm_xcrs)))
3687 break;
3688 r = 0;
3689 break;
3690 }
3691 case KVM_SET_XCRS: {
3692 u.xcrs = memdup_user(argp, sizeof(*u.xcrs));
3693 if (IS_ERR(u.xcrs))
3694 return PTR_ERR(u.xcrs);
3695
3696 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_x86_set_xcrs(vcpu, u.xcrs);
3697 break;
3698 }
3699 case KVM_SET_TSC_KHZ: {
3700 u32 user_tsc_khz;
3701
3702 r = -EINVAL;
3703 user_tsc_khz = (u32)arg;
3704
3705 if (user_tsc_khz >= kvm_max_guest_tsc_khz)
3706 goto out;
3707
3708 if (user_tsc_khz == 0)
3709 user_tsc_khz = tsc_khz;
3710
3711 if (!kvm_set_tsc_khz(vcpu, user_tsc_khz))
3712 r = 0;
3713
3714 goto out;
3715 }
3716 case KVM_GET_TSC_KHZ: {
3717 r = vcpu->arch.virtual_tsc_khz;
3718 goto out;
3719 }
3720 case KVM_KVMCLOCK_CTRL: {
3721 r = kvm_set_guest_paused(vcpu);
3722 goto out;
3723 }
3724 case KVM_ENABLE_CAP: {
3725 struct kvm_enable_cap cap;
3726
3727 r = -EFAULT;
3728 if (copy_from_user(&cap, argp, sizeof(cap)))
3729 goto out;
3730 r = kvm_vcpu_ioctl_enable_cap(vcpu, &cap);
3731 break;
3732 }
3733 default:
3734 r = -EINVAL;
3735 }
3736out:
3737 kfree(u.buffer);
3738 return r;
3739}
3740
3741int kvm_arch_vcpu_fault(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct vm_fault *vmf)
3742{
3743 return VM_FAULT_SIGBUS;
3744}
3745
3746static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_tss_addr(struct kvm *kvm, unsigned long addr)
3747{
3748 int ret;
3749
3750 if (addr > (unsigned int)(-3 * PAGE_SIZE))
3751 return -EINVAL;
3752 ret = kvm_x86_ops->set_tss_addr(kvm, addr);
3753 return ret;
3754}
3755
3756static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_identity_map_addr(struct kvm *kvm,
3757 u64 ident_addr)
3758{
3759 kvm->arch.ept_identity_map_addr = ident_addr;
3760 return 0;
3761}
3762
3763static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_nr_mmu_pages(struct kvm *kvm,
3764 u32 kvm_nr_mmu_pages)
3765{
3766 if (kvm_nr_mmu_pages < KVM_MIN_ALLOC_MMU_PAGES)
3767 return -EINVAL;
3768
3769 mutex_lock(&kvm->slots_lock);
3770
3771 kvm_mmu_change_mmu_pages(kvm, kvm_nr_mmu_pages);
3772 kvm->arch.n_requested_mmu_pages = kvm_nr_mmu_pages;
3773
3774 mutex_unlock(&kvm->slots_lock);
3775 return 0;
3776}
3777
3778static int kvm_vm_ioctl_get_nr_mmu_pages(struct kvm *kvm)
3779{
3780 return kvm->arch.n_max_mmu_pages;
3781}
3782
3783static int kvm_vm_ioctl_get_irqchip(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_irqchip *chip)
3784{
3785 struct kvm_pic *pic = kvm->arch.vpic;
3786 int r;
3787
3788 r = 0;
3789 switch (chip->chip_id) {
3790 case KVM_IRQCHIP_PIC_MASTER:
3791 memcpy(&chip->chip.pic, &pic->pics[0],
3792 sizeof(struct kvm_pic_state));
3793 break;
3794 case KVM_IRQCHIP_PIC_SLAVE:
3795 memcpy(&chip->chip.pic, &pic->pics[1],
3796 sizeof(struct kvm_pic_state));
3797 break;
3798 case KVM_IRQCHIP_IOAPIC:
3799 kvm_get_ioapic(kvm, &chip->chip.ioapic);
3800 break;
3801 default:
3802 r = -EINVAL;
3803 break;
3804 }
3805 return r;
3806}
3807
3808static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_irqchip(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_irqchip *chip)
3809{
3810 struct kvm_pic *pic = kvm->arch.vpic;
3811 int r;
3812
3813 r = 0;
3814 switch (chip->chip_id) {
3815 case KVM_IRQCHIP_PIC_MASTER:
3816 spin_lock(&pic->lock);
3817 memcpy(&pic->pics[0], &chip->chip.pic,
3818 sizeof(struct kvm_pic_state));
3819 spin_unlock(&pic->lock);
3820 break;
3821 case KVM_IRQCHIP_PIC_SLAVE:
3822 spin_lock(&pic->lock);
3823 memcpy(&pic->pics[1], &chip->chip.pic,
3824 sizeof(struct kvm_pic_state));
3825 spin_unlock(&pic->lock);
3826 break;
3827 case KVM_IRQCHIP_IOAPIC:
3828 kvm_set_ioapic(kvm, &chip->chip.ioapic);
3829 break;
3830 default:
3831 r = -EINVAL;
3832 break;
3833 }
3834 kvm_pic_update_irq(pic);
3835 return r;
3836}
3837
3838static int kvm_vm_ioctl_get_pit(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_pit_state *ps)
3839{
3840 struct kvm_kpit_state *kps = &kvm->arch.vpit->pit_state;
3841
3842 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(*ps) != sizeof(kps->channels));
3843
3844 mutex_lock(&kps->lock);
3845 memcpy(ps, &kps->channels, sizeof(*ps));
3846 mutex_unlock(&kps->lock);
3847 return 0;
3848}
3849
3850static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_pit(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_pit_state *ps)
3851{
3852 int i;
3853 struct kvm_pit *pit = kvm->arch.vpit;
3854
3855 mutex_lock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3856 memcpy(&pit->pit_state.channels, ps, sizeof(*ps));
3857 for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
3858 kvm_pit_load_count(pit, i, ps->channels[i].count, 0);
3859 mutex_unlock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3860 return 0;
3861}
3862
3863static int kvm_vm_ioctl_get_pit2(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_pit_state2 *ps)
3864{
3865 mutex_lock(&kvm->arch.vpit->pit_state.lock);
3866 memcpy(ps->channels, &kvm->arch.vpit->pit_state.channels,
3867 sizeof(ps->channels));
3868 ps->flags = kvm->arch.vpit->pit_state.flags;
3869 mutex_unlock(&kvm->arch.vpit->pit_state.lock);
3870 memset(&ps->reserved, 0, sizeof(ps->reserved));
3871 return 0;
3872}
3873
3874static int kvm_vm_ioctl_set_pit2(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_pit_state2 *ps)
3875{
3876 int start = 0;
3877 int i;
3878 u32 prev_legacy, cur_legacy;
3879 struct kvm_pit *pit = kvm->arch.vpit;
3880
3881 mutex_lock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3882 prev_legacy = pit->pit_state.flags & KVM_PIT_FLAGS_HPET_LEGACY;
3883 cur_legacy = ps->flags & KVM_PIT_FLAGS_HPET_LEGACY;
3884 if (!prev_legacy && cur_legacy)
3885 start = 1;
3886 memcpy(&pit->pit_state.channels, &ps->channels,
3887 sizeof(pit->pit_state.channels));
3888 pit->pit_state.flags = ps->flags;
3889 for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
3890 kvm_pit_load_count(pit, i, pit->pit_state.channels[i].count,
3891 start && i == 0);
3892 mutex_unlock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3893 return 0;
3894}
3895
3896static int kvm_vm_ioctl_reinject(struct kvm *kvm,
3897 struct kvm_reinject_control *control)
3898{
3899 struct kvm_pit *pit = kvm->arch.vpit;
3900
3901 if (!pit)
3902 return -ENXIO;
3903
3904 /* pit->pit_state.lock was overloaded to prevent userspace from getting
3905 * an inconsistent state after running multiple KVM_REINJECT_CONTROL
3906 * ioctls in parallel. Use a separate lock if that ioctl isn't rare.
3907 */
3908 mutex_lock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3909 kvm_pit_set_reinject(pit, control->pit_reinject);
3910 mutex_unlock(&pit->pit_state.lock);
3911
3912 return 0;
3913}
3914
3915/**
3916 * kvm_vm_ioctl_get_dirty_log - get and clear the log of dirty pages in a slot
3917 * @kvm: kvm instance
3918 * @log: slot id and address to which we copy the log
3919 *
3920 * Steps 1-4 below provide general overview of dirty page logging. See
3921 * kvm_get_dirty_log_protect() function description for additional details.
3922 *
3923 * We call kvm_get_dirty_log_protect() to handle steps 1-3, upon return we
3924 * always flush the TLB (step 4) even if previous step failed and the dirty
3925 * bitmap may be corrupt. Regardless of previous outcome the KVM logging API
3926 * does not preclude user space subsequent dirty log read. Flushing TLB ensures
3927 * writes will be marked dirty for next log read.
3928 *
3929 * 1. Take a snapshot of the bit and clear it if needed.
3930 * 2. Write protect the corresponding page.
3931 * 3. Copy the snapshot to the userspace.
3932 * 4. Flush TLB's if needed.
3933 */
3934int kvm_vm_ioctl_get_dirty_log(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_dirty_log *log)
3935{
3936 bool is_dirty = false;
3937 int r;
3938
3939 mutex_lock(&kvm->slots_lock);
3940
3941 /*
3942 * Flush potentially hardware-cached dirty pages to dirty_bitmap.
3943 */
3944 if (kvm_x86_ops->flush_log_dirty)
3945 kvm_x86_ops->flush_log_dirty(kvm);
3946
3947 r = kvm_get_dirty_log_protect(kvm, log, &is_dirty);
3948
3949 /*
3950 * All the TLBs can be flushed out of mmu lock, see the comments in
3951 * kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access().
3952 */
3953 lockdep_assert_held(&kvm->slots_lock);
3954 if (is_dirty)
3955 kvm_flush_remote_tlbs(kvm);
3956
3957 mutex_unlock(&kvm->slots_lock);
3958 return r;
3959}
3960
3961int kvm_vm_ioctl_irq_line(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_irq_level *irq_event,
3962 bool line_status)
3963{
3964 if (!irqchip_in_kernel(kvm))
3965 return -ENXIO;
3966
3967 irq_event->status = kvm_set_irq(kvm, KVM_USERSPACE_IRQ_SOURCE_ID,
3968 irq_event->irq, irq_event->level,
3969 line_status);
3970 return 0;
3971}
3972
3973static int kvm_vm_ioctl_enable_cap(struct kvm *kvm,
3974 struct kvm_enable_cap *cap)
3975{
3976 int r;
3977
3978 if (cap->flags)
3979 return -EINVAL;
3980
3981 switch (cap->cap) {
3982 case KVM_CAP_DISABLE_QUIRKS:
3983 kvm->arch.disabled_quirks = cap->args[0];
3984 r = 0;
3985 break;
3986 case KVM_CAP_SPLIT_IRQCHIP: {
3987 mutex_lock(&kvm->lock);
3988 r = -EINVAL;
3989 if (cap->args[0] > MAX_NR_RESERVED_IOAPIC_PINS)
3990 goto split_irqchip_unlock;
3991 r = -EEXIST;
3992 if (irqchip_in_kernel(kvm))
3993 goto split_irqchip_unlock;
3994 if (kvm->created_vcpus)
3995 goto split_irqchip_unlock;
3996 r = kvm_setup_empty_irq_routing(kvm);
3997 if (r)
3998 goto split_irqchip_unlock;
3999 /* Pairs with irqchip_in_kernel. */
4000 smp_wmb();
4001 kvm->arch.irqchip_mode = KVM_IRQCHIP_SPLIT;
4002 kvm->arch.nr_reserved_ioapic_pins = cap->args[0];
4003 r = 0;
4004split_irqchip_unlock:
4005 mutex_unlock(&kvm->lock);
4006 break;
4007 }
4008 case KVM_CAP_X2APIC_API:
4009 r = -EINVAL;
4010 if (cap->args[0] & ~KVM_X2APIC_API_VALID_FLAGS)
4011 break;
4012
4013 if (cap->args[0] & KVM_X2APIC_API_USE_32BIT_IDS)
4014 kvm->arch.x2apic_format = true;
4015 if (cap->args[0] & KVM_X2APIC_API_DISABLE_BROADCAST_QUIRK)
4016 kvm->arch.x2apic_broadcast_quirk_disabled = true;
4017
4018 r = 0;
4019 break;
4020 default:
4021 r = -EINVAL;
4022 break;
4023 }
4024 return r;
4025}
4026
4027long kvm_arch_vm_ioctl(struct file *filp,
4028 unsigned int ioctl, unsigned long arg)
4029{
4030 struct kvm *kvm = filp->private_data;
4031 void __user *argp = (void __user *)arg;
4032 int r = -ENOTTY;
4033 /*
4034 * This union makes it completely explicit to gcc-3.x
4035 * that these two variables' stack usage should be
4036 * combined, not added together.
4037 */
4038 union {
4039 struct kvm_pit_state ps;
4040 struct kvm_pit_state2 ps2;
4041 struct kvm_pit_config pit_config;
4042 } u;
4043
4044 switch (ioctl) {
4045 case KVM_SET_TSS_ADDR:
4046 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_tss_addr(kvm, arg);
4047 break;
4048 case KVM_SET_IDENTITY_MAP_ADDR: {
4049 u64 ident_addr;
4050
4051 r = -EFAULT;
4052 if (copy_from_user(&ident_addr, argp, sizeof ident_addr))
4053 goto out;
4054 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_identity_map_addr(kvm, ident_addr);
4055 break;
4056 }
4057 case KVM_SET_NR_MMU_PAGES:
4058 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_nr_mmu_pages(kvm, arg);
4059 break;
4060 case KVM_GET_NR_MMU_PAGES:
4061 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_get_nr_mmu_pages(kvm);
4062 break;
4063 case KVM_CREATE_IRQCHIP: {
4064 mutex_lock(&kvm->lock);
4065
4066 r = -EEXIST;
4067 if (irqchip_in_kernel(kvm))
4068 goto create_irqchip_unlock;
4069
4070 r = -EINVAL;
4071 if (kvm->created_vcpus)
4072 goto create_irqchip_unlock;
4073
4074 r = kvm_pic_init(kvm);
4075 if (r)
4076 goto create_irqchip_unlock;
4077
4078 r = kvm_ioapic_init(kvm);
4079 if (r) {
4080 kvm_pic_destroy(kvm);
4081 goto create_irqchip_unlock;
4082 }
4083
4084 r = kvm_setup_default_irq_routing(kvm);
4085 if (r) {
4086 kvm_ioapic_destroy(kvm);
4087 kvm_pic_destroy(kvm);
4088 goto create_irqchip_unlock;
4089 }
4090 /* Write kvm->irq_routing before enabling irqchip_in_kernel. */
4091 smp_wmb();
4092 kvm->arch.irqchip_mode = KVM_IRQCHIP_KERNEL;
4093 create_irqchip_unlock:
4094 mutex_unlock(&kvm->lock);
4095 break;
4096 }
4097 case KVM_CREATE_PIT:
4098 u.pit_config.flags = KVM_PIT_SPEAKER_DUMMY;
4099 goto create_pit;
4100 case KVM_CREATE_PIT2:
4101 r = -EFAULT;
4102 if (copy_from_user(&u.pit_config, argp,
4103 sizeof(struct kvm_pit_config)))
4104 goto out;
4105 create_pit:
4106 mutex_lock(&kvm->lock);
4107 r = -EEXIST;
4108 if (kvm->arch.vpit)
4109 goto create_pit_unlock;
4110 r = -ENOMEM;
4111 kvm->arch.vpit = kvm_create_pit(kvm, u.pit_config.flags);
4112 if (kvm->arch.vpit)
4113 r = 0;
4114 create_pit_unlock:
4115 mutex_unlock(&kvm->lock);
4116 break;
4117 case KVM_GET_IRQCHIP: {
4118 /* 0: PIC master, 1: PIC slave, 2: IOAPIC */
4119 struct kvm_irqchip *chip;
4120
4121 chip = memdup_user(argp, sizeof(*chip));
4122 if (IS_ERR(chip)) {
4123 r = PTR_ERR(chip);
4124 goto out;
4125 }
4126
4127 r = -ENXIO;
4128 if (!irqchip_kernel(kvm))
4129 goto get_irqchip_out;
4130 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_get_irqchip(kvm, chip);
4131 if (r)
4132 goto get_irqchip_out;
4133 r = -EFAULT;
4134 if (copy_to_user(argp, chip, sizeof *chip))
4135 goto get_irqchip_out;
4136 r = 0;
4137 get_irqchip_out:
4138 kfree(chip);
4139 break;
4140 }
4141 case KVM_SET_IRQCHIP: {
4142 /* 0: PIC master, 1: PIC slave, 2: IOAPIC */
4143 struct kvm_irqchip *chip;
4144
4145 chip = memdup_user(argp, sizeof(*chip));
4146 if (IS_ERR(chip)) {
4147 r = PTR_ERR(chip);
4148 goto out;
4149 }
4150
4151 r = -ENXIO;
4152 if (!irqchip_kernel(kvm))
4153 goto set_irqchip_out;
4154 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_irqchip(kvm, chip);
4155 if (r)
4156 goto set_irqchip_out;
4157 r = 0;
4158 set_irqchip_out:
4159 kfree(chip);
4160 break;
4161 }
4162 case KVM_GET_PIT: {
4163 r = -EFAULT;
4164 if (copy_from_user(&u.ps, argp, sizeof(struct kvm_pit_state)))
4165 goto out;
4166 r = -ENXIO;
4167 if (!kvm->arch.vpit)
4168 goto out;
4169 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_get_pit(kvm, &u.ps);
4170 if (r)
4171 goto out;
4172 r = -EFAULT;
4173 if (copy_to_user(argp, &u.ps, sizeof(struct kvm_pit_state)))
4174 goto out;
4175 r = 0;
4176 break;
4177 }
4178 case KVM_SET_PIT: {
4179 r = -EFAULT;
4180 if (copy_from_user(&u.ps, argp, sizeof u.ps))
4181 goto out;
4182 r = -ENXIO;
4183 if (!kvm->arch.vpit)
4184 goto out;
4185 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_pit(kvm, &u.ps);
4186 break;
4187 }
4188 case KVM_GET_PIT2: {
4189 r = -ENXIO;
4190 if (!kvm->arch.vpit)
4191 goto out;
4192 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_get_pit2(kvm, &u.ps2);
4193 if (r)
4194 goto out;
4195 r = -EFAULT;
4196 if (copy_to_user(argp, &u.ps2, sizeof(u.ps2)))
4197 goto out;
4198 r = 0;
4199 break;
4200 }
4201 case KVM_SET_PIT2: {
4202 r = -EFAULT;
4203 if (copy_from_user(&u.ps2, argp, sizeof(u.ps2)))
4204 goto out;
4205 r = -ENXIO;
4206 if (!kvm->arch.vpit)
4207 goto out;
4208 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_set_pit2(kvm, &u.ps2);
4209 break;
4210 }
4211 case KVM_REINJECT_CONTROL: {
4212 struct kvm_reinject_control control;
4213 r = -EFAULT;
4214 if (copy_from_user(&control, argp, sizeof(control)))
4215 goto out;
4216 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_reinject(kvm, &control);
4217 break;
4218 }
4219 case KVM_SET_BOOT_CPU_ID:
4220 r = 0;
4221 mutex_lock(&kvm->lock);
4222 if (kvm->created_vcpus)
4223 r = -EBUSY;
4224 else
4225 kvm->arch.bsp_vcpu_id = arg;
4226 mutex_unlock(&kvm->lock);
4227 break;
4228 case KVM_XEN_HVM_CONFIG: {
4229 struct kvm_xen_hvm_config xhc;
4230 r = -EFAULT;
4231 if (copy_from_user(&xhc, argp, sizeof(xhc)))
4232 goto out;
4233 r = -EINVAL;
4234 if (xhc.flags)
4235 goto out;
4236 memcpy(&kvm->arch.xen_hvm_config, &xhc, sizeof(xhc));
4237 r = 0;
4238 break;
4239 }
4240 case KVM_SET_CLOCK: {
4241 struct kvm_clock_data user_ns;
4242 u64 now_ns;
4243
4244 r = -EFAULT;
4245 if (copy_from_user(&user_ns, argp, sizeof(user_ns)))
4246 goto out;
4247
4248 r = -EINVAL;
4249 if (user_ns.flags)
4250 goto out;
4251
4252 r = 0;
4253 /*
4254 * TODO: userspace has to take care of races with VCPU_RUN, so
4255 * kvm_gen_update_masterclock() can be cut down to locked
4256 * pvclock_update_vm_gtod_copy().
4257 */
4258 kvm_gen_update_masterclock(kvm);
4259 now_ns = get_kvmclock_ns(kvm);
4260 kvm->arch.kvmclock_offset += user_ns.clock - now_ns;
4261 kvm_make_all_cpus_request(kvm, KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE);
4262 break;
4263 }
4264 case KVM_GET_CLOCK: {
4265 struct kvm_clock_data user_ns;
4266 u64 now_ns;
4267
4268 now_ns = get_kvmclock_ns(kvm);
4269 user_ns.clock = now_ns;
4270 user_ns.flags = kvm->arch.use_master_clock ? KVM_CLOCK_TSC_STABLE : 0;
4271 memset(&user_ns.pad, 0, sizeof(user_ns.pad));
4272
4273 r = -EFAULT;
4274 if (copy_to_user(argp, &user_ns, sizeof(user_ns)))
4275 goto out;
4276 r = 0;
4277 break;
4278 }
4279 case KVM_ENABLE_CAP: {
4280 struct kvm_enable_cap cap;
4281
4282 r = -EFAULT;
4283 if (copy_from_user(&cap, argp, sizeof(cap)))
4284 goto out;
4285 r = kvm_vm_ioctl_enable_cap(kvm, &cap);
4286 break;
4287 }
4288 default:
4289 r = -ENOTTY;
4290 }
4291out:
4292 return r;
4293}
4294
4295static void kvm_init_msr_list(void)
4296{
4297 u32 dummy[2];
4298 unsigned i, j;
4299
4300 for (i = j = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(msrs_to_save); i++) {
4301 if (rdmsr_safe(msrs_to_save[i], &dummy[0], &dummy[1]) < 0)
4302 continue;
4303
4304 /*
4305 * Even MSRs that are valid in the host may not be exposed
4306 * to the guests in some cases.
4307 */
4308 switch (msrs_to_save[i]) {
4309 case MSR_IA32_BNDCFGS:
4310 if (!kvm_x86_ops->mpx_supported())
4311 continue;
4312 break;
4313 case MSR_TSC_AUX:
4314 if (!kvm_x86_ops->rdtscp_supported())
4315 continue;
4316 break;
4317 default:
4318 break;
4319 }
4320
4321 if (j < i)
4322 msrs_to_save[j] = msrs_to_save[i];
4323 j++;
4324 }
4325 num_msrs_to_save = j;
4326
4327 for (i = j = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(emulated_msrs); i++) {
4328 if (!kvm_x86_ops->has_emulated_msr(emulated_msrs[i]))
4329 continue;
4330
4331 if (j < i)
4332 emulated_msrs[j] = emulated_msrs[i];
4333 j++;
4334 }
4335 num_emulated_msrs = j;
4336}
4337
4338static int vcpu_mmio_write(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t addr, int len,
4339 const void *v)
4340{
4341 int handled = 0;
4342 int n;
4343
4344 do {
4345 n = min(len, 8);
4346 if (!(lapic_in_kernel(vcpu) &&
4347 !kvm_iodevice_write(vcpu, &vcpu->arch.apic->dev, addr, n, v))
4348 && kvm_io_bus_write(vcpu, KVM_MMIO_BUS, addr, n, v))
4349 break;
4350 handled += n;
4351 addr += n;
4352 len -= n;
4353 v += n;
4354 } while (len);
4355
4356 return handled;
4357}
4358
4359static int vcpu_mmio_read(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t addr, int len, void *v)
4360{
4361 int handled = 0;
4362 int n;
4363
4364 do {
4365 n = min(len, 8);
4366 if (!(lapic_in_kernel(vcpu) &&
4367 !kvm_iodevice_read(vcpu, &vcpu->arch.apic->dev,
4368 addr, n, v))
4369 && kvm_io_bus_read(vcpu, KVM_MMIO_BUS, addr, n, v))
4370 break;
4371 trace_kvm_mmio(KVM_TRACE_MMIO_READ, n, addr, v);
4372 handled += n;
4373 addr += n;
4374 len -= n;
4375 v += n;
4376 } while (len);
4377
4378 return handled;
4379}
4380
4381static void kvm_set_segment(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4382 struct kvm_segment *var, int seg)
4383{
4384 kvm_x86_ops->set_segment(vcpu, var, seg);
4385}
4386
4387void kvm_get_segment(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4388 struct kvm_segment *var, int seg)
4389{
4390 kvm_x86_ops->get_segment(vcpu, var, seg);
4391}
4392
4393gpa_t translate_nested_gpa(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa, u32 access,
4394 struct x86_exception *exception)
4395{
4396 gpa_t t_gpa;
4397
4398 BUG_ON(!mmu_is_nested(vcpu));
4399
4400 /* NPT walks are always user-walks */
4401 access |= PFERR_USER_MASK;
4402 t_gpa = vcpu->arch.mmu.gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gpa, access, exception);
4403
4404 return t_gpa;
4405}
4406
4407gpa_t kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_read(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva,
4408 struct x86_exception *exception)
4409{
4410 u32 access = (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0;
4411 return vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gva, access, exception);
4412}
4413
4414 gpa_t kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_fetch(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva,
4415 struct x86_exception *exception)
4416{
4417 u32 access = (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0;
4418 access |= PFERR_FETCH_MASK;
4419 return vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gva, access, exception);
4420}
4421
4422gpa_t kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_write(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva,
4423 struct x86_exception *exception)
4424{
4425 u32 access = (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0;
4426 access |= PFERR_WRITE_MASK;
4427 return vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gva, access, exception);
4428}
4429
4430/* uses this to access any guest's mapped memory without checking CPL */
4431gpa_t kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_system(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t gva,
4432 struct x86_exception *exception)
4433{
4434 return vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gva, 0, exception);
4435}
4436
4437static int kvm_read_guest_virt_helper(gva_t addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4438 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 access,
4439 struct x86_exception *exception)
4440{
4441 void *data = val;
4442 int r = X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4443
4444 while (bytes) {
4445 gpa_t gpa = vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, addr, access,
4446 exception);
4447 unsigned offset = addr & (PAGE_SIZE-1);
4448 unsigned toread = min(bytes, (unsigned)PAGE_SIZE - offset);
4449 int ret;
4450
4451 if (gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA)
4452 return X86EMUL_PROPAGATE_FAULT;
4453 ret = kvm_vcpu_read_guest_page(vcpu, gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT, data,
4454 offset, toread);
4455 if (ret < 0) {
4456 r = X86EMUL_IO_NEEDED;
4457 goto out;
4458 }
4459
4460 bytes -= toread;
4461 data += toread;
4462 addr += toread;
4463 }
4464out:
4465 return r;
4466}
4467
4468/* used for instruction fetching */
4469static int kvm_fetch_guest_virt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4470 gva_t addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4471 struct x86_exception *exception)
4472{
4473 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4474 u32 access = (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0;
4475 unsigned offset;
4476 int ret;
4477
4478 /* Inline kvm_read_guest_virt_helper for speed. */
4479 gpa_t gpa = vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, addr, access|PFERR_FETCH_MASK,
4480 exception);
4481 if (unlikely(gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA))
4482 return X86EMUL_PROPAGATE_FAULT;
4483
4484 offset = addr & (PAGE_SIZE-1);
4485 if (WARN_ON(offset + bytes > PAGE_SIZE))
4486 bytes = (unsigned)PAGE_SIZE - offset;
4487 ret = kvm_vcpu_read_guest_page(vcpu, gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT, val,
4488 offset, bytes);
4489 if (unlikely(ret < 0))
4490 return X86EMUL_IO_NEEDED;
4491
4492 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4493}
4494
4495int kvm_read_guest_virt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4496 gva_t addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4497 struct x86_exception *exception)
4498{
4499 u32 access = (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0;
4500
4501 return kvm_read_guest_virt_helper(addr, val, bytes, vcpu, access,
4502 exception);
4503}
4504EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_read_guest_virt);
4505
4506static int emulator_read_std(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4507 gva_t addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4508 struct x86_exception *exception, bool system)
4509{
4510 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4511 u32 access = 0;
4512
4513 if (!system && kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3)
4514 access |= PFERR_USER_MASK;
4515
4516 return kvm_read_guest_virt_helper(addr, val, bytes, vcpu, access, exception);
4517}
4518
4519static int kvm_read_guest_phys_system(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4520 unsigned long addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes)
4521{
4522 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4523 int r = kvm_vcpu_read_guest(vcpu, addr, val, bytes);
4524
4525 return r < 0 ? X86EMUL_IO_NEEDED : X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4526}
4527
4528static int kvm_write_guest_virt_helper(gva_t addr, void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4529 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 access,
4530 struct x86_exception *exception)
4531{
4532 void *data = val;
4533 int r = X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4534
4535 while (bytes) {
4536 gpa_t gpa = vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, addr,
4537 access,
4538 exception);
4539 unsigned offset = addr & (PAGE_SIZE-1);
4540 unsigned towrite = min(bytes, (unsigned)PAGE_SIZE - offset);
4541 int ret;
4542
4543 if (gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA)
4544 return X86EMUL_PROPAGATE_FAULT;
4545 ret = kvm_vcpu_write_guest(vcpu, gpa, data, towrite);
4546 if (ret < 0) {
4547 r = X86EMUL_IO_NEEDED;
4548 goto out;
4549 }
4550
4551 bytes -= towrite;
4552 data += towrite;
4553 addr += towrite;
4554 }
4555out:
4556 return r;
4557}
4558
4559static int emulator_write_std(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, gva_t addr, void *val,
4560 unsigned int bytes, struct x86_exception *exception,
4561 bool system)
4562{
4563 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4564 u32 access = PFERR_WRITE_MASK;
4565
4566 if (!system && kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3)
4567 access |= PFERR_USER_MASK;
4568
4569 return kvm_write_guest_virt_helper(addr, val, bytes, vcpu,
4570 access, exception);
4571}
4572
4573int kvm_write_guest_virt_system(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t addr, void *val,
4574 unsigned int bytes, struct x86_exception *exception)
4575{
4576 return kvm_write_guest_virt_helper(addr, val, bytes, vcpu,
4577 PFERR_WRITE_MASK, exception);
4578}
4579EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_write_guest_virt_system);
4580
4581static int vcpu_is_mmio_gpa(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long gva,
4582 gpa_t gpa, bool write)
4583{
4584 /* For APIC access vmexit */
4585 if ((gpa & PAGE_MASK) == APIC_DEFAULT_PHYS_BASE)
4586 return 1;
4587
4588 if (vcpu_match_mmio_gpa(vcpu, gpa)) {
4589 trace_vcpu_match_mmio(gva, gpa, write, true);
4590 return 1;
4591 }
4592
4593 return 0;
4594}
4595
4596static int vcpu_mmio_gva_to_gpa(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long gva,
4597 gpa_t *gpa, struct x86_exception *exception,
4598 bool write)
4599{
4600 u32 access = ((kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 3) ? PFERR_USER_MASK : 0)
4601 | (write ? PFERR_WRITE_MASK : 0);
4602
4603 /*
4604 * currently PKRU is only applied to ept enabled guest so
4605 * there is no pkey in EPT page table for L1 guest or EPT
4606 * shadow page table for L2 guest.
4607 */
4608 if (vcpu_match_mmio_gva(vcpu, gva)
4609 && !permission_fault(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu,
4610 vcpu->arch.access, 0, access)) {
4611 *gpa = vcpu->arch.mmio_gfn << PAGE_SHIFT |
4612 (gva & (PAGE_SIZE - 1));
4613 trace_vcpu_match_mmio(gva, *gpa, write, false);
4614 return 1;
4615 }
4616
4617 *gpa = vcpu->arch.walk_mmu->gva_to_gpa(vcpu, gva, access, exception);
4618
4619 if (*gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA)
4620 return -1;
4621
4622 return vcpu_is_mmio_gpa(vcpu, gva, *gpa, write);
4623}
4624
4625int emulator_write_phys(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4626 const void *val, int bytes)
4627{
4628 int ret;
4629
4630 ret = kvm_vcpu_write_guest(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes);
4631 if (ret < 0)
4632 return 0;
4633 kvm_page_track_write(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes);
4634 return 1;
4635}
4636
4637struct read_write_emulator_ops {
4638 int (*read_write_prepare)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, void *val,
4639 int bytes);
4640 int (*read_write_emulate)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4641 void *val, int bytes);
4642 int (*read_write_mmio)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4643 int bytes, void *val);
4644 int (*read_write_exit_mmio)(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4645 void *val, int bytes);
4646 bool write;
4647};
4648
4649static int read_prepare(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, void *val, int bytes)
4650{
4651 if (vcpu->mmio_read_completed) {
4652 trace_kvm_mmio(KVM_TRACE_MMIO_READ, bytes,
4653 vcpu->mmio_fragments[0].gpa, val);
4654 vcpu->mmio_read_completed = 0;
4655 return 1;
4656 }
4657
4658 return 0;
4659}
4660
4661static int read_emulate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4662 void *val, int bytes)
4663{
4664 return !kvm_vcpu_read_guest(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes);
4665}
4666
4667static int write_emulate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4668 void *val, int bytes)
4669{
4670 return emulator_write_phys(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes);
4671}
4672
4673static int write_mmio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa, int bytes, void *val)
4674{
4675 trace_kvm_mmio(KVM_TRACE_MMIO_WRITE, bytes, gpa, val);
4676 return vcpu_mmio_write(vcpu, gpa, bytes, val);
4677}
4678
4679static int read_exit_mmio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4680 void *val, int bytes)
4681{
4682 trace_kvm_mmio(KVM_TRACE_MMIO_READ_UNSATISFIED, bytes, gpa, NULL);
4683 return X86EMUL_IO_NEEDED;
4684}
4685
4686static int write_exit_mmio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t gpa,
4687 void *val, int bytes)
4688{
4689 struct kvm_mmio_fragment *frag = &vcpu->mmio_fragments[0];
4690
4691 memcpy(vcpu->run->mmio.data, frag->data, min(8u, frag->len));
4692 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4693}
4694
4695static const struct read_write_emulator_ops read_emultor = {
4696 .read_write_prepare = read_prepare,
4697 .read_write_emulate = read_emulate,
4698 .read_write_mmio = vcpu_mmio_read,
4699 .read_write_exit_mmio = read_exit_mmio,
4700};
4701
4702static const struct read_write_emulator_ops write_emultor = {
4703 .read_write_emulate = write_emulate,
4704 .read_write_mmio = write_mmio,
4705 .read_write_exit_mmio = write_exit_mmio,
4706 .write = true,
4707};
4708
4709static int emulator_read_write_onepage(unsigned long addr, void *val,
4710 unsigned int bytes,
4711 struct x86_exception *exception,
4712 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
4713 const struct read_write_emulator_ops *ops)
4714{
4715 gpa_t gpa;
4716 int handled, ret;
4717 bool write = ops->write;
4718 struct kvm_mmio_fragment *frag;
4719 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
4720
4721 /*
4722 * If the exit was due to a NPF we may already have a GPA.
4723 * If the GPA is present, use it to avoid the GVA to GPA table walk.
4724 * Note, this cannot be used on string operations since string
4725 * operation using rep will only have the initial GPA from the NPF
4726 * occurred.
4727 */
4728 if (vcpu->arch.gpa_available &&
4729 emulator_can_use_gpa(ctxt) &&
4730 (addr & ~PAGE_MASK) == (vcpu->arch.gpa_val & ~PAGE_MASK)) {
4731 gpa = vcpu->arch.gpa_val;
4732 ret = vcpu_is_mmio_gpa(vcpu, addr, gpa, write);
4733 } else {
4734 ret = vcpu_mmio_gva_to_gpa(vcpu, addr, &gpa, exception, write);
4735 if (ret < 0)
4736 return X86EMUL_PROPAGATE_FAULT;
4737 }
4738
4739 if (!ret && ops->read_write_emulate(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes))
4740 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4741
4742 /*
4743 * Is this MMIO handled locally?
4744 */
4745 handled = ops->read_write_mmio(vcpu, gpa, bytes, val);
4746 if (handled == bytes)
4747 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4748
4749 gpa += handled;
4750 bytes -= handled;
4751 val += handled;
4752
4753 WARN_ON(vcpu->mmio_nr_fragments >= KVM_MAX_MMIO_FRAGMENTS);
4754 frag = &vcpu->mmio_fragments[vcpu->mmio_nr_fragments++];
4755 frag->gpa = gpa;
4756 frag->data = val;
4757 frag->len = bytes;
4758 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4759}
4760
4761static int emulator_read_write(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4762 unsigned long addr,
4763 void *val, unsigned int bytes,
4764 struct x86_exception *exception,
4765 const struct read_write_emulator_ops *ops)
4766{
4767 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4768 gpa_t gpa;
4769 int rc;
4770
4771 if (ops->read_write_prepare &&
4772 ops->read_write_prepare(vcpu, val, bytes))
4773 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4774
4775 vcpu->mmio_nr_fragments = 0;
4776
4777 /* Crossing a page boundary? */
4778 if (((addr + bytes - 1) ^ addr) & PAGE_MASK) {
4779 int now;
4780
4781 now = -addr & ~PAGE_MASK;
4782 rc = emulator_read_write_onepage(addr, val, now, exception,
4783 vcpu, ops);
4784
4785 if (rc != X86EMUL_CONTINUE)
4786 return rc;
4787 addr += now;
4788 if (ctxt->mode != X86EMUL_MODE_PROT64)
4789 addr = (u32)addr;
4790 val += now;
4791 bytes -= now;
4792 }
4793
4794 rc = emulator_read_write_onepage(addr, val, bytes, exception,
4795 vcpu, ops);
4796 if (rc != X86EMUL_CONTINUE)
4797 return rc;
4798
4799 if (!vcpu->mmio_nr_fragments)
4800 return rc;
4801
4802 gpa = vcpu->mmio_fragments[0].gpa;
4803
4804 vcpu->mmio_needed = 1;
4805 vcpu->mmio_cur_fragment = 0;
4806
4807 vcpu->run->mmio.len = min(8u, vcpu->mmio_fragments[0].len);
4808 vcpu->run->mmio.is_write = vcpu->mmio_is_write = ops->write;
4809 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_MMIO;
4810 vcpu->run->mmio.phys_addr = gpa;
4811
4812 return ops->read_write_exit_mmio(vcpu, gpa, val, bytes);
4813}
4814
4815static int emulator_read_emulated(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4816 unsigned long addr,
4817 void *val,
4818 unsigned int bytes,
4819 struct x86_exception *exception)
4820{
4821 return emulator_read_write(ctxt, addr, val, bytes,
4822 exception, &read_emultor);
4823}
4824
4825static int emulator_write_emulated(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4826 unsigned long addr,
4827 const void *val,
4828 unsigned int bytes,
4829 struct x86_exception *exception)
4830{
4831 return emulator_read_write(ctxt, addr, (void *)val, bytes,
4832 exception, &write_emultor);
4833}
4834
4835#define CMPXCHG_TYPE(t, ptr, old, new) \
4836 (cmpxchg((t *)(ptr), *(t *)(old), *(t *)(new)) == *(t *)(old))
4837
4838#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
4839# define CMPXCHG64(ptr, old, new) CMPXCHG_TYPE(u64, ptr, old, new)
4840#else
4841# define CMPXCHG64(ptr, old, new) \
4842 (cmpxchg64((u64 *)(ptr), *(u64 *)(old), *(u64 *)(new)) == *(u64 *)(old))
4843#endif
4844
4845static int emulator_cmpxchg_emulated(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4846 unsigned long addr,
4847 const void *old,
4848 const void *new,
4849 unsigned int bytes,
4850 struct x86_exception *exception)
4851{
4852 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4853 gpa_t gpa;
4854 struct page *page;
4855 char *kaddr;
4856 bool exchanged;
4857
4858 /* guests cmpxchg8b have to be emulated atomically */
4859 if (bytes > 8 || (bytes & (bytes - 1)))
4860 goto emul_write;
4861
4862 gpa = kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_write(vcpu, addr, NULL);
4863
4864 if (gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA ||
4865 (gpa & PAGE_MASK) == APIC_DEFAULT_PHYS_BASE)
4866 goto emul_write;
4867
4868 if (((gpa + bytes - 1) & PAGE_MASK) != (gpa & PAGE_MASK))
4869 goto emul_write;
4870
4871 page = kvm_vcpu_gfn_to_page(vcpu, gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4872 if (is_error_page(page))
4873 goto emul_write;
4874
4875 kaddr = kmap_atomic(page);
4876 kaddr += offset_in_page(gpa);
4877 switch (bytes) {
4878 case 1:
4879 exchanged = CMPXCHG_TYPE(u8, kaddr, old, new);
4880 break;
4881 case 2:
4882 exchanged = CMPXCHG_TYPE(u16, kaddr, old, new);
4883 break;
4884 case 4:
4885 exchanged = CMPXCHG_TYPE(u32, kaddr, old, new);
4886 break;
4887 case 8:
4888 exchanged = CMPXCHG64(kaddr, old, new);
4889 break;
4890 default:
4891 BUG();
4892 }
4893 kunmap_atomic(kaddr);
4894 kvm_release_page_dirty(page);
4895
4896 if (!exchanged)
4897 return X86EMUL_CMPXCHG_FAILED;
4898
4899 kvm_vcpu_mark_page_dirty(vcpu, gpa >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4900 kvm_page_track_write(vcpu, gpa, new, bytes);
4901
4902 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
4903
4904emul_write:
4905 printk_once(KERN_WARNING "kvm: emulating exchange as write\n");
4906
4907 return emulator_write_emulated(ctxt, addr, new, bytes, exception);
4908}
4909
4910static int kernel_pio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, void *pd)
4911{
4912 int r = 0, i;
4913
4914 for (i = 0; i < vcpu->arch.pio.count; i++) {
4915 if (vcpu->arch.pio.in)
4916 r = kvm_io_bus_read(vcpu, KVM_PIO_BUS, vcpu->arch.pio.port,
4917 vcpu->arch.pio.size, pd);
4918 else
4919 r = kvm_io_bus_write(vcpu, KVM_PIO_BUS,
4920 vcpu->arch.pio.port, vcpu->arch.pio.size,
4921 pd);
4922 if (r)
4923 break;
4924 pd += vcpu->arch.pio.size;
4925 }
4926 return r;
4927}
4928
4929static int emulator_pio_in_out(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int size,
4930 unsigned short port, void *val,
4931 unsigned int count, bool in)
4932{
4933 vcpu->arch.pio.port = port;
4934 vcpu->arch.pio.in = in;
4935 vcpu->arch.pio.count = count;
4936 vcpu->arch.pio.size = size;
4937
4938 if (!kernel_pio(vcpu, vcpu->arch.pio_data)) {
4939 vcpu->arch.pio.count = 0;
4940 return 1;
4941 }
4942
4943 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_IO;
4944 vcpu->run->io.direction = in ? KVM_EXIT_IO_IN : KVM_EXIT_IO_OUT;
4945 vcpu->run->io.size = size;
4946 vcpu->run->io.data_offset = KVM_PIO_PAGE_OFFSET * PAGE_SIZE;
4947 vcpu->run->io.count = count;
4948 vcpu->run->io.port = port;
4949
4950 return 0;
4951}
4952
4953static int emulator_pio_in_emulated(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4954 int size, unsigned short port, void *val,
4955 unsigned int count)
4956{
4957 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4958 int ret;
4959
4960 if (vcpu->arch.pio.count)
4961 goto data_avail;
4962
4963 memset(vcpu->arch.pio_data, 0, size * count);
4964
4965 ret = emulator_pio_in_out(vcpu, size, port, val, count, true);
4966 if (ret) {
4967data_avail:
4968 memcpy(val, vcpu->arch.pio_data, size * count);
4969 trace_kvm_pio(KVM_PIO_IN, port, size, count, vcpu->arch.pio_data);
4970 vcpu->arch.pio.count = 0;
4971 return 1;
4972 }
4973
4974 return 0;
4975}
4976
4977static int emulator_pio_out_emulated(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
4978 int size, unsigned short port,
4979 const void *val, unsigned int count)
4980{
4981 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
4982
4983 memcpy(vcpu->arch.pio_data, val, size * count);
4984 trace_kvm_pio(KVM_PIO_OUT, port, size, count, vcpu->arch.pio_data);
4985 return emulator_pio_in_out(vcpu, size, port, (void *)val, count, false);
4986}
4987
4988static unsigned long get_segment_base(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int seg)
4989{
4990 return kvm_x86_ops->get_segment_base(vcpu, seg);
4991}
4992
4993static void emulator_invlpg(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, ulong address)
4994{
4995 kvm_mmu_invlpg(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), address);
4996}
4997
4998static int kvm_emulate_wbinvd_noskip(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
4999{
5000 if (!need_emulate_wbinvd(vcpu))
5001 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
5002
5003 if (kvm_x86_ops->has_wbinvd_exit()) {
5004 int cpu = get_cpu();
5005
5006 cpumask_set_cpu(cpu, vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask);
5007 smp_call_function_many(vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask,
5008 wbinvd_ipi, NULL, 1);
5009 put_cpu();
5010 cpumask_clear(vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask);
5011 } else
5012 wbinvd();
5013 return X86EMUL_CONTINUE;
5014}
5015
5016int kvm_emulate_wbinvd(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5017{
5018 kvm_emulate_wbinvd_noskip(vcpu);
5019 return kvm_skip_emulated_instruction(vcpu);
5020}
5021EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_emulate_wbinvd);
5022
5023
5024
5025static void emulator_wbinvd(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5026{
5027 kvm_emulate_wbinvd_noskip(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt));
5028}
5029
5030static int emulator_get_dr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, int dr,
5031 unsigned long *dest)
5032{
5033 return kvm_get_dr(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dr, dest);
5034}
5035
5036static int emulator_set_dr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, int dr,
5037 unsigned long value)
5038{
5039
5040 return __kvm_set_dr(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dr, value);
5041}
5042
5043static u64 mk_cr_64(u64 curr_cr, u32 new_val)
5044{
5045 return (curr_cr & ~((1ULL << 32) - 1)) | new_val;
5046}
5047
5048static unsigned long emulator_get_cr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, int cr)
5049{
5050 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5051 unsigned long value;
5052
5053 switch (cr) {
5054 case 0:
5055 value = kvm_read_cr0(vcpu);
5056 break;
5057 case 2:
5058 value = vcpu->arch.cr2;
5059 break;
5060 case 3:
5061 value = kvm_read_cr3(vcpu);
5062 break;
5063 case 4:
5064 value = kvm_read_cr4(vcpu);
5065 break;
5066 case 8:
5067 value = kvm_get_cr8(vcpu);
5068 break;
5069 default:
5070 kvm_err("%s: unexpected cr %u\n", __func__, cr);
5071 return 0;
5072 }
5073
5074 return value;
5075}
5076
5077static int emulator_set_cr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, int cr, ulong val)
5078{
5079 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5080 int res = 0;
5081
5082 switch (cr) {
5083 case 0:
5084 res = kvm_set_cr0(vcpu, mk_cr_64(kvm_read_cr0(vcpu), val));
5085 break;
5086 case 2:
5087 vcpu->arch.cr2 = val;
5088 break;
5089 case 3:
5090 res = kvm_set_cr3(vcpu, val);
5091 break;
5092 case 4:
5093 res = kvm_set_cr4(vcpu, mk_cr_64(kvm_read_cr4(vcpu), val));
5094 break;
5095 case 8:
5096 res = kvm_set_cr8(vcpu, val);
5097 break;
5098 default:
5099 kvm_err("%s: unexpected cr %u\n", __func__, cr);
5100 res = -1;
5101 }
5102
5103 return res;
5104}
5105
5106static int emulator_get_cpl(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5107{
5108 return kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt));
5109}
5110
5111static void emulator_get_gdt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, struct desc_ptr *dt)
5112{
5113 kvm_x86_ops->get_gdt(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dt);
5114}
5115
5116static void emulator_get_idt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, struct desc_ptr *dt)
5117{
5118 kvm_x86_ops->get_idt(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dt);
5119}
5120
5121static void emulator_set_gdt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, struct desc_ptr *dt)
5122{
5123 kvm_x86_ops->set_gdt(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dt);
5124}
5125
5126static void emulator_set_idt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, struct desc_ptr *dt)
5127{
5128 kvm_x86_ops->set_idt(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), dt);
5129}
5130
5131static unsigned long emulator_get_cached_segment_base(
5132 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, int seg)
5133{
5134 return get_segment_base(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), seg);
5135}
5136
5137static bool emulator_get_segment(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, u16 *selector,
5138 struct desc_struct *desc, u32 *base3,
5139 int seg)
5140{
5141 struct kvm_segment var;
5142
5143 kvm_get_segment(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), &var, seg);
5144 *selector = var.selector;
5145
5146 if (var.unusable) {
5147 memset(desc, 0, sizeof(*desc));
5148 if (base3)
5149 *base3 = 0;
5150 return false;
5151 }
5152
5153 if (var.g)
5154 var.limit >>= 12;
5155 set_desc_limit(desc, var.limit);
5156 set_desc_base(desc, (unsigned long)var.base);
5157#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
5158 if (base3)
5159 *base3 = var.base >> 32;
5160#endif
5161 desc->type = var.type;
5162 desc->s = var.s;
5163 desc->dpl = var.dpl;
5164 desc->p = var.present;
5165 desc->avl = var.avl;
5166 desc->l = var.l;
5167 desc->d = var.db;
5168 desc->g = var.g;
5169
5170 return true;
5171}
5172
5173static void emulator_set_segment(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, u16 selector,
5174 struct desc_struct *desc, u32 base3,
5175 int seg)
5176{
5177 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5178 struct kvm_segment var;
5179
5180 var.selector = selector;
5181 var.base = get_desc_base(desc);
5182#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
5183 var.base |= ((u64)base3) << 32;
5184#endif
5185 var.limit = get_desc_limit(desc);
5186 if (desc->g)
5187 var.limit = (var.limit << 12) | 0xfff;
5188 var.type = desc->type;
5189 var.dpl = desc->dpl;
5190 var.db = desc->d;
5191 var.s = desc->s;
5192 var.l = desc->l;
5193 var.g = desc->g;
5194 var.avl = desc->avl;
5195 var.present = desc->p;
5196 var.unusable = !var.present;
5197 var.padding = 0;
5198
5199 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &var, seg);
5200 return;
5201}
5202
5203static int emulator_get_msr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5204 u32 msr_index, u64 *pdata)
5205{
5206 struct msr_data msr;
5207 int r;
5208
5209 msr.index = msr_index;
5210 msr.host_initiated = false;
5211 r = kvm_get_msr(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), &msr);
5212 if (r)
5213 return r;
5214
5215 *pdata = msr.data;
5216 return 0;
5217}
5218
5219static int emulator_set_msr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5220 u32 msr_index, u64 data)
5221{
5222 struct msr_data msr;
5223
5224 msr.data = data;
5225 msr.index = msr_index;
5226 msr.host_initiated = false;
5227 return kvm_set_msr(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), &msr);
5228}
5229
5230static u64 emulator_get_smbase(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5231{
5232 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5233
5234 return vcpu->arch.smbase;
5235}
5236
5237static void emulator_set_smbase(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, u64 smbase)
5238{
5239 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5240
5241 vcpu->arch.smbase = smbase;
5242}
5243
5244static int emulator_check_pmc(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5245 u32 pmc)
5246{
5247 return kvm_pmu_is_valid_msr_idx(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), pmc);
5248}
5249
5250static int emulator_read_pmc(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5251 u32 pmc, u64 *pdata)
5252{
5253 return kvm_pmu_rdpmc(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), pmc, pdata);
5254}
5255
5256static void emulator_halt(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5257{
5258 emul_to_vcpu(ctxt)->arch.halt_request = 1;
5259}
5260
5261static void emulator_get_fpu(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5262{
5263 preempt_disable();
5264 kvm_load_guest_fpu(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt));
5265}
5266
5267static void emulator_put_fpu(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5268{
5269 preempt_enable();
5270}
5271
5272static int emulator_intercept(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5273 struct x86_instruction_info *info,
5274 enum x86_intercept_stage stage)
5275{
5276 return kvm_x86_ops->check_intercept(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), info, stage);
5277}
5278
5279static bool emulator_get_cpuid(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5280 u32 *eax, u32 *ebx, u32 *ecx, u32 *edx, bool check_limit)
5281{
5282 return kvm_cpuid(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), eax, ebx, ecx, edx, check_limit);
5283}
5284
5285static ulong emulator_read_gpr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, unsigned reg)
5286{
5287 return kvm_register_read(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), reg);
5288}
5289
5290static void emulator_write_gpr(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, unsigned reg, ulong val)
5291{
5292 kvm_register_write(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), reg, val);
5293}
5294
5295static void emulator_set_nmi_mask(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, bool masked)
5296{
5297 kvm_x86_ops->set_nmi_mask(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), masked);
5298}
5299
5300static unsigned emulator_get_hflags(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
5301{
5302 return emul_to_vcpu(ctxt)->arch.hflags;
5303}
5304
5305static void emulator_set_hflags(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt, unsigned emul_flags)
5306{
5307 kvm_set_hflags(emul_to_vcpu(ctxt), emul_flags);
5308}
5309
5310static const struct x86_emulate_ops emulate_ops = {
5311 .read_gpr = emulator_read_gpr,
5312 .write_gpr = emulator_write_gpr,
5313 .read_std = emulator_read_std,
5314 .write_std = emulator_write_std,
5315 .read_phys = kvm_read_guest_phys_system,
5316 .fetch = kvm_fetch_guest_virt,
5317 .read_emulated = emulator_read_emulated,
5318 .write_emulated = emulator_write_emulated,
5319 .cmpxchg_emulated = emulator_cmpxchg_emulated,
5320 .invlpg = emulator_invlpg,
5321 .pio_in_emulated = emulator_pio_in_emulated,
5322 .pio_out_emulated = emulator_pio_out_emulated,
5323 .get_segment = emulator_get_segment,
5324 .set_segment = emulator_set_segment,
5325 .get_cached_segment_base = emulator_get_cached_segment_base,
5326 .get_gdt = emulator_get_gdt,
5327 .get_idt = emulator_get_idt,
5328 .set_gdt = emulator_set_gdt,
5329 .set_idt = emulator_set_idt,
5330 .get_cr = emulator_get_cr,
5331 .set_cr = emulator_set_cr,
5332 .cpl = emulator_get_cpl,
5333 .get_dr = emulator_get_dr,
5334 .set_dr = emulator_set_dr,
5335 .get_smbase = emulator_get_smbase,
5336 .set_smbase = emulator_set_smbase,
5337 .set_msr = emulator_set_msr,
5338 .get_msr = emulator_get_msr,
5339 .check_pmc = emulator_check_pmc,
5340 .read_pmc = emulator_read_pmc,
5341 .halt = emulator_halt,
5342 .wbinvd = emulator_wbinvd,
5343 .fix_hypercall = emulator_fix_hypercall,
5344 .get_fpu = emulator_get_fpu,
5345 .put_fpu = emulator_put_fpu,
5346 .intercept = emulator_intercept,
5347 .get_cpuid = emulator_get_cpuid,
5348 .set_nmi_mask = emulator_set_nmi_mask,
5349 .get_hflags = emulator_get_hflags,
5350 .set_hflags = emulator_set_hflags,
5351};
5352
5353static void toggle_interruptibility(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 mask)
5354{
5355 u32 int_shadow = kvm_x86_ops->get_interrupt_shadow(vcpu);
5356 /*
5357 * an sti; sti; sequence only disable interrupts for the first
5358 * instruction. So, if the last instruction, be it emulated or
5359 * not, left the system with the INT_STI flag enabled, it
5360 * means that the last instruction is an sti. We should not
5361 * leave the flag on in this case. The same goes for mov ss
5362 */
5363 if (int_shadow & mask)
5364 mask = 0;
5365 if (unlikely(int_shadow || mask)) {
5366 kvm_x86_ops->set_interrupt_shadow(vcpu, mask);
5367 if (!mask)
5368 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
5369 }
5370}
5371
5372static bool inject_emulated_exception(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5373{
5374 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
5375 if (ctxt->exception.vector == PF_VECTOR)
5376 return kvm_propagate_fault(vcpu, &ctxt->exception);
5377
5378 if (ctxt->exception.error_code_valid)
5379 kvm_queue_exception_e(vcpu, ctxt->exception.vector,
5380 ctxt->exception.error_code);
5381 else
5382 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, ctxt->exception.vector);
5383 return false;
5384}
5385
5386static void init_emulate_ctxt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5387{
5388 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
5389 int cs_db, cs_l;
5390
5391 kvm_x86_ops->get_cs_db_l_bits(vcpu, &cs_db, &cs_l);
5392
5393 ctxt->eflags = kvm_get_rflags(vcpu);
5394 ctxt->tf = (ctxt->eflags & X86_EFLAGS_TF) != 0;
5395
5396 ctxt->eip = kvm_rip_read(vcpu);
5397 ctxt->mode = (!is_protmode(vcpu)) ? X86EMUL_MODE_REAL :
5398 (ctxt->eflags & X86_EFLAGS_VM) ? X86EMUL_MODE_VM86 :
5399 (cs_l && is_long_mode(vcpu)) ? X86EMUL_MODE_PROT64 :
5400 cs_db ? X86EMUL_MODE_PROT32 :
5401 X86EMUL_MODE_PROT16;
5402 BUILD_BUG_ON(HF_GUEST_MASK != X86EMUL_GUEST_MASK);
5403 BUILD_BUG_ON(HF_SMM_MASK != X86EMUL_SMM_MASK);
5404 BUILD_BUG_ON(HF_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK != X86EMUL_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK);
5405
5406 init_decode_cache(ctxt);
5407 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_from_vcpu = false;
5408}
5409
5410int kvm_inject_realmode_interrupt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int irq, int inc_eip)
5411{
5412 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
5413 int ret;
5414
5415 init_emulate_ctxt(vcpu);
5416
5417 ctxt->op_bytes = 2;
5418 ctxt->ad_bytes = 2;
5419 ctxt->_eip = ctxt->eip + inc_eip;
5420 ret = emulate_int_real(ctxt, irq);
5421
5422 if (ret != X86EMUL_CONTINUE)
5423 return EMULATE_FAIL;
5424
5425 ctxt->eip = ctxt->_eip;
5426 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, ctxt->eip);
5427 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, ctxt->eflags);
5428
5429 if (irq == NMI_VECTOR)
5430 vcpu->arch.nmi_pending = 0;
5431 else
5432 vcpu->arch.interrupt.pending = false;
5433
5434 return EMULATE_DONE;
5435}
5436EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_inject_realmode_interrupt);
5437
5438static int handle_emulation_failure(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5439{
5440 int r = EMULATE_DONE;
5441
5442 ++vcpu->stat.insn_emulation_fail;
5443 trace_kvm_emulate_insn_failed(vcpu);
5444 if (!is_guest_mode(vcpu) && kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 0) {
5445 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_INTERNAL_ERROR;
5446 vcpu->run->internal.suberror = KVM_INTERNAL_ERROR_EMULATION;
5447 vcpu->run->internal.ndata = 0;
5448 r = EMULATE_USER_EXIT;
5449 }
5450 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, UD_VECTOR);
5451
5452 return r;
5453}
5454
5455static bool reexecute_instruction(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gva_t cr2,
5456 bool write_fault_to_shadow_pgtable,
5457 int emulation_type)
5458{
5459 gpa_t gpa = cr2;
5460 kvm_pfn_t pfn;
5461
5462 if (emulation_type & EMULTYPE_NO_REEXECUTE)
5463 return false;
5464
5465 if (!vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map) {
5466 /*
5467 * Write permission should be allowed since only
5468 * write access need to be emulated.
5469 */
5470 gpa = kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_write(vcpu, cr2, NULL);
5471
5472 /*
5473 * If the mapping is invalid in guest, let cpu retry
5474 * it to generate fault.
5475 */
5476 if (gpa == UNMAPPED_GVA)
5477 return true;
5478 }
5479
5480 /*
5481 * Do not retry the unhandleable instruction if it faults on the
5482 * readonly host memory, otherwise it will goto a infinite loop:
5483 * retry instruction -> write #PF -> emulation fail -> retry
5484 * instruction -> ...
5485 */
5486 pfn = gfn_to_pfn(vcpu->kvm, gpa_to_gfn(gpa));
5487
5488 /*
5489 * If the instruction failed on the error pfn, it can not be fixed,
5490 * report the error to userspace.
5491 */
5492 if (is_error_noslot_pfn(pfn))
5493 return false;
5494
5495 kvm_release_pfn_clean(pfn);
5496
5497 /* The instructions are well-emulated on direct mmu. */
5498 if (vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map) {
5499 unsigned int indirect_shadow_pages;
5500
5501 spin_lock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
5502 indirect_shadow_pages = vcpu->kvm->arch.indirect_shadow_pages;
5503 spin_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->mmu_lock);
5504
5505 if (indirect_shadow_pages)
5506 kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(vcpu->kvm, gpa_to_gfn(gpa));
5507
5508 return true;
5509 }
5510
5511 /*
5512 * if emulation was due to access to shadowed page table
5513 * and it failed try to unshadow page and re-enter the
5514 * guest to let CPU execute the instruction.
5515 */
5516 kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(vcpu->kvm, gpa_to_gfn(gpa));
5517
5518 /*
5519 * If the access faults on its page table, it can not
5520 * be fixed by unprotecting shadow page and it should
5521 * be reported to userspace.
5522 */
5523 return !write_fault_to_shadow_pgtable;
5524}
5525
5526static bool retry_instruction(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt,
5527 unsigned long cr2, int emulation_type)
5528{
5529 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
5530 unsigned long last_retry_eip, last_retry_addr, gpa = cr2;
5531
5532 last_retry_eip = vcpu->arch.last_retry_eip;
5533 last_retry_addr = vcpu->arch.last_retry_addr;
5534
5535 /*
5536 * If the emulation is caused by #PF and it is non-page_table
5537 * writing instruction, it means the VM-EXIT is caused by shadow
5538 * page protected, we can zap the shadow page and retry this
5539 * instruction directly.
5540 *
5541 * Note: if the guest uses a non-page-table modifying instruction
5542 * on the PDE that points to the instruction, then we will unmap
5543 * the instruction and go to an infinite loop. So, we cache the
5544 * last retried eip and the last fault address, if we meet the eip
5545 * and the address again, we can break out of the potential infinite
5546 * loop.
5547 */
5548 vcpu->arch.last_retry_eip = vcpu->arch.last_retry_addr = 0;
5549
5550 if (!(emulation_type & EMULTYPE_RETRY))
5551 return false;
5552
5553 if (x86_page_table_writing_insn(ctxt))
5554 return false;
5555
5556 if (ctxt->eip == last_retry_eip && last_retry_addr == cr2)
5557 return false;
5558
5559 vcpu->arch.last_retry_eip = ctxt->eip;
5560 vcpu->arch.last_retry_addr = cr2;
5561
5562 if (!vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map)
5563 gpa = kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_write(vcpu, cr2, NULL);
5564
5565 kvm_mmu_unprotect_page(vcpu->kvm, gpa_to_gfn(gpa));
5566
5567 return true;
5568}
5569
5570static int complete_emulated_mmio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu);
5571static int complete_emulated_pio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu);
5572
5573static void kvm_smm_changed(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5574{
5575 if (!(vcpu->arch.hflags & HF_SMM_MASK)) {
5576 /* This is a good place to trace that we are exiting SMM. */
5577 trace_kvm_enter_smm(vcpu->vcpu_id, vcpu->arch.smbase, false);
5578
5579 /* Process a latched INIT or SMI, if any. */
5580 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
5581 }
5582
5583 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
5584}
5585
5586static void kvm_set_hflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned emul_flags)
5587{
5588 unsigned changed = vcpu->arch.hflags ^ emul_flags;
5589
5590 vcpu->arch.hflags = emul_flags;
5591
5592 if (changed & HF_SMM_MASK)
