5593 kvm_smm_changed(vcpu);
5594}
5595
5596static int kvm_vcpu_check_hw_bp(unsigned long addr, u32 type, u32 dr7,
5597 unsigned long *db)
5598{
5599 u32 dr6 = 0;
5600 int i;
5601 u32 enable, rwlen;
5602
5603 enable = dr7;
5604 rwlen = dr7 >> 16;
5605 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++, enable >>= 2, rwlen >>= 4)
5606 if ((enable & 3) && (rwlen & 15) == type && db[i] == addr)
5607 dr6 |= (1 << i);
5608 return dr6;
5609}
5610
5611static void kvm_vcpu_do_singlestep(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int *r)
5612{
5613 struct kvm_run *kvm_run = vcpu->run;
5614
5615 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP) {
5616 kvm_run->debug.arch.dr6 = DR6_BS | DR6_FIXED_1 | DR6_RTM;
5617 kvm_run->debug.arch.pc = vcpu->arch.singlestep_rip;
5618 kvm_run->debug.arch.exception = DB_VECTOR;
5619 kvm_run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_DEBUG;
5620 *r = EMULATE_USER_EXIT;
5621 } else {
5622 /*
5623 * "Certain debug exceptions may clear bit 0-3. The
5624 * remaining contents of the DR6 register are never
5625 * cleared by the processor".
5626 */
5627 vcpu->arch.dr6 &= ~15;
5628 vcpu->arch.dr6 |= DR6_BS | DR6_RTM;
5629 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, DB_VECTOR);
5630 }
5631}
5632
5633int kvm_skip_emulated_instruction(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5634{
5635 unsigned long rflags = kvm_x86_ops->get_rflags(vcpu);
5636 int r = EMULATE_DONE;
5637
5638 kvm_x86_ops->skip_emulated_instruction(vcpu);
5639
5640 /*
5641 * rflags is the old, "raw" value of the flags. The new value has
5642 * not been saved yet.
5643 *
5644 * This is correct even for TF set by the guest, because "the
5645 * processor will not generate this exception after the instruction
5646 * that sets the TF flag".
5647 */
5648 if (unlikely(rflags & X86_EFLAGS_TF))
5649 kvm_vcpu_do_singlestep(vcpu, &r);
5650 return r == EMULATE_DONE;
5651}
5652EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_skip_emulated_instruction);
5653
5654static bool kvm_vcpu_check_breakpoint(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int *r)
5655{
5656 if (unlikely(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP) &&
5657 (vcpu->arch.guest_debug_dr7 & DR7_BP_EN_MASK)) {
5658 struct kvm_run *kvm_run = vcpu->run;
5659 unsigned long eip = kvm_get_linear_rip(vcpu);
5660 u32 dr6 = kvm_vcpu_check_hw_bp(eip, 0,
5661 vcpu->arch.guest_debug_dr7,
5662 vcpu->arch.eff_db);
5663
5664 if (dr6 != 0) {
5665 kvm_run->debug.arch.dr6 = dr6 | DR6_FIXED_1 | DR6_RTM;
5666 kvm_run->debug.arch.pc = eip;
5667 kvm_run->debug.arch.exception = DB_VECTOR;
5668 kvm_run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_DEBUG;
5669 *r = EMULATE_USER_EXIT;
5670 return true;
5671 }
5672 }
5673
5674 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.dr7 & DR7_BP_EN_MASK) &&
5675 !(kvm_get_rflags(vcpu) & X86_EFLAGS_RF)) {
5676 unsigned long eip = kvm_get_linear_rip(vcpu);
5677 u32 dr6 = kvm_vcpu_check_hw_bp(eip, 0,
5678 vcpu->arch.dr7,
5679 vcpu->arch.db);
5680
5681 if (dr6 != 0) {
5682 vcpu->arch.dr6 &= ~15;
5683 vcpu->arch.dr6 |= dr6 | DR6_RTM;
5684 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, DB_VECTOR);
5685 *r = EMULATE_DONE;
5686 return true;
5687 }
5688 }
5689
5690 return false;
5691}
5692
5693int x86_emulate_instruction(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
5694 unsigned long cr2,
5695 int emulation_type,
5696 void *insn,
5697 int insn_len)
5698{
5699 int r;
5700 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
5701 bool writeback = true;
5702 bool write_fault_to_spt = vcpu->arch.write_fault_to_shadow_pgtable;
5703
5704 /*
5705 * Clear write_fault_to_shadow_pgtable here to ensure it is
5706 * never reused.
5707 */
5708 vcpu->arch.write_fault_to_shadow_pgtable = false;
5709 kvm_clear_exception_queue(vcpu);
5710
5711 if (!(emulation_type & EMULTYPE_NO_DECODE)) {
5712 init_emulate_ctxt(vcpu);
5713
5714 /*
5715 * We will reenter on the same instruction since
5716 * we do not set complete_userspace_io. This does not
5717 * handle watchpoints yet, those would be handled in
5718 * the emulate_ops.
5719 */
5720 if (!(emulation_type & EMULTYPE_SKIP) &&
5721 kvm_vcpu_check_breakpoint(vcpu, &r))
5722 return r;
5723
5724 ctxt->interruptibility = 0;
5725 ctxt->have_exception = false;
5726 ctxt->exception.vector = -1;
5727 ctxt->perm_ok = false;
5728
5729 ctxt->ud = emulation_type & EMULTYPE_TRAP_UD;
5730
5731 r = x86_decode_insn(ctxt, insn, insn_len);
5732
5733 trace_kvm_emulate_insn_start(vcpu);
5734 ++vcpu->stat.insn_emulation;
5735 if (r != EMULATION_OK) {
5736 if (emulation_type & EMULTYPE_TRAP_UD)
5737 return EMULATE_FAIL;
5738 if (reexecute_instruction(vcpu, cr2, write_fault_to_spt,
5739 emulation_type))
5740 return EMULATE_DONE;
5741 if (ctxt->have_exception && inject_emulated_exception(vcpu))
5742 return EMULATE_DONE;
5743 if (emulation_type & EMULTYPE_SKIP)
5744 return EMULATE_FAIL;
5745 return handle_emulation_failure(vcpu);
5746 }
5747 }
5748
5749 if (emulation_type & EMULTYPE_SKIP) {
5750 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, ctxt->_eip);
5751 if (ctxt->eflags & X86_EFLAGS_RF)
5752 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, ctxt->eflags & ~X86_EFLAGS_RF);
5753 return EMULATE_DONE;
5754 }
5755
5756 if (retry_instruction(ctxt, cr2, emulation_type))
5757 return EMULATE_DONE;
5758
5759 /* this is needed for vmware backdoor interface to work since it
5760 changes registers values during IO operation */
5761 if (vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_from_vcpu) {
5762 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_from_vcpu = false;
5763 emulator_invalidate_register_cache(ctxt);
5764 }
5765
5766restart:
5767 /* Save the faulting GPA (cr2) in the address field */
5768 ctxt->exception.address = cr2;
5769
5770 r = x86_emulate_insn(ctxt);
5771
5772 if (r == EMULATION_INTERCEPTED)
5773 return EMULATE_DONE;
5774
5775 if (r == EMULATION_FAILED) {
5776 if (reexecute_instruction(vcpu, cr2, write_fault_to_spt,
5777 emulation_type))
5778 return EMULATE_DONE;
5779
5780 return handle_emulation_failure(vcpu);
5781 }
5782
5783 if (ctxt->have_exception) {
5784 r = EMULATE_DONE;
5785 if (inject_emulated_exception(vcpu))
5786 return r;
5787 } else if (vcpu->arch.pio.count) {
5788 if (!vcpu->arch.pio.in) {
5789 /* FIXME: return into emulator if single-stepping. */
5790 vcpu->arch.pio.count = 0;
5791 } else {
5792 writeback = false;
5793 vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io = complete_emulated_pio;
5794 }
5795 r = EMULATE_USER_EXIT;
5796 } else if (vcpu->mmio_needed) {
5797 if (!vcpu->mmio_is_write)
5798 writeback = false;
5799 r = EMULATE_USER_EXIT;
5800 vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io = complete_emulated_mmio;
5801 } else if (r == EMULATION_RESTART)
5802 goto restart;
5803 else
5804 r = EMULATE_DONE;
5805
5806 if (writeback) {
5807 unsigned long rflags = kvm_x86_ops->get_rflags(vcpu);
5808 toggle_interruptibility(vcpu, ctxt->interruptibility);
5809 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_to_vcpu = false;
5810 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, ctxt->eip);
5811 if (r == EMULATE_DONE &&
5812 (ctxt->tf || (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP)))
5813 kvm_vcpu_do_singlestep(vcpu, &r);
5814 if (!ctxt->have_exception ||
5815 exception_type(ctxt->exception.vector) == EXCPT_TRAP)
5816 __kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, ctxt->eflags);
5817
5818 /*
5819 * For STI, interrupts are shadowed; so KVM_REQ_EVENT will
5820 * do nothing, and it will be requested again as soon as
5821 * the shadow expires. But we still need to check here,
5822 * because POPF has no interrupt shadow.
5823 */
5824 if (unlikely((ctxt->eflags & ~rflags) & X86_EFLAGS_IF))
5825 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
5826 } else
5827 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_to_vcpu = true;
5828
5829 return r;
5830}
5831EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(x86_emulate_instruction);
5832
5833int kvm_fast_pio_out(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int size, unsigned short port)
5834{
5835 unsigned long val = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX);
5836 int ret = emulator_pio_out_emulated(&vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt,
5837 size, port, &val, 1);
5838 /* do not return to emulator after return from userspace */
5839 vcpu->arch.pio.count = 0;
5840 return ret;
5841}
5842EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_fast_pio_out);
5843
5844static int complete_fast_pio_in(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
5845{
5846 unsigned long val;
5847
5848 /* We should only ever be called with arch.pio.count equal to 1 */
5849 BUG_ON(vcpu->arch.pio.count != 1);
5850
5851 /* For size less than 4 we merge, else we zero extend */
5852 val = (vcpu->arch.pio.size < 4) ? kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX)
5853 : 0;
5854
5855 /*
5856 * Since vcpu->arch.pio.count == 1 let emulator_pio_in_emulated perform
5857 * the copy and tracing
5858 */
5859 emulator_pio_in_emulated(&vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt, vcpu->arch.pio.size,
5860 vcpu->arch.pio.port, &val, 1);
5861 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX, val);
5862
5863 return 1;
5864}
5865
5866int kvm_fast_pio_in(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int size, unsigned short port)
5867{
5868 unsigned long val;
5869 int ret;
5870
5871 /* For size less than 4 we merge, else we zero extend */
5872 val = (size < 4) ? kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX) : 0;
5873
5874 ret = emulator_pio_in_emulated(&vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt, size, port,
5875 &val, 1);
5876 if (ret) {
5877 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX, val);
5878 return ret;
5879 }
5880
5881 vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io = complete_fast_pio_in;
5882
5883 return 0;
5884}
5885EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_fast_pio_in);
5886
5887static int kvmclock_cpu_down_prep(unsigned int cpu)
5888{
5889 __this_cpu_write(cpu_tsc_khz, 0);
5890 return 0;
5891}
5892
5893static void tsc_khz_changed(void *data)
5894{
5895 struct cpufreq_freqs *freq = data;
5896 unsigned long khz = 0;
5897
5898 if (data)
5899 khz = freq->new;
5900 else if (!boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_CONSTANT_TSC))
5901 khz = cpufreq_quick_get(raw_smp_processor_id());
5902 if (!khz)
5903 khz = tsc_khz;
5904 __this_cpu_write(cpu_tsc_khz, khz);
5905}
5906
5907static int kvmclock_cpufreq_notifier(struct notifier_block *nb, unsigned long val,
5908 void *data)
5909{
5910 struct cpufreq_freqs *freq = data;
5911 struct kvm *kvm;
5912 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
5913 int i, send_ipi = 0;
5914
5915 /*
5916 * We allow guests to temporarily run on slowing clocks,
5917 * provided we notify them after, or to run on accelerating
5918 * clocks, provided we notify them before. Thus time never
5919 * goes backwards.
5920 *
5921 * However, we have a problem. We can't atomically update
5922 * the frequency of a given CPU from this function; it is
5923 * merely a notifier, which can be called from any CPU.
5924 * Changing the TSC frequency at arbitrary points in time
5925 * requires a recomputation of local variables related to
5926 * the TSC for each VCPU. We must flag these local variables
5927 * to be updated and be sure the update takes place with the
5928 * new frequency before any guests proceed.
5929 *
5930 * Unfortunately, the combination of hotplug CPU and frequency
5931 * change creates an intractable locking scenario; the order
5932 * of when these callouts happen is undefined with respect to
5933 * CPU hotplug, and they can race with each other. As such,
5934 * merely setting per_cpu(cpu_tsc_khz) = X during a hotadd is
5935 * undefined; you can actually have a CPU frequency change take
5936 * place in between the computation of X and the setting of the
5937 * variable. To protect against this problem, all updates of
5938 * the per_cpu tsc_khz variable are done in an interrupt
5939 * protected IPI, and all callers wishing to update the value
5940 * must wait for a synchronous IPI to complete (which is trivial
5941 * if the caller is on the CPU already). This establishes the
5942 * necessary total order on variable updates.
5943 *
5944 * Note that because a guest time update may take place
5945 * anytime after the setting of the VCPU's request bit, the
5946 * correct TSC value must be set before the request. However,
5947 * to ensure the update actually makes it to any guest which
5948 * starts running in hardware virtualization between the set
5949 * and the acquisition of the spinlock, we must also ping the
5950 * CPU after setting the request bit.
5951 *
5952 */
5953
5954 if (val == CPUFREQ_PRECHANGE && freq->old > freq->new)
5955 return 0;
5956 if (val == CPUFREQ_POSTCHANGE && freq->old < freq->new)
5957 return 0;
5958
5959 smp_call_function_single(freq->cpu, tsc_khz_changed, freq, 1);
5960
5961 spin_lock(&kvm_lock);
5962 list_for_each_entry(kvm, &vm_list, vm_list) {
5963 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm) {
5964 if (vcpu->cpu != freq->cpu)
5965 continue;
5966 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
5967 if (vcpu->cpu != smp_processor_id())
5968 send_ipi = 1;
5969 }
5970 }
5971 spin_unlock(&kvm_lock);
5972
5973 if (freq->old < freq->new && send_ipi) {
5974 /*
5975 * We upscale the frequency. Must make the guest
5976 * doesn't see old kvmclock values while running with
5977 * the new frequency, otherwise we risk the guest sees
5978 * time go backwards.
5979 *
5980 * In case we update the frequency for another cpu
5981 * (which might be in guest context) send an interrupt
5982 * to kick the cpu out of guest context. Next time
5983 * guest context is entered kvmclock will be updated,
5984 * so the guest will not see stale values.
5985 */
5986 smp_call_function_single(freq->cpu, tsc_khz_changed, freq, 1);
5987 }
5988 return 0;
5989}
5990
5991static struct notifier_block kvmclock_cpufreq_notifier_block = {
5992 .notifier_call = kvmclock_cpufreq_notifier
5993};
5994
5995static int kvmclock_cpu_online(unsigned int cpu)
5996{
5997 tsc_khz_changed(NULL);
5998 return 0;
5999}
6000
6001static void kvm_timer_init(void)
6002{
6003 max_tsc_khz = tsc_khz;
6004
6005 if (!boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_CONSTANT_TSC)) {
6006#ifdef CONFIG_CPU_FREQ
6007 struct cpufreq_policy policy;
6008 int cpu;
6009
6010 memset(&policy, 0, sizeof(policy));
6011 cpu = get_cpu();
6012 cpufreq_get_policy(&policy, cpu);
6013 if (policy.cpuinfo.max_freq)
6014 max_tsc_khz = policy.cpuinfo.max_freq;
6015 put_cpu();
6016#endif
6017 cpufreq_register_notifier(&kvmclock_cpufreq_notifier_block,
6018 CPUFREQ_TRANSITION_NOTIFIER);
6019 }
6020 pr_debug("kvm: max_tsc_khz = %ld\n", max_tsc_khz);
6021
6022 cpuhp_setup_state(CPUHP_AP_X86_KVM_CLK_ONLINE, "x86/kvm/clk:online",
6023 kvmclock_cpu_online, kvmclock_cpu_down_prep);
6024}
6025
6026static DEFINE_PER_CPU(struct kvm_vcpu *, current_vcpu);
6027
6028int kvm_is_in_guest(void)
6029{
6030 return __this_cpu_read(current_vcpu) != NULL;
6031}
6032
6033static int kvm_is_user_mode(void)
6034{
6035 int user_mode = 3;
6036
6037 if (__this_cpu_read(current_vcpu))
6038 user_mode = kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(__this_cpu_read(current_vcpu));
6039
6040 return user_mode != 0;
6041}
6042
6043static unsigned long kvm_get_guest_ip(void)
6044{
6045 unsigned long ip = 0;
6046
6047 if (__this_cpu_read(current_vcpu))
6048 ip = kvm_rip_read(__this_cpu_read(current_vcpu));
6049
6050 return ip;
6051}
6052
6053static struct perf_guest_info_callbacks kvm_guest_cbs = {
6054 .is_in_guest = kvm_is_in_guest,
6055 .is_user_mode = kvm_is_user_mode,
6056 .get_guest_ip = kvm_get_guest_ip,
6057};
6058
6059void kvm_before_handle_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6060{
6061 __this_cpu_write(current_vcpu, vcpu);
6062}
6063EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_before_handle_nmi);
6064
6065void kvm_after_handle_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6066{
6067 __this_cpu_write(current_vcpu, NULL);
6068}
6069EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_after_handle_nmi);
6070
6071static void kvm_set_mmio_spte_mask(void)
6072{
6073 u64 mask;
6074 int maxphyaddr = boot_cpu_data.x86_phys_bits;
6075
6076 /*
6077 * Set the reserved bits and the present bit of an paging-structure
6078 * entry to generate page fault with PFER.RSV = 1.
6079 */
6080 /* Mask the reserved physical address bits. */
6081 mask = rsvd_bits(maxphyaddr, 51);
6082
6083 /* Set the present bit. */
6084 mask |= 1ull;
6085
6086#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6087 /*
6088 * If reserved bit is not supported, clear the present bit to disable
6089 * mmio page fault.
6090 */
6091 if (maxphyaddr == 52)
6092 mask &= ~1ull;
6093#endif
6094
6095 kvm_mmu_set_mmio_spte_mask(mask, mask);
6096}
6097
6098#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6099static void pvclock_gtod_update_fn(struct work_struct *work)
6100{
6101 struct kvm *kvm;
6102
6103 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
6104 int i;
6105
6106 spin_lock(&kvm_lock);
6107 list_for_each_entry(kvm, &vm_list, vm_list)
6108 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm)
6109 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MASTERCLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
6110 atomic_set(&kvm_guest_has_master_clock, 0);
6111 spin_unlock(&kvm_lock);
6112}
6113
6114static DECLARE_WORK(pvclock_gtod_work, pvclock_gtod_update_fn);
6115
6116/*
6117 * Notification about pvclock gtod data update.
6118 */
6119static int pvclock_gtod_notify(struct notifier_block *nb, unsigned long unused,
6120 void *priv)
6121{
6122 struct pvclock_gtod_data *gtod = &pvclock_gtod_data;
6123 struct timekeeper *tk = priv;
6124
6125 update_pvclock_gtod(tk);
6126
6127 /* disable master clock if host does not trust, or does not
6128 * use, TSC clocksource
6129 */
6130 if (gtod->clock.vclock_mode != VCLOCK_TSC &&
6131 atomic_read(&kvm_guest_has_master_clock) != 0)
6132 queue_work(system_long_wq, &pvclock_gtod_work);
6133
6134 return 0;
6135}
6136
6137static struct notifier_block pvclock_gtod_notifier = {
6138 .notifier_call = pvclock_gtod_notify,
6139};
6140#endif
6141
6142int kvm_arch_init(void *opaque)
6143{
6144 int r;
6145 struct kvm_x86_ops *ops = opaque;
6146
6147 if (kvm_x86_ops) {
6148 printk(KERN_ERR "kvm: already loaded the other module\n");
6149 r = -EEXIST;
6150 goto out;
6151 }
6152
6153 if (!ops->cpu_has_kvm_support()) {
6154 printk(KERN_ERR "kvm: no hardware support\n");
6155 r = -EOPNOTSUPP;
6156 goto out;
6157 }
6158 if (ops->disabled_by_bios()) {
6159 printk(KERN_ERR "kvm: disabled by bios\n");
6160 r = -EOPNOTSUPP;
6161 goto out;
6162 }
6163
6164 r = -ENOMEM;
6165 shared_msrs = alloc_percpu(struct kvm_shared_msrs);
6166 if (!shared_msrs) {
6167 printk(KERN_ERR "kvm: failed to allocate percpu kvm_shared_msrs\n");
6168 goto out;
6169 }
6170
6171 r = kvm_mmu_module_init();
6172 if (r)
6173 goto out_free_percpu;
6174
6175 kvm_set_mmio_spte_mask();
6176
6177 kvm_x86_ops = ops;
6178
6179 kvm_mmu_set_mask_ptes(PT_USER_MASK, PT_ACCESSED_MASK,
6180 PT_DIRTY_MASK, PT64_NX_MASK, 0,
6181 PT_PRESENT_MASK, 0, sme_me_mask);
6182 kvm_timer_init();
6183
6184 perf_register_guest_info_callbacks(&kvm_guest_cbs);
6185
6186 if (boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVE))
6187 host_xcr0 = xgetbv(XCR_XFEATURE_ENABLED_MASK);
6188
6189 kvm_lapic_init();
6190#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6191 pvclock_gtod_register_notifier(&pvclock_gtod_notifier);
6192#endif
6193
6194 return 0;
6195
6196out_free_percpu:
6197 free_percpu(shared_msrs);
6198out:
6199 return r;
6200}
6201
6202void kvm_arch_exit(void)
6203{
6204 kvm_lapic_exit();
6205 perf_unregister_guest_info_callbacks(&kvm_guest_cbs);
6206
6207 if (!boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_CONSTANT_TSC))
6208 cpufreq_unregister_notifier(&kvmclock_cpufreq_notifier_block,
6209 CPUFREQ_TRANSITION_NOTIFIER);
6210 cpuhp_remove_state_nocalls(CPUHP_AP_X86_KVM_CLK_ONLINE);
6211#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6212 pvclock_gtod_unregister_notifier(&pvclock_gtod_notifier);
6213#endif
6214 kvm_x86_ops = NULL;
6215 kvm_mmu_module_exit();
6216 free_percpu(shared_msrs);
6217}
6218
6219int kvm_vcpu_halt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6220{
6221 ++vcpu->stat.halt_exits;
6222 if (lapic_in_kernel(vcpu)) {
6223 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_HALTED;
6224 return 1;
6225 } else {
6226 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_HLT;
6227 return 0;
6228 }
6229}
6230EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_vcpu_halt);
6231
6232int kvm_emulate_halt(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6233{
6234 int ret = kvm_skip_emulated_instruction(vcpu);
6235 /*
6236 * TODO: we might be squashing a GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP-triggered
6237 * KVM_EXIT_DEBUG here.
6238 */
6239 return kvm_vcpu_halt(vcpu) && ret;
6240}
6241EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_emulate_halt);
6242
6243#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6244static int kvm_pv_clock_pairing(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gpa_t paddr,
6245 unsigned long clock_type)
6246{
6247 struct kvm_clock_pairing clock_pairing;
6248 struct timespec ts;
6249 u64 cycle;
6250 int ret;
6251
6252 if (clock_type != KVM_CLOCK_PAIRING_WALLCLOCK)
6253 return -KVM_EOPNOTSUPP;
6254
6255 if (kvm_get_walltime_and_clockread(&ts, &cycle) == false)
6256 return -KVM_EOPNOTSUPP;
6257
6258 clock_pairing.sec = ts.tv_sec;
6259 clock_pairing.nsec = ts.tv_nsec;
6260 clock_pairing.tsc = kvm_read_l1_tsc(vcpu, cycle);
6261 clock_pairing.flags = 0;
6262
6263 ret = 0;
6264 if (kvm_write_guest(vcpu->kvm, paddr, &clock_pairing,
6265 sizeof(struct kvm_clock_pairing)))
6266 ret = -KVM_EFAULT;
6267
6268 return ret;
6269}
6270#endif
6271
6272/*
6273 * kvm_pv_kick_cpu_op: Kick a vcpu.
6274 *
6275 * @apicid - apicid of vcpu to be kicked.
6276 */
6277static void kvm_pv_kick_cpu_op(struct kvm *kvm, unsigned long flags, int apicid)
6278{
6279 struct kvm_lapic_irq lapic_irq;
6280
6281 lapic_irq.shorthand = 0;
6282 lapic_irq.dest_mode = 0;
6283 lapic_irq.level = 0;
6284 lapic_irq.dest_id = apicid;
6285 lapic_irq.msi_redir_hint = false;
6286
6287 lapic_irq.delivery_mode = APIC_DM_REMRD;
6288 kvm_irq_delivery_to_apic(kvm, NULL, &lapic_irq, NULL);
6289}
6290
6291void kvm_vcpu_deactivate_apicv(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6292{
6293 vcpu->arch.apicv_active = false;
6294 kvm_x86_ops->refresh_apicv_exec_ctrl(vcpu);
6295}
6296
6297int kvm_emulate_hypercall(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6298{
6299 unsigned long nr, a0, a1, a2, a3, ret;
6300 int op_64_bit;
6301
6302 if (kvm_hv_hypercall_enabled(vcpu->kvm)) {
6303 if (!kvm_hv_hypercall(vcpu))
6304 return 0;
6305 goto out;
6306 }
6307
6308 nr = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX);
6309 a0 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RBX);
6310 a1 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RCX);
6311 a2 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDX);
6312 a3 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RSI);
6313
6314 trace_kvm_hypercall(nr, a0, a1, a2, a3);
6315
6316 op_64_bit = is_64_bit_mode(vcpu);
6317 if (!op_64_bit) {
6318 nr &= 0xFFFFFFFF;
6319 a0 &= 0xFFFFFFFF;
6320 a1 &= 0xFFFFFFFF;
6321 a2 &= 0xFFFFFFFF;
6322 a3 &= 0xFFFFFFFF;
6323 }
6324
6325 if (kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) != 0) {
6326 ret = -KVM_EPERM;
6327 goto out_error;
6328 }
6329
6330 switch (nr) {
6331 case KVM_HC_VAPIC_POLL_IRQ:
6332 ret = 0;
6333 break;
6334 case KVM_HC_KICK_CPU:
6335 kvm_pv_kick_cpu_op(vcpu->kvm, a0, a1);
6336 ret = 0;
6337 break;
6338#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6339 case KVM_HC_CLOCK_PAIRING:
6340 ret = kvm_pv_clock_pairing(vcpu, a0, a1);
6341 break;
6342#endif
6343 default:
6344 ret = -KVM_ENOSYS;
6345 break;
6346 }
6347out_error:
6348 if (!op_64_bit)
6349 ret = (u32)ret;
6350 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX, ret);
6351
6352out:
6353 ++vcpu->stat.hypercalls;
6354 return kvm_skip_emulated_instruction(vcpu);
6355}
6356EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_emulate_hypercall);
6357
6358static int emulator_fix_hypercall(struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt)
6359{
6360 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu = emul_to_vcpu(ctxt);
6361 char instruction[3];
6362 unsigned long rip = kvm_rip_read(vcpu);
6363
6364 kvm_x86_ops->patch_hypercall(vcpu, instruction);
6365
6366 return emulator_write_emulated(ctxt, rip, instruction, 3,
6367 &ctxt->exception);
6368}
6369
6370static int dm_request_for_irq_injection(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6371{
6372 return vcpu->run->request_interrupt_window &&
6373 likely(!pic_in_kernel(vcpu->kvm));
6374}
6375
6376static void post_kvm_run_save(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6377{
6378 struct kvm_run *kvm_run = vcpu->run;
6379
6380 kvm_run->if_flag = (kvm_get_rflags(vcpu) & X86_EFLAGS_IF) != 0;
6381 kvm_run->flags = is_smm(vcpu) ? KVM_RUN_X86_SMM : 0;
6382 kvm_run->cr8 = kvm_get_cr8(vcpu);
6383 kvm_run->apic_base = kvm_get_apic_base(vcpu);
6384 kvm_run->ready_for_interrupt_injection =
6385 pic_in_kernel(vcpu->kvm) ||
6386 kvm_vcpu_ready_for_interrupt_injection(vcpu);
6387}
6388
6389static void update_cr8_intercept(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6390{
6391 int max_irr, tpr;
6392
6393 if (!kvm_x86_ops->update_cr8_intercept)
6394 return;
6395
6396 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
6397 return;
6398
6399 if (vcpu->arch.apicv_active)
6400 return;
6401
6402 if (!vcpu->arch.apic->vapic_addr)
6403 max_irr = kvm_lapic_find_highest_irr(vcpu);
6404 else
6405 max_irr = -1;
6406
6407 if (max_irr != -1)
6408 max_irr >>= 4;
6409
6410 tpr = kvm_lapic_get_cr8(vcpu);
6411
6412 kvm_x86_ops->update_cr8_intercept(vcpu, tpr, max_irr);
6413}
6414
6415static int inject_pending_event(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, bool req_int_win)
6416{
6417 int r;
6418
6419 /* try to reinject previous events if any */
6420 if (vcpu->arch.exception.injected) {
6421 kvm_x86_ops->queue_exception(vcpu);
6422 return 0;
6423 }
6424
6425 /*
6426 * Exceptions must be injected immediately, or the exception
6427 * frame will have the address of the NMI or interrupt handler.
6428 */
6429 if (!vcpu->arch.exception.pending) {
6430 if (vcpu->arch.nmi_injected) {
6431 kvm_x86_ops->set_nmi(vcpu);
6432 return 0;
6433 }
6434
6435 if (vcpu->arch.interrupt.pending) {
6436 kvm_x86_ops->set_irq(vcpu);
6437 return 0;
6438 }
6439 }
6440
6441 if (is_guest_mode(vcpu) && kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events) {
6442 r = kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events(vcpu, req_int_win);
6443 if (r != 0)
6444 return r;
6445 }
6446
6447 /* try to inject new event if pending */
6448 if (vcpu->arch.exception.pending) {
6449 trace_kvm_inj_exception(vcpu->arch.exception.nr,
6450 vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code,
6451 vcpu->arch.exception.error_code);
6452
6453 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = false;
6454 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = true;
6455
6456 if (exception_type(vcpu->arch.exception.nr) == EXCPT_FAULT)
6457 __kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, kvm_get_rflags(vcpu) |
6458 X86_EFLAGS_RF);
6459
6460 if (vcpu->arch.exception.nr == DB_VECTOR &&
6461 (vcpu->arch.dr7 & DR7_GD)) {
6462 vcpu->arch.dr7 &= ~DR7_GD;
6463 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
6464 }
6465
6466 kvm_x86_ops->queue_exception(vcpu);
6467 } else if (vcpu->arch.smi_pending && !is_smm(vcpu)) {
6468 vcpu->arch.smi_pending = false;
6469 enter_smm(vcpu);
6470 } else if (vcpu->arch.nmi_pending && kvm_x86_ops->nmi_allowed(vcpu)) {
6471 --vcpu->arch.nmi_pending;
6472 vcpu->arch.nmi_injected = true;
6473 kvm_x86_ops->set_nmi(vcpu);
6474 } else if (kvm_cpu_has_injectable_intr(vcpu)) {
6475 /*
6476 * Because interrupts can be injected asynchronously, we are
6477 * calling check_nested_events again here to avoid a race condition.
6478 * See https://lkml.org/lkml/2014/7/2/60 for discussion about this
6479 * proposal and current concerns. Perhaps we should be setting
6480 * KVM_REQ_EVENT only on certain events and not unconditionally?
6481 */
6482 if (is_guest_mode(vcpu) && kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events) {
6483 r = kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events(vcpu, req_int_win);
6484 if (r != 0)
6485 return r;
6486 }
6487 if (kvm_x86_ops->interrupt_allowed(vcpu)) {
6488 kvm_queue_interrupt(vcpu, kvm_cpu_get_interrupt(vcpu),
6489 false);
6490 kvm_x86_ops->set_irq(vcpu);
6491 }
6492 }
6493
6494 return 0;
6495}
6496
6497static void process_nmi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6498{
6499 unsigned limit = 2;
6500
6501 /*
6502 * x86 is limited to one NMI running, and one NMI pending after it.
6503 * If an NMI is already in progress, limit further NMIs to just one.
6504 * Otherwise, allow two (and we'll inject the first one immediately).
6505 */
6506 if (kvm_x86_ops->get_nmi_mask(vcpu) || vcpu->arch.nmi_injected)
6507 limit = 1;
6508
6509 vcpu->arch.nmi_pending += atomic_xchg(&vcpu->arch.nmi_queued, 0);
6510 vcpu->arch.nmi_pending = min(vcpu->arch.nmi_pending, limit);
6511 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
6512}
6513
6514#define put_smstate(type, buf, offset, val) \
6515 *(type *)((buf) + (offset) - 0x7e00) = val
6516
6517static u32 enter_smm_get_segment_flags(struct kvm_segment *seg)
6518{
6519 u32 flags = 0;
6520 flags |= seg->g << 23;
6521 flags |= seg->db << 22;
6522 flags |= seg->l << 21;
6523 flags |= seg->avl << 20;
6524 flags |= seg->present << 15;
6525 flags |= seg->dpl << 13;
6526 flags |= seg->s << 12;
6527 flags |= seg->type << 8;
6528 return flags;
6529}
6530
6531static void enter_smm_save_seg_32(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, char *buf, int n)
6532{
6533 struct kvm_segment seg;
6534 int offset;
6535
6536 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, n);
6537 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fa8 + n * 4, seg.selector);
6538
6539 if (n < 3)
6540 offset = 0x7f84 + n * 12;
6541 else
6542 offset = 0x7f2c + (n - 3) * 12;
6543
6544 put_smstate(u32, buf, offset + 8, seg.base);
6545 put_smstate(u32, buf, offset + 4, seg.limit);
6546 put_smstate(u32, buf, offset, enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg));
6547}
6548
6549#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6550static void enter_smm_save_seg_64(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, char *buf, int n)
6551{
6552 struct kvm_segment seg;
6553 int offset;
6554 u16 flags;
6555
6556 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, n);
6557 offset = 0x7e00 + n * 16;
6558
6559 flags = enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg) >> 8;
6560 put_smstate(u16, buf, offset, seg.selector);
6561 put_smstate(u16, buf, offset + 2, flags);
6562 put_smstate(u32, buf, offset + 4, seg.limit);
6563 put_smstate(u64, buf, offset + 8, seg.base);
6564}
6565#endif
6566
6567static void enter_smm_save_state_32(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, char *buf)
6568{
6569 struct desc_ptr dt;
6570 struct kvm_segment seg;
6571 unsigned long val;
6572 int i;
6573
6574 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7ffc, kvm_read_cr0(vcpu));
6575 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7ff8, kvm_read_cr3(vcpu));
6576 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7ff4, kvm_get_rflags(vcpu));
6577 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7ff0, kvm_rip_read(vcpu));
6578
6579 for (i = 0; i < 8; i++)
6580 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fd0 + i * 4, kvm_register_read(vcpu, i));
6581
6582 kvm_get_dr(vcpu, 6, &val);
6583 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fcc, (u32)val);
6584 kvm_get_dr(vcpu, 7, &val);
6585 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fc8, (u32)val);
6586
6587 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, VCPU_SREG_TR);
6588 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fc4, seg.selector);
6589 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f64, seg.base);
6590 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f60, seg.limit);
6591 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f5c, enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg));
6592
6593 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, VCPU_SREG_LDTR);
6594 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7fc0, seg.selector);
6595 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f80, seg.base);
6596 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f7c, seg.limit);
6597 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f78, enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg));
6598
6599 kvm_x86_ops->get_gdt(vcpu, &dt);
6600 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f74, dt.address);
6601 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f70, dt.size);
6602
6603 kvm_x86_ops->get_idt(vcpu, &dt);
6604 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f58, dt.address);
6605 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f54, dt.size);
6606
6607 for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
6608 enter_smm_save_seg_32(vcpu, buf, i);
6609
6610 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f14, kvm_read_cr4(vcpu));
6611
6612 /* revision id */
6613 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7efc, 0x00020000);
6614 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7ef8, vcpu->arch.smbase);
6615}
6616
6617static void enter_smm_save_state_64(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, char *buf)
6618{
6619#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
6620 struct desc_ptr dt;
6621 struct kvm_segment seg;
6622 unsigned long val;
6623 int i;
6624
6625 for (i = 0; i < 16; i++)
6626 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7ff8 - i * 8, kvm_register_read(vcpu, i));
6627
6628 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f78, kvm_rip_read(vcpu));
6629 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f70, kvm_get_rflags(vcpu));
6630
6631 kvm_get_dr(vcpu, 6, &val);
6632 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f68, val);
6633 kvm_get_dr(vcpu, 7, &val);
6634 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f60, val);
6635
6636 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f58, kvm_read_cr0(vcpu));
6637 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f50, kvm_read_cr3(vcpu));
6638 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7f48, kvm_read_cr4(vcpu));
6639
6640 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7f00, vcpu->arch.smbase);
6641
6642 /* revision id */
6643 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7efc, 0x00020064);
6644
6645 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7ed0, vcpu->arch.efer);
6646
6647 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, VCPU_SREG_TR);
6648 put_smstate(u16, buf, 0x7e90, seg.selector);
6649 put_smstate(u16, buf, 0x7e92, enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg) >> 8);
6650 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7e94, seg.limit);
6651 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7e98, seg.base);
6652
6653 kvm_x86_ops->get_idt(vcpu, &dt);
6654 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7e84, dt.size);
6655 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7e88, dt.address);
6656
6657 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &seg, VCPU_SREG_LDTR);
6658 put_smstate(u16, buf, 0x7e70, seg.selector);
6659 put_smstate(u16, buf, 0x7e72, enter_smm_get_segment_flags(&seg) >> 8);
6660 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7e74, seg.limit);
6661 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7e78, seg.base);
6662
6663 kvm_x86_ops->get_gdt(vcpu, &dt);
6664 put_smstate(u32, buf, 0x7e64, dt.size);
6665 put_smstate(u64, buf, 0x7e68, dt.address);
6666
6667 for (i = 0; i < 6; i++)
6668 enter_smm_save_seg_64(vcpu, buf, i);
6669#else
6670 WARN_ON_ONCE(1);
6671#endif
6672}
6673
6674static void enter_smm(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6675{
6676 struct kvm_segment cs, ds;
6677 struct desc_ptr dt;
6678 char buf[512];
6679 u32 cr0;
6680
6681 trace_kvm_enter_smm(vcpu->vcpu_id, vcpu->arch.smbase, true);
6682 vcpu->arch.hflags |= HF_SMM_MASK;
6683 memset(buf, 0, 512);
6684 if (guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_LM))
6685 enter_smm_save_state_64(vcpu, buf);
6686 else
6687 enter_smm_save_state_32(vcpu, buf);
6688
6689 kvm_vcpu_write_guest(vcpu, vcpu->arch.smbase + 0xfe00, buf, sizeof(buf));
6690
6691 if (kvm_x86_ops->get_nmi_mask(vcpu))
6692 vcpu->arch.hflags |= HF_SMM_INSIDE_NMI_MASK;
6693 else
6694 kvm_x86_ops->set_nmi_mask(vcpu, true);
6695
6696 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, X86_EFLAGS_FIXED);
6697 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, 0x8000);
6698
6699 cr0 = vcpu->arch.cr0 & ~(X86_CR0_PE | X86_CR0_EM | X86_CR0_TS | X86_CR0_PG);
6700 kvm_x86_ops->set_cr0(vcpu, cr0);
6701 vcpu->arch.cr0 = cr0;
6702
6703 kvm_x86_ops->set_cr4(vcpu, 0);
6704
6705 /* Undocumented: IDT limit is set to zero on entry to SMM. */
6706 dt.address = dt.size = 0;
6707 kvm_x86_ops->set_idt(vcpu, &dt);
6708
6709 __kvm_set_dr(vcpu, 7, DR7_FIXED_1);
6710
6711 cs.selector = (vcpu->arch.smbase >> 4) & 0xffff;
6712 cs.base = vcpu->arch.smbase;
6713
6714 ds.selector = 0;
6715 ds.base = 0;
6716
6717 cs.limit = ds.limit = 0xffffffff;
6718 cs.type = ds.type = 0x3;
6719 cs.dpl = ds.dpl = 0;
6720 cs.db = ds.db = 0;
6721 cs.s = ds.s = 1;
6722 cs.l = ds.l = 0;
6723 cs.g = ds.g = 1;
6724 cs.avl = ds.avl = 0;
6725 cs.present = ds.present = 1;
6726 cs.unusable = ds.unusable = 0;
6727 cs.padding = ds.padding = 0;
6728
6729 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
6730 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &ds, VCPU_SREG_DS);
6731 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &ds, VCPU_SREG_ES);
6732 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &ds, VCPU_SREG_FS);
6733 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &ds, VCPU_SREG_GS);
6734 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &ds, VCPU_SREG_SS);
6735
6736 if (guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_LM))
6737 kvm_x86_ops->set_efer(vcpu, 0);
6738
6739 kvm_update_cpuid(vcpu);
6740 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
6741}
6742
6743static void process_smi(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6744{
6745 vcpu->arch.smi_pending = true;
6746 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
6747}
6748
6749void kvm_make_scan_ioapic_request(struct kvm *kvm)
6750{
6751 kvm_make_all_cpus_request(kvm, KVM_REQ_SCAN_IOAPIC);
6752}
6753
6754static void vcpu_scan_ioapic(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6755{
6756 u64 eoi_exit_bitmap[4];
6757
6758 if (!kvm_apic_hw_enabled(vcpu->arch.apic))
6759 return;
6760
6761 bitmap_zero(vcpu->arch.ioapic_handled_vectors, 256);
6762
6763 if (irqchip_split(vcpu->kvm))
6764 kvm_scan_ioapic_routes(vcpu, vcpu->arch.ioapic_handled_vectors);
6765 else {
6766 if (kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr && vcpu->arch.apicv_active)
6767 kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr(vcpu);
6768 kvm_ioapic_scan_entry(vcpu, vcpu->arch.ioapic_handled_vectors);
6769 }
6770 bitmap_or((ulong *)eoi_exit_bitmap, vcpu->arch.ioapic_handled_vectors,
6771 vcpu_to_synic(vcpu)->vec_bitmap, 256);
6772 kvm_x86_ops->load_eoi_exitmap(vcpu, eoi_exit_bitmap);
6773}
6774
6775static void kvm_vcpu_flush_tlb(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6776{
6777 ++vcpu->stat.tlb_flush;
6778 kvm_x86_ops->tlb_flush(vcpu);
6779}
6780
6781void kvm_arch_mmu_notifier_invalidate_range(struct kvm *kvm,
6782 unsigned long start, unsigned long end)
6783{
6784 unsigned long apic_address;
6785
6786 /*
6787 * The physical address of apic access page is stored in the VMCS.
6788 * Update it when it becomes invalid.
6789 */
6790 apic_address = gfn_to_hva(kvm, APIC_DEFAULT_PHYS_BASE >> PAGE_SHIFT);
6791 if (start <= apic_address && apic_address < end)
6792 kvm_make_all_cpus_request(kvm, KVM_REQ_APIC_PAGE_RELOAD);
6793}
6794
6795void kvm_vcpu_reload_apic_access_page(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6796{
6797 struct page *page = NULL;
6798
6799 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
6800 return;
6801
6802 if (!kvm_x86_ops->set_apic_access_page_addr)
6803 return;
6804
6805 page = gfn_to_page(vcpu->kvm, APIC_DEFAULT_PHYS_BASE >> PAGE_SHIFT);
6806 if (is_error_page(page))
6807 return;
6808 kvm_x86_ops->set_apic_access_page_addr(vcpu, page_to_phys(page));
6809
6810 /*
6811 * Do not pin apic access page in memory, the MMU notifier
6812 * will call us again if it is migrated or swapped out.
6813 */
6814 put_page(page);
6815}
6816EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_vcpu_reload_apic_access_page);
6817
6818/*
6819 * Returns 1 to let vcpu_run() continue the guest execution loop without
6820 * exiting to the userspace. Otherwise, the value will be returned to the
6821 * userspace.
6822 */
6823static int vcpu_enter_guest(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
6824{
6825 int r;
6826 bool req_int_win =
6827 dm_request_for_irq_injection(vcpu) &&
6828 kvm_cpu_accept_dm_intr(vcpu);
6829
6830 bool req_immediate_exit = false;
6831
6832 if (kvm_request_pending(vcpu)) {
6833 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_MMU_RELOAD, vcpu))
6834 kvm_mmu_unload(vcpu);
6835 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_MIGRATE_TIMER, vcpu))
6836 __kvm_migrate_timers(vcpu);
6837 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_MASTERCLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu))
6838 kvm_gen_update_masterclock(vcpu->kvm);
6839 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_GLOBAL_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu))
6840 kvm_gen_kvmclock_update(vcpu);
6841 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu)) {
6842 r = kvm_guest_time_update(vcpu);
6843 if (unlikely(r))
6844 goto out;
6845 }
6846 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_MMU_SYNC, vcpu))
6847 kvm_mmu_sync_roots(vcpu);
6848 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_TLB_FLUSH, vcpu))
6849 kvm_vcpu_flush_tlb(vcpu);
6850 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_REPORT_TPR_ACCESS, vcpu)) {
6851 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_TPR_ACCESS;
6852 r = 0;
6853 goto out;
6854 }
6855 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_TRIPLE_FAULT, vcpu)) {
6856 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_SHUTDOWN;
6857 vcpu->mmio_needed = 0;
6858 r = 0;
6859 goto out;
6860 }
6861 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_APF_HALT, vcpu)) {
6862 /* Page is swapped out. Do synthetic halt */
6863 vcpu->arch.apf.halted = true;
6864 r = 1;
6865 goto out;
6866 }
6867 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_STEAL_UPDATE, vcpu))
6868 record_steal_time(vcpu);
6869 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_SMI, vcpu))
6870 process_smi(vcpu);
6871 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_NMI, vcpu))
6872 process_nmi(vcpu);
6873 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_PMU, vcpu))
6874 kvm_pmu_handle_event(vcpu);
6875 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_PMI, vcpu))
6876 kvm_pmu_deliver_pmi(vcpu);
6877 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_IOAPIC_EOI_EXIT, vcpu)) {
6878 BUG_ON(vcpu->arch.pending_ioapic_eoi > 255);
6879 if (test_bit(vcpu->arch.pending_ioapic_eoi,
6880 vcpu->arch.ioapic_handled_vectors)) {
6881 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_IOAPIC_EOI;
6882 vcpu->run->eoi.vector =
6883 vcpu->arch.pending_ioapic_eoi;
6884 r = 0;
6885 goto out;
6886 }
6887 }
6888 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_SCAN_IOAPIC, vcpu))
6889 vcpu_scan_ioapic(vcpu);
6890 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_APIC_PAGE_RELOAD, vcpu))
6891 kvm_vcpu_reload_apic_access_page(vcpu);
6892 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_HV_CRASH, vcpu)) {
6893 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_SYSTEM_EVENT;
6894 vcpu->run->system_event.type = KVM_SYSTEM_EVENT_CRASH;
6895 r = 0;
6896 goto out;
6897 }
6898 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_HV_RESET, vcpu)) {
6899 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_SYSTEM_EVENT;
6900 vcpu->run->system_event.type = KVM_SYSTEM_EVENT_RESET;
6901 r = 0;
6902 goto out;
6903 }
6904 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_HV_EXIT, vcpu)) {
6905 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_HYPERV;
6906 vcpu->run->hyperv = vcpu->arch.hyperv.exit;
6907 r = 0;
6908 goto out;
6909 }
6910
6911 /*
6912 * KVM_REQ_HV_STIMER has to be processed after
6913 * KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, because Hyper-V SynIC timers
6914 * depend on the guest clock being up-to-date
6915 */
6916 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_HV_STIMER, vcpu))
6917 kvm_hv_process_stimers(vcpu);
6918 }
6919
6920 if (kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu) || req_int_win) {
6921 ++vcpu->stat.req_event;
6922 kvm_apic_accept_events(vcpu);
6923 if (vcpu->arch.mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_INIT_RECEIVED) {
6924 r = 1;
6925 goto out;
6926 }
6927
6928 if (inject_pending_event(vcpu, req_int_win) != 0)
6929 req_immediate_exit = true;
6930 else {
6931 /* Enable NMI/IRQ window open exits if needed.
6932 *
6933 * SMIs have two cases: 1) they can be nested, and
6934 * then there is nothing to do here because RSM will
6935 * cause a vmexit anyway; 2) or the SMI can be pending
6936 * because inject_pending_event has completed the
6937 * injection of an IRQ or NMI from the previous vmexit,
6938 * and then we request an immediate exit to inject the SMI.
6939 */
6940 if (vcpu->arch.smi_pending && !is_smm(vcpu))
6941 req_immediate_exit = true;
6942 if (vcpu->arch.nmi_pending)
6943 kvm_x86_ops->enable_nmi_window(vcpu);
6944 if (kvm_cpu_has_injectable_intr(vcpu) || req_int_win)
6945 kvm_x86_ops->enable_irq_window(vcpu);
6946 WARN_ON(vcpu->arch.exception.pending);
6947 }
6948
6949 if (kvm_lapic_enabled(vcpu)) {
6950 update_cr8_intercept(vcpu);
6951 kvm_lapic_sync_to_vapic(vcpu);
6952 }
6953 }
6954
6955 r = kvm_mmu_reload(vcpu);
6956 if (unlikely(r)) {
6957 goto cancel_injection;
6958 }
6959
6960 preempt_disable();
6961
6962 kvm_x86_ops->prepare_guest_switch(vcpu);
6963 kvm_load_guest_fpu(vcpu);
6964
6965 /*
6966 * Disable IRQs before setting IN_GUEST_MODE. Posted interrupt
6967 * IPI are then delayed after guest entry, which ensures that they
6968 * result in virtual interrupt delivery.
6969 */
6970 local_irq_disable();
6971 vcpu->mode = IN_GUEST_MODE;
6972
6973 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, vcpu->srcu_idx);
6974
6975 /*
6976 * 1) We should set ->mode before checking ->requests. Please see
6977 * the comment in kvm_vcpu_exiting_guest_mode().
6978 *
6979 * 2) For APICv, we should set ->mode before checking PIR.ON. This
6980 * pairs with the memory barrier implicit in pi_test_and_set_on
6981 * (see vmx_deliver_posted_interrupt).
6982 *
6983 * 3) This also orders the write to mode from any reads to the page
6984 * tables done while the VCPU is running. Please see the comment
6985 * in kvm_flush_remote_tlbs.
6986 */
6987 smp_mb__after_srcu_read_unlock();
6988
6989 /*
6990 * This handles the case where a posted interrupt was
6991 * notified with kvm_vcpu_kick.
6992 */
6993 if (kvm_lapic_enabled(vcpu)) {
6994 if (kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr && vcpu->arch.apicv_active)
6995 kvm_x86_ops->sync_pir_to_irr(vcpu);
6996 }
6997
6998 if (vcpu->mode == EXITING_GUEST_MODE || kvm_request_pending(vcpu)
6999 || need_resched() || signal_pending(current)) {
7000 vcpu->mode = OUTSIDE_GUEST_MODE;
7001 smp_wmb();
7002 local_irq_enable();
7003 preempt_enable();
7004 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
7005 r = 1;
7006 goto cancel_injection;
7007 }
7008
7009 kvm_load_guest_xcr0(vcpu);
7010
7011 if (req_immediate_exit) {
7012 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7013 smp_send_reschedule(vcpu->cpu);
7014 }
7015
7016 trace_kvm_entry(vcpu->vcpu_id);
7017 wait_lapic_expire(vcpu);
7018 guest_enter_irqoff();
7019
7020 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs)) {
7021 set_debugreg(0, 7);
7022 set_debugreg(vcpu->arch.eff_db[0], 0);
7023 set_debugreg(vcpu->arch.eff_db[1], 1);
7024 set_debugreg(vcpu->arch.eff_db[2], 2);
7025 set_debugreg(vcpu->arch.eff_db[3], 3);
7026 set_debugreg(vcpu->arch.dr6, 6);
7027 vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs &= ~KVM_DEBUGREG_RELOAD;
7028 }
7029
7030 kvm_x86_ops->run(vcpu);
7031
7032 /*
7033 * Do this here before restoring debug registers on the host. And
7034 * since we do this before handling the vmexit, a DR access vmexit
7035 * can (a) read the correct value of the debug registers, (b) set
7036 * KVM_DEBUGREG_WONT_EXIT again.
7037 */
7038 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs & KVM_DEBUGREG_WONT_EXIT)) {
7039 WARN_ON(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP);
7040 kvm_x86_ops->sync_dirty_debug_regs(vcpu);
7041 kvm_update_dr0123(vcpu);
7042 kvm_update_dr6(vcpu);
7043 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
7044 vcpu->arch.switch_db_regs &= ~KVM_DEBUGREG_RELOAD;
7045 }
7046
7047 /*
7048 * If the guest has used debug registers, at least dr7
7049 * will be disabled while returning to the host.
7050 * If we don't have active breakpoints in the host, we don't
7051 * care about the messed up debug address registers. But if
7052 * we have some of them active, restore the old state.
7053 */
7054 if (hw_breakpoint_active())
7055 hw_breakpoint_restore();
7056
7057 vcpu->arch.last_guest_tsc = kvm_read_l1_tsc(vcpu, rdtsc());
7058
7059 vcpu->mode = OUTSIDE_GUEST_MODE;
7060 smp_wmb();
7061
7062 kvm_put_guest_xcr0(vcpu);
7063
7064 kvm_x86_ops->handle_external_intr(vcpu);
7065
7066 ++vcpu->stat.exits;
7067
7068 guest_exit_irqoff();
7069
7070 local_irq_enable();
7071 preempt_enable();
7072
7073 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
7074
7075 /*
7076 * Profile KVM exit RIPs:
7077 */
7078 if (unlikely(prof_on == KVM_PROFILING)) {
7079 unsigned long rip = kvm_rip_read(vcpu);
7080 profile_hit(KVM_PROFILING, (void *)rip);
7081 }
7082
7083 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.tsc_always_catchup))
7084 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
7085
7086 if (vcpu->arch.apic_attention)
7087 kvm_lapic_sync_from_vapic(vcpu);
7088
7089 vcpu->arch.gpa_available = false;
7090 r = kvm_x86_ops->handle_exit(vcpu);
7091 return r;
7092
7093cancel_injection:
7094 kvm_x86_ops->cancel_injection(vcpu);
7095 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.apic_attention))
7096 kvm_lapic_sync_from_vapic(vcpu);
7097out:
7098 return r;
7099}
7100
7101static inline int vcpu_block(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7102{
7103 if (!kvm_arch_vcpu_runnable(vcpu) &&
7104 (!kvm_x86_ops->pre_block || kvm_x86_ops->pre_block(vcpu) == 0)) {
7105 srcu_read_unlock(&kvm->srcu, vcpu->srcu_idx);
7106 kvm_vcpu_block(vcpu);
7107 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&kvm->srcu);
7108
7109 if (kvm_x86_ops->post_block)
7110 kvm_x86_ops->post_block(vcpu);
7111
7112 if (!kvm_check_request(KVM_REQ_UNHALT, vcpu))
7113 return 1;
7114 }
7115
7116 kvm_apic_accept_events(vcpu);
7117 switch(vcpu->arch.mp_state) {
7118 case KVM_MP_STATE_HALTED:
7119 vcpu->arch.pv.pv_unhalted = false;
7120 vcpu->arch.mp_state =
7121 KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE;
7122 case KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE:
7123 vcpu->arch.apf.halted = false;
7124 break;
7125 case KVM_MP_STATE_INIT_RECEIVED:
7126 break;
7127 default:
7128 return -EINTR;
7129 break;
7130 }
7131 return 1;
7132}
7133
7134static inline bool kvm_vcpu_running(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7135{
7136 if (is_guest_mode(vcpu) && kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events)
7137 kvm_x86_ops->check_nested_events(vcpu, false);
7138
7139 return (vcpu->arch.mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE &&
7140 !vcpu->arch.apf.halted);
7141}
7142
7143static int vcpu_run(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7144{
7145 int r;
7146 struct kvm *kvm = vcpu->kvm;
7147
7148 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&kvm->srcu);
7149
7150 for (;;) {
7151 if (kvm_vcpu_running(vcpu)) {
7152 r = vcpu_enter_guest(vcpu);
7153 } else {
7154 r = vcpu_block(kvm, vcpu);
7155 }
7156
7157 if (r <= 0)
7158 break;
7159
7160 kvm_clear_request(KVM_REQ_PENDING_TIMER, vcpu);
7161 if (kvm_cpu_has_pending_timer(vcpu))
7162 kvm_inject_pending_timer_irqs(vcpu);
7163
7164 if (dm_request_for_irq_injection(vcpu) &&
7165 kvm_vcpu_ready_for_interrupt_injection(vcpu)) {
7166 r = 0;
7167 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_IRQ_WINDOW_OPEN;
7168 ++vcpu->stat.request_irq_exits;
7169 break;
7170 }
7171
7172 kvm_check_async_pf_completion(vcpu);
7173
7174 if (signal_pending(current)) {
7175 r = -EINTR;
7176 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_INTR;
7177 ++vcpu->stat.signal_exits;
7178 break;
7179 }
7180 if (need_resched()) {
7181 srcu_read_unlock(&kvm->srcu, vcpu->srcu_idx);
7182 cond_resched();
7183 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&kvm->srcu);
7184 }
7185 }
7186
7187 srcu_read_unlock(&kvm->srcu, vcpu->srcu_idx);
7188
7189 return r;
7190}
7191
7192static inline int complete_emulated_io(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7193{
7194 int r;
7195 vcpu->srcu_idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
7196 r = emulate_instruction(vcpu, EMULTYPE_NO_DECODE);
7197 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, vcpu->srcu_idx);
7198 if (r != EMULATE_DONE)
7199 return 0;
7200 return 1;
7201}
7202
7203static int complete_emulated_pio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7204{
7205 BUG_ON(!vcpu->arch.pio.count);
7206
7207 return complete_emulated_io(vcpu);
7208}
7209
7210/*
7211 * Implements the following, as a state machine:
7212 *
7213 * read:
7214 * for each fragment
7215 * for each mmio piece in the fragment
7216 * write gpa, len
7217 * exit
7218 * copy data
7219 * execute insn
7220 *
7221 * write:
7222 * for each fragment
7223 * for each mmio piece in the fragment
7224 * write gpa, len
7225 * copy data
7226 * exit
7227 */
7228static int complete_emulated_mmio(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7229{
7230 struct kvm_run *run = vcpu->run;
7231 struct kvm_mmio_fragment *frag;
7232 unsigned len;
7233
7234 BUG_ON(!vcpu->mmio_needed);
7235
7236 /* Complete previous fragment */
7237 frag = &vcpu->mmio_fragments[vcpu->mmio_cur_fragment];
7238 len = min(8u, frag->len);
7239 if (!vcpu->mmio_is_write)
7240 memcpy(frag->data, run->mmio.data, len);
7241
7242 if (frag->len <= 8) {
7243 /* Switch to the next fragment. */
7244 frag++;
7245 vcpu->mmio_cur_fragment++;
7246 } else {
7247 /* Go forward to the next mmio piece. */
7248 frag->data += len;
7249 frag->gpa += len;
7250 frag->len -= len;
7251 }
7252
7253 if (vcpu->mmio_cur_fragment >= vcpu->mmio_nr_fragments) {
7254 vcpu->mmio_needed = 0;
7255
7256 /* FIXME: return into emulator if single-stepping. */
7257 if (vcpu->mmio_is_write)
7258 return 1;
7259 vcpu->mmio_read_completed = 1;
7260 return complete_emulated_io(vcpu);
7261 }
7262
7263 run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_MMIO;
7264 run->mmio.phys_addr = frag->gpa;
7265 if (vcpu->mmio_is_write)
7266 memcpy(run->mmio.data, frag->data, min(8u, frag->len));
7267 run->mmio.len = min(8u, frag->len);
7268 run->mmio.is_write = vcpu->mmio_is_write;
7269 vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io = complete_emulated_mmio;
7270 return 0;
7271}
7272
7273
7274int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_run(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_run *kvm_run)
7275{
7276 struct fpu *fpu = &current->thread.fpu;
7277 int r;
7278
7279 fpu__initialize(fpu);
7280
7281 kvm_sigset_activate(vcpu);
7282
7283 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_UNINITIALIZED)) {
7284 if (kvm_run->immediate_exit) {
7285 r = -EINTR;
7286 goto out;
7287 }
7288 kvm_vcpu_block(vcpu);
7289 kvm_apic_accept_events(vcpu);
7290 kvm_clear_request(KVM_REQ_UNHALT, vcpu);
7291 r = -EAGAIN;
7292 if (signal_pending(current)) {
7293 r = -EINTR;
7294 vcpu->run->exit_reason = KVM_EXIT_INTR;
7295 ++vcpu->stat.signal_exits;
7296 }
7297 goto out;
7298 }
7299
7300 /* re-sync apic's tpr */
7301 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu)) {
7302 if (kvm_set_cr8(vcpu, kvm_run->cr8) != 0) {
7303 r = -EINVAL;
7304 goto out;
7305 }
7306 }
7307
7308 if (unlikely(vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io)) {
7309 int (*cui)(struct kvm_vcpu *) = vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io;
7310 vcpu->arch.complete_userspace_io = NULL;
7311 r = cui(vcpu);
7312 if (r <= 0)
7313 goto out;
7314 } else
7315 WARN_ON(vcpu->arch.pio.count || vcpu->mmio_needed);
7316
7317 if (kvm_run->immediate_exit)
7318 r = -EINTR;
7319 else
7320 r = vcpu_run(vcpu);
7321
7322out:
7323 post_kvm_run_save(vcpu);
7324 kvm_sigset_deactivate(vcpu);
7325
7326 return r;
7327}
7328
7329int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_get_regs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_regs *regs)
7330{
7331 if (vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_to_vcpu) {
7332 /*
7333 * We are here if userspace calls get_regs() in the middle of
7334 * instruction emulation. Registers state needs to be copied
7335 * back from emulation context to vcpu. Userspace shouldn't do
7336 * that usually, but some bad designed PV devices (vmware
7337 * backdoor interface) need this to work
7338 */
7339 emulator_writeback_register_cache(&vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt);
7340 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_to_vcpu = false;
7341 }
7342 regs->rax = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX);
7343 regs->rbx = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RBX);
7344 regs->rcx = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RCX);
7345 regs->rdx = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDX);
7346 regs->rsi = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RSI);
7347 regs->rdi = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDI);
7348 regs->rsp = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RSP);
7349 regs->rbp = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RBP);
7350#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
7351 regs->r8 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R8);
7352 regs->r9 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R9);
7353 regs->r10 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R10);
7354 regs->r11 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R11);
7355 regs->r12 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R12);
7356 regs->r13 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R13);
7357 regs->r14 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R14);
7358 regs->r15 = kvm_register_read(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R15);
7359#endif
7360
7361 regs->rip = kvm_rip_read(vcpu);
7362 regs->rflags = kvm_get_rflags(vcpu);
7363
7364 return 0;
7365}
7366
7367int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_set_regs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_regs *regs)
7368{
7369 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_from_vcpu = true;
7370 vcpu->arch.emulate_regs_need_sync_to_vcpu = false;
7371
7372 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RAX, regs->rax);
7373 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RBX, regs->rbx);
7374 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RCX, regs->rcx);
7375 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDX, regs->rdx);
7376 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RSI, regs->rsi);
7377 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RDI, regs->rdi);
7378 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RSP, regs->rsp);
7379 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_RBP, regs->rbp);
7380#ifdef CONFIG_X86_64
7381 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R8, regs->r8);
7382 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R9, regs->r9);
7383 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R10, regs->r10);
7384 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R11, regs->r11);
7385 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R12, regs->r12);
7386 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R13, regs->r13);
7387 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R14, regs->r14);
7388 kvm_register_write(vcpu, VCPU_REGS_R15, regs->r15);
7389#endif
7390
7391 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, regs->rip);
7392 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, regs->rflags | X86_EFLAGS_FIXED);
7393
7394 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = false;
7395
7396 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7397
7398 return 0;
7399}
7400
7401void kvm_get_cs_db_l_bits(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int *db, int *l)
7402{
7403 struct kvm_segment cs;
7404
7405 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7406 *db = cs.db;
7407 *l = cs.l;
7408}
7409EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_cs_db_l_bits);
7410
7411int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_get_sregs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7412 struct kvm_sregs *sregs)
7413{
7414 struct desc_ptr dt;
7415
7416 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7417 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ds, VCPU_SREG_DS);
7418 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->es, VCPU_SREG_ES);
7419 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->fs, VCPU_SREG_FS);
7420 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->gs, VCPU_SREG_GS);
7421 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ss, VCPU_SREG_SS);
7422
7423 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->tr, VCPU_SREG_TR);
7424 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ldt, VCPU_SREG_LDTR);
7425
7426 kvm_x86_ops->get_idt(vcpu, &dt);
7427 sregs->idt.limit = dt.size;
7428 sregs->idt.base = dt.address;
7429 kvm_x86_ops->get_gdt(vcpu, &dt);
7430 sregs->gdt.limit = dt.size;
7431 sregs->gdt.base = dt.address;
7432
7433 sregs->cr0 = kvm_read_cr0(vcpu);
7434 sregs->cr2 = vcpu->arch.cr2;
7435 sregs->cr3 = kvm_read_cr3(vcpu);
7436 sregs->cr4 = kvm_read_cr4(vcpu);
7437 sregs->cr8 = kvm_get_cr8(vcpu);
7438 sregs->efer = vcpu->arch.efer;
7439 sregs->apic_base = kvm_get_apic_base(vcpu);
7440
7441 memset(sregs->interrupt_bitmap, 0, sizeof sregs->interrupt_bitmap);
7442
7443 if (vcpu->arch.interrupt.pending && !vcpu->arch.interrupt.soft)
7444 set_bit(vcpu->arch.interrupt.nr,
7445 (unsigned long *)sregs->interrupt_bitmap);
7446
7447 return 0;
7448}
7449
7450int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_get_mpstate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7451 struct kvm_mp_state *mp_state)
7452{
7453 kvm_apic_accept_events(vcpu);
7454 if (vcpu->arch.mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_HALTED &&
7455 vcpu->arch.pv.pv_unhalted)
7456 mp_state->mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE;
7457 else
7458 mp_state->mp_state = vcpu->arch.mp_state;
7459
7460 return 0;
7461}
7462
7463int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_set_mpstate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7464 struct kvm_mp_state *mp_state)
7465{
7466 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu) &&
7467 mp_state->mp_state != KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE)
7468 return -EINVAL;
7469
7470 /* INITs are latched while in SMM */
7471 if ((is_smm(vcpu) || vcpu->arch.smi_pending) &&
7472 (mp_state->mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_SIPI_RECEIVED ||
7473 mp_state->mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_INIT_RECEIVED))
7474 return -EINVAL;
7475
7476 if (mp_state->mp_state == KVM_MP_STATE_SIPI_RECEIVED) {
7477 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_INIT_RECEIVED;
7478 set_bit(KVM_APIC_SIPI, &vcpu->arch.apic->pending_events);
7479 } else
7480 vcpu->arch.mp_state = mp_state->mp_state;
7481 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7482 return 0;
7483}
7484
7485int kvm_task_switch(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u16 tss_selector, int idt_index,
7486 int reason, bool has_error_code, u32 error_code)
7487{
7488 struct x86_emulate_ctxt *ctxt = &vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt;
7489 int ret;
7490
7491 init_emulate_ctxt(vcpu);
7492
7493 ret = emulator_task_switch(ctxt, tss_selector, idt_index, reason,
7494 has_error_code, error_code);
7495
7496 if (ret)
7497 return EMULATE_FAIL;
7498
7499 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, ctxt->eip);
7500 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, ctxt->eflags);
7501 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7502 return EMULATE_DONE;
7503}
7504EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_task_switch);
7505
7506int kvm_valid_sregs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_sregs *sregs)
7507{
7508 if ((sregs->efer & EFER_LME) && (sregs->cr0 & X86_CR0_PG)) {
7509 /*
7510 * When EFER.LME and CR0.PG are set, the processor is in
7511 * 64-bit mode (though maybe in a 32-bit code segment).
7512 * CR4.PAE and EFER.LMA must be set.
7513 */
7514 if (!(sregs->cr4 & X86_CR4_PAE)
7515 || !(sregs->efer & EFER_LMA))
7516 return -EINVAL;
7517 } else {
7518 /*
7519 * Not in 64-bit mode: EFER.LMA is clear and the code
7520 * segment cannot be 64-bit.
7521 */
7522 if (sregs->efer & EFER_LMA || sregs->cs.l)
7523 return -EINVAL;
7524 }
7525
7526 return 0;
7527}
7528
7529int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_set_sregs(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7530 struct kvm_sregs *sregs)
7531{
7532 struct msr_data apic_base_msr;
7533 int mmu_reset_needed = 0;
7534 int cpuid_update_needed = 0;
7535 int pending_vec, max_bits, idx;
7536 struct desc_ptr dt;
7537
7538 if (!guest_cpuid_has(vcpu, X86_FEATURE_XSAVE) &&
7539 (sregs->cr4 & X86_CR4_OSXSAVE))
7540 return -EINVAL;
7541
7542 if (kvm_valid_sregs(vcpu, sregs))
7543 return -EINVAL;
7544
7545 apic_base_msr.data = sregs->apic_base;
7546 apic_base_msr.host_initiated = true;
7547 if (kvm_set_apic_base(vcpu, &apic_base_msr))
7548 return -EINVAL;
7549
7550 dt.size = sregs->idt.limit;
7551 dt.address = sregs->idt.base;
7552 kvm_x86_ops->set_idt(vcpu, &dt);
7553 dt.size = sregs->gdt.limit;
7554 dt.address = sregs->gdt.base;
7555 kvm_x86_ops->set_gdt(vcpu, &dt);
7556
7557 vcpu->arch.cr2 = sregs->cr2;
7558 mmu_reset_needed |= kvm_read_cr3(vcpu) != sregs->cr3;
7559 vcpu->arch.cr3 = sregs->cr3;
7560 __set_bit(VCPU_EXREG_CR3, (ulong *)&vcpu->arch.regs_avail);
7561
7562 kvm_set_cr8(vcpu, sregs->cr8);
7563
7564 mmu_reset_needed |= vcpu->arch.efer != sregs->efer;
7565 kvm_x86_ops->set_efer(vcpu, sregs->efer);
7566
7567 mmu_reset_needed |= kvm_read_cr0(vcpu) != sregs->cr0;
7568 kvm_x86_ops->set_cr0(vcpu, sregs->cr0);
7569 vcpu->arch.cr0 = sregs->cr0;
7570
7571 mmu_reset_needed |= kvm_read_cr4(vcpu) != sregs->cr4;
7572 cpuid_update_needed |= ((kvm_read_cr4(vcpu) ^ sregs->cr4) &
7573 (X86_CR4_OSXSAVE | X86_CR4_PKE));
7574 kvm_x86_ops->set_cr4(vcpu, sregs->cr4);
7575 if (cpuid_update_needed)
7576 kvm_update_cpuid(vcpu);
7577
7578 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
7579 if (!is_long_mode(vcpu) && is_pae(vcpu)) {
7580 load_pdptrs(vcpu, vcpu->arch.walk_mmu, kvm_read_cr3(vcpu));
7581 mmu_reset_needed = 1;
7582 }
7583 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
7584
7585 if (mmu_reset_needed)
7586 kvm_mmu_reset_context(vcpu);
7587
7588 max_bits = KVM_NR_INTERRUPTS;
7589 pending_vec = find_first_bit(
7590 (const unsigned long *)sregs->interrupt_bitmap, max_bits);
7591 if (pending_vec < max_bits) {
7592 kvm_queue_interrupt(vcpu, pending_vec, false);
7593 pr_debug("Set back pending irq %d\n", pending_vec);
7594 }
7595
7596 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7597 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ds, VCPU_SREG_DS);
7598 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->es, VCPU_SREG_ES);
7599 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->fs, VCPU_SREG_FS);
7600 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->gs, VCPU_SREG_GS);
7601 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ss, VCPU_SREG_SS);
7602
7603 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->tr, VCPU_SREG_TR);
7604 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &sregs->ldt, VCPU_SREG_LDTR);
7605
7606 update_cr8_intercept(vcpu);
7607
7608 /* Older userspace won't unhalt the vcpu on reset. */
7609 if (kvm_vcpu_is_bsp(vcpu) && kvm_rip_read(vcpu) == 0xfff0 &&
7610 sregs->cs.selector == 0xf000 && sregs->cs.base == 0xffff0000 &&
7611 !is_protmode(vcpu))
7612 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE;
7613
7614 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7615
7616 return 0;
7617}
7618
7619int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_set_guest_debug(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7620 struct kvm_guest_debug *dbg)
7621{
7622 unsigned long rflags;
7623 int i, r;
7624
7625 if (dbg->control & (KVM_GUESTDBG_INJECT_DB | KVM_GUESTDBG_INJECT_BP)) {
7626 r = -EBUSY;
7627 if (vcpu->arch.exception.pending)
7628 goto out;
7629 if (dbg->control & KVM_GUESTDBG_INJECT_DB)
7630 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, DB_VECTOR);
7631 else
7632 kvm_queue_exception(vcpu, BP_VECTOR);
7633 }
7634
7635 /*
7636 * Read rflags as long as potentially injected trace flags are still
7637 * filtered out.
7638 */
7639 rflags = kvm_get_rflags(vcpu);
7640
7641 vcpu->guest_debug = dbg->control;
7642 if (!(vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_ENABLE))
7643 vcpu->guest_debug = 0;
7644
7645 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_USE_HW_BP) {
7646 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_DB_REGS; ++i)
7647 vcpu->arch.eff_db[i] = dbg->arch.debugreg[i];
7648 vcpu->arch.guest_debug_dr7 = dbg->arch.debugreg[7];
7649 } else {
7650 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_DB_REGS; i++)
7651 vcpu->arch.eff_db[i] = vcpu->arch.db[i];
7652 }
7653 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
7654
7655 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP)
7656 vcpu->arch.singlestep_rip = kvm_rip_read(vcpu) +
7657 get_segment_base(vcpu, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7658
7659 /*
7660 * Trigger an rflags update that will inject or remove the trace
7661 * flags.
7662 */
7663 kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, rflags);
7664
7665 kvm_x86_ops->update_bp_intercept(vcpu);
7666
7667 r = 0;
7668
7669out:
7670
7671 return r;
7672}
7673
7674/*
7675 * Translate a guest virtual address to a guest physical address.
7676 */
7677int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_translate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
7678 struct kvm_translation *tr)
7679{
7680 unsigned long vaddr = tr->linear_address;
7681 gpa_t gpa;
7682 int idx;
7683
7684 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
7685 gpa = kvm_mmu_gva_to_gpa_system(vcpu, vaddr, NULL);
7686 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
7687 tr->physical_address = gpa;
7688 tr->valid = gpa != UNMAPPED_GVA;
7689 tr->writeable = 1;
7690 tr->usermode = 0;
7691
7692 return 0;
7693}
7694
7695int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_get_fpu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_fpu *fpu)
7696{
7697 struct fxregs_state *fxsave =
7698 &vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.fxsave;
7699
7700 memcpy(fpu->fpr, fxsave->st_space, 128);
7701 fpu->fcw = fxsave->cwd;
7702 fpu->fsw = fxsave->swd;
7703 fpu->ftwx = fxsave->twd;
7704 fpu->last_opcode = fxsave->fop;
7705 fpu->last_ip = fxsave->rip;
7706 fpu->last_dp = fxsave->rdp;
7707 memcpy(fpu->xmm, fxsave->xmm_space, sizeof fxsave->xmm_space);
7708
7709 return 0;
7710}
7711
7712int kvm_arch_vcpu_ioctl_set_fpu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_fpu *fpu)
7713{
7714 struct fxregs_state *fxsave =
7715 &vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.fxsave;
7716
7717 memcpy(fxsave->st_space, fpu->fpr, 128);
7718 fxsave->cwd = fpu->fcw;
7719 fxsave->swd = fpu->fsw;
7720 fxsave->twd = fpu->ftwx;
7721 fxsave->fop = fpu->last_opcode;
7722 fxsave->rip = fpu->last_ip;
7723 fxsave->rdp = fpu->last_dp;
7724 memcpy(fxsave->xmm_space, fpu->xmm, sizeof fxsave->xmm_space);
7725
7726 return 0;
7727}
7728
7729static void fx_init(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7730{
7731 fpstate_init(&vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state);
7732 if (boot_cpu_has(X86_FEATURE_XSAVES))
7733 vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state.xsave.header.xcomp_bv =
7734 host_xcr0 | XSTATE_COMPACTION_ENABLED;
7735
7736 /*
7737 * Ensure guest xcr0 is valid for loading
7738 */
7739 vcpu->arch.xcr0 = XFEATURE_MASK_FP;
7740
7741 vcpu->arch.cr0 |= X86_CR0_ET;
7742}
7743
7744void kvm_load_guest_fpu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7745{
7746 if (vcpu->guest_fpu_loaded)
7747 return;
7748
7749 /*
7750 * Restore all possible states in the guest,
7751 * and assume host would use all available bits.
7752 * Guest xcr0 would be loaded later.
7753 */
7754 vcpu->guest_fpu_loaded = 1;
7755 __kernel_fpu_begin();
7756 /* PKRU is separately restored in kvm_x86_ops->run. */
7757 __copy_kernel_to_fpregs(&vcpu->arch.guest_fpu.state,
7758 ~XFEATURE_MASK_PKRU);
7759 trace_kvm_fpu(1);
7760}
7761
7762void kvm_put_guest_fpu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7763{
7764 if (!vcpu->guest_fpu_loaded)
7765 return;
7766
7767 vcpu->guest_fpu_loaded = 0;
7768 copy_fpregs_to_fpstate(&vcpu->arch.guest_fpu);
7769 __kernel_fpu_end();
7770 ++vcpu->stat.fpu_reload;
7771 trace_kvm_fpu(0);
7772}
7773
7774void kvm_arch_vcpu_free(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7775{
7776 void *wbinvd_dirty_mask = vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask;
7777
7778 kvmclock_reset(vcpu);
7779
7780 kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_free(vcpu);
7781 free_cpumask_var(wbinvd_dirty_mask);
7782}
7783
7784struct kvm_vcpu *kvm_arch_vcpu_create(struct kvm *kvm,
7785 unsigned int id)
7786{
7787 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
7788
7789 if (check_tsc_unstable() && atomic_read(&kvm->online_vcpus) != 0)
7790 printk_once(KERN_WARNING
7791 "kvm: SMP vm created on host with unstable TSC; "
7792 "guest TSC will not be reliable\n");
7793
7794 vcpu = kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_create(kvm, id);
7795
7796 return vcpu;
7797}
7798
7799int kvm_arch_vcpu_setup(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7800{
7801 int r;
7802
7803 kvm_vcpu_mtrr_init(vcpu);
7804 r = vcpu_load(vcpu);
7805 if (r)
7806 return r;
7807 kvm_vcpu_reset(vcpu, false);
7808 kvm_mmu_setup(vcpu);
7809 vcpu_put(vcpu);
7810 return r;
7811}
7812
7813void kvm_arch_vcpu_postcreate(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7814{
7815 struct msr_data msr;
7816 struct kvm *kvm = vcpu->kvm;
7817
7818 kvm_hv_vcpu_postcreate(vcpu);
7819
7820 if (vcpu_load(vcpu))
7821 return;
7822 msr.data = 0x0;
7823 msr.index = MSR_IA32_TSC;
7824 msr.host_initiated = true;
7825 kvm_write_tsc(vcpu, &msr);
7826 vcpu_put(vcpu);
7827
7828 if (!kvmclock_periodic_sync)
7829 return;
7830
7831 schedule_delayed_work(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_sync_work,
7832 KVMCLOCK_SYNC_PERIOD);
7833}
7834
7835void kvm_arch_vcpu_destroy(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
7836{
7837 int r;
7838 vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val = 0;
7839
7840 r = vcpu_load(vcpu);
7841 BUG_ON(r);
7842 kvm_mmu_unload(vcpu);
7843 vcpu_put(vcpu);
7844
7845 kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_free(vcpu);
7846}
7847
7848void kvm_vcpu_reset(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, bool init_event)
7849{
7850 kvm_lapic_reset(vcpu, init_event);
7851
7852 vcpu->arch.hflags = 0;
7853
7854 vcpu->arch.smi_pending = 0;
7855 atomic_set(&vcpu->arch.nmi_queued, 0);
7856 vcpu->arch.nmi_pending = 0;
7857 vcpu->arch.nmi_injected = false;
7858 kvm_clear_interrupt_queue(vcpu);
7859 kvm_clear_exception_queue(vcpu);
7860 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = false;
7861
7862 memset(vcpu->arch.db, 0, sizeof(vcpu->arch.db));
7863 kvm_update_dr0123(vcpu);
7864 vcpu->arch.dr6 = DR6_INIT;
7865 kvm_update_dr6(vcpu);
7866 vcpu->arch.dr7 = DR7_FIXED_1;
7867 kvm_update_dr7(vcpu);
7868
7869 vcpu->arch.cr2 = 0;
7870
7871 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
7872 vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val = 0;
7873 vcpu->arch.st.msr_val = 0;
7874
7875 kvmclock_reset(vcpu);
7876
7877 kvm_clear_async_pf_completion_queue(vcpu);
7878 kvm_async_pf_hash_reset(vcpu);
7879 vcpu->arch.apf.halted = false;
7880
7881 if (!init_event) {
7882 kvm_pmu_reset(vcpu);
7883 vcpu->arch.smbase = 0x30000;
7884
7885 vcpu->arch.msr_platform_info = MSR_PLATFORM_INFO_CPUID_FAULT;
7886 vcpu->arch.msr_misc_features_enables = 0;
7887 }
7888
7889 memset(vcpu->arch.regs, 0, sizeof(vcpu->arch.regs));
7890 vcpu->arch.regs_avail = ~0;
7891 vcpu->arch.regs_dirty = ~0;
7892
7893 kvm_x86_ops->vcpu_reset(vcpu, init_event);
7894}
7895
7896void kvm_vcpu_deliver_sipi_vector(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u8 vector)
7897{
7898 struct kvm_segment cs;
7899
7900 kvm_get_segment(vcpu, &cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7901 cs.selector = vector << 8;
7902 cs.base = vector << 12;
7903 kvm_set_segment(vcpu, &cs, VCPU_SREG_CS);
7904 kvm_rip_write(vcpu, 0);
7905}
7906
7907int kvm_arch_hardware_enable(void)
7908{
7909 struct kvm *kvm;
7910 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
7911 int i;
7912 int ret;
7913 u64 local_tsc;
7914 u64 max_tsc = 0;
7915 bool stable, backwards_tsc = false;
7916
7917 kvm_shared_msr_cpu_online();
7918 ret = kvm_x86_ops->hardware_enable();
7919 if (ret != 0)
7920 return ret;
7921
7922 local_tsc = rdtsc();
7923 stable = !check_tsc_unstable();
7924 list_for_each_entry(kvm, &vm_list, vm_list) {
7925 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm) {
7926 if (!stable && vcpu->cpu == smp_processor_id())
7927 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_CLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
7928 if (stable && vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc > local_tsc) {
7929 backwards_tsc = true;
7930 if (vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc > max_tsc)
7931 max_tsc = vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc;
7932 }
7933 }
7934 }
7935
7936 /*
7937 * Sometimes, even reliable TSCs go backwards. This happens on
7938 * platforms that reset TSC during suspend or hibernate actions, but
7939 * maintain synchronization. We must compensate. Fortunately, we can
7940 * detect that condition here, which happens early in CPU bringup,
7941 * before any KVM threads can be running. Unfortunately, we can't
7942 * bring the TSCs fully up to date with real time, as we aren't yet far
7943 * enough into CPU bringup that we know how much real time has actually
7944 * elapsed; our helper function, ktime_get_boot_ns() will be using boot
7945 * variables that haven't been updated yet.
7946 *
7947 * So we simply find the maximum observed TSC above, then record the
7948 * adjustment to TSC in each VCPU. When the VCPU later gets loaded,
7949 * the adjustment will be applied. Note that we accumulate
7950 * adjustments, in case multiple suspend cycles happen before some VCPU
7951 * gets a chance to run again. In the event that no KVM threads get a
7952 * chance to run, we will miss the entire elapsed period, as we'll have
7953 * reset last_host_tsc, so VCPUs will not have the TSC adjusted and may
7954 * loose cycle time. This isn't too big a deal, since the loss will be
7955 * uniform across all VCPUs (not to mention the scenario is extremely
7956 * unlikely). It is possible that a second hibernate recovery happens
7957 * much faster than a first, causing the observed TSC here to be
7958 * smaller; this would require additional padding adjustment, which is
7959 * why we set last_host_tsc to the local tsc observed here.
7960 *
7961 * N.B. - this code below runs only on platforms with reliable TSC,
7962 * as that is the only way backwards_tsc is set above. Also note
7963 * that this runs for ALL vcpus, which is not a bug; all VCPUs should
7964 * have the same delta_cyc adjustment applied if backwards_tsc
7965 * is detected. Note further, this adjustment is only done once,
7966 * as we reset last_host_tsc on all VCPUs to stop this from being
7967 * called multiple times (one for each physical CPU bringup).
7968 *
7969 * Platforms with unreliable TSCs don't have to deal with this, they
7970 * will be compensated by the logic in vcpu_load, which sets the TSC to
7971 * catchup mode. This will catchup all VCPUs to real time, but cannot
7972 * guarantee that they stay in perfect synchronization.
7973 */
7974 if (backwards_tsc) {
7975 u64 delta_cyc = max_tsc - local_tsc;
7976 list_for_each_entry(kvm, &vm_list, vm_list) {
7977 kvm->arch.backwards_tsc_observed = true;
7978 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm) {
7979 vcpu->arch.tsc_offset_adjustment += delta_cyc;
7980 vcpu->arch.last_host_tsc = local_tsc;
7981 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_MASTERCLOCK_UPDATE, vcpu);
7982 }
7983
7984 /*
7985 * We have to disable TSC offset matching.. if you were
7986 * booting a VM while issuing an S4 host suspend....
7987 * you may have some problem. Solving this issue is
7988 * left as an exercise to the reader.
7989 */
7990 kvm->arch.last_tsc_nsec = 0;
7991 kvm->arch.last_tsc_write = 0;
7992 }
7993
7994 }
7995 return 0;
7996}
7997
7998void kvm_arch_hardware_disable(void)
7999{
8000 kvm_x86_ops->hardware_disable();
8001 drop_user_return_notifiers();
8002}
8003
8004int kvm_arch_hardware_setup(void)
8005{
8006 int r;
8007
8008 r = kvm_x86_ops->hardware_setup();
8009 if (r != 0)
8010 return r;
8011
8012 if (kvm_has_tsc_control) {
8013 /*
8014 * Make sure the user can only configure tsc_khz values that
8015 * fit into a signed integer.
8016 * A min value is not calculated needed because it will always
8017 * be 1 on all machines.
8018 */
8019 u64 max = min(0x7fffffffULL,
8020 __scale_tsc(kvm_max_tsc_scaling_ratio, tsc_khz));
8021 kvm_max_guest_tsc_khz = max;
8022
8023 kvm_default_tsc_scaling_ratio = 1ULL << kvm_tsc_scaling_ratio_frac_bits;
8024 }
8025
8026 kvm_init_msr_list();
8027 return 0;
8028}
8029
8030void kvm_arch_hardware_unsetup(void)
8031{
8032 kvm_x86_ops->hardware_unsetup();
8033}
8034
8035void kvm_arch_check_processor_compat(void *rtn)
8036{
8037 kvm_x86_ops->check_processor_compatibility(rtn);
8038}
8039
8040bool kvm_vcpu_is_reset_bsp(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8041{
8042 return vcpu->kvm->arch.bsp_vcpu_id == vcpu->vcpu_id;
8043}
8044EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_vcpu_is_reset_bsp);
8045
8046bool kvm_vcpu_is_bsp(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8047{
8048 return (vcpu->arch.apic_base & MSR_IA32_APICBASE_BSP) != 0;
8049}
8050
8051struct static_key kvm_no_apic_vcpu __read_mostly;
8052EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_no_apic_vcpu);
8053
8054int kvm_arch_vcpu_init(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8055{
8056 struct page *page;
8057 struct kvm *kvm;
8058 int r;
8059
8060 BUG_ON(vcpu->kvm == NULL);
8061 kvm = vcpu->kvm;
8062
8063 vcpu->arch.apicv_active = kvm_x86_ops->get_enable_apicv(vcpu);
8064 vcpu->arch.pv.pv_unhalted = false;
8065 vcpu->arch.emulate_ctxt.ops = &emulate_ops;
8066 if (!irqchip_in_kernel(kvm) || kvm_vcpu_is_reset_bsp(vcpu))
8067 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE;
8068 else
8069 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_UNINITIALIZED;
8070
8071 page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_ZERO);
8072 if (!page) {
8073 r = -ENOMEM;
8074 goto fail;
8075 }
8076 vcpu->arch.pio_data = page_address(page);
8077
8078 kvm_set_tsc_khz(vcpu, max_tsc_khz);
8079
8080 r = kvm_mmu_create(vcpu);
8081 if (r < 0)
8082 goto fail_free_pio_data;
8083
8084 if (irqchip_in_kernel(kvm)) {
8085 r = kvm_create_lapic(vcpu);
8086 if (r < 0)
8087 goto fail_mmu_destroy;
8088 } else
8089 static_key_slow_inc(&kvm_no_apic_vcpu);
8090
8091 vcpu->arch.mce_banks = kzalloc(KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS * sizeof(u64) * 4,
8092 GFP_KERNEL);
8093 if (!vcpu->arch.mce_banks) {
8094 r = -ENOMEM;
8095 goto fail_free_lapic;
8096 }
8097 vcpu->arch.mcg_cap = KVM_MAX_MCE_BANKS;
8098
8099 if (!zalloc_cpumask_var(&vcpu->arch.wbinvd_dirty_mask, GFP_KERNEL)) {
8100 r = -ENOMEM;
8101 goto fail_free_mce_banks;
8102 }
8103
8104 fx_init(vcpu);
8105
8106 vcpu->arch.ia32_tsc_adjust_msr = 0x0;
8107 vcpu->arch.pv_time_enabled = false;
8108
8109 vcpu->arch.guest_supported_xcr0 = 0;
8110 vcpu->arch.guest_xstate_size = XSAVE_HDR_SIZE + XSAVE_HDR_OFFSET;
8111
8112 vcpu->arch.maxphyaddr = cpuid_query_maxphyaddr(vcpu);
8113
8114 vcpu->arch.pat = MSR_IA32_CR_PAT_DEFAULT;
8115
8116 kvm_async_pf_hash_reset(vcpu);
8117 kvm_pmu_init(vcpu);
8118
8119 vcpu->arch.pending_external_vector = -1;
8120 vcpu->arch.preempted_in_kernel = false;
8121
8122 kvm_hv_vcpu_init(vcpu);
8123
8124 return 0;
8125
8126fail_free_mce_banks:
8127 kfree(vcpu->arch.mce_banks);
8128fail_free_lapic:
8129 kvm_free_lapic(vcpu);
8130fail_mmu_destroy:
8131 kvm_mmu_destroy(vcpu);
8132fail_free_pio_data:
8133 free_page((unsigned long)vcpu->arch.pio_data);
8134fail:
8135 return r;
8136}
8137
8138void kvm_arch_vcpu_uninit(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8139{
8140 int idx;
8141
8142 kvm_hv_vcpu_uninit(vcpu);
8143 kvm_pmu_destroy(vcpu);
8144 kfree(vcpu->arch.mce_banks);
8145 kvm_free_lapic(vcpu);
8146 idx = srcu_read_lock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu);
8147 kvm_mmu_destroy(vcpu);
8148 srcu_read_unlock(&vcpu->kvm->srcu, idx);
8149 free_page((unsigned long)vcpu->arch.pio_data);
8150 if (!lapic_in_kernel(vcpu))
8151 static_key_slow_dec(&kvm_no_apic_vcpu);
8152}
8153
8154void kvm_arch_sched_in(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, int cpu)
8155{
8156 kvm_x86_ops->sched_in(vcpu, cpu);
8157}
8158
8159int kvm_arch_init_vm(struct kvm *kvm, unsigned long type)
8160{
8161 if (type)
8162 return -EINVAL;
8163
8164 INIT_HLIST_HEAD(&kvm->arch.mask_notifier_list);
8165 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kvm->arch.active_mmu_pages);
8166 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kvm->arch.zapped_obsolete_pages);
8167 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&kvm->arch.assigned_dev_head);
8168 atomic_set(&kvm->arch.noncoherent_dma_count, 0);
8169
8170 /* Reserve bit 0 of irq_sources_bitmap for userspace irq source */
8171 set_bit(KVM_USERSPACE_IRQ_SOURCE_ID, &kvm->arch.irq_sources_bitmap);
8172 /* Reserve bit 1 of irq_sources_bitmap for irqfd-resampler */
8173 set_bit(KVM_IRQFD_RESAMPLE_IRQ_SOURCE_ID,
8174 &kvm->arch.irq_sources_bitmap);
8175
8176 raw_spin_lock_init(&kvm->arch.tsc_write_lock);
8177 mutex_init(&kvm->arch.apic_map_lock);
8178 mutex_init(&kvm->arch.hyperv.hv_lock);
8179 spin_lock_init(&kvm->arch.pvclock_gtod_sync_lock);
8180
8181 kvm->arch.kvmclock_offset = -ktime_get_boot_ns();
8182 pvclock_update_vm_gtod_copy(kvm);
8183
8184 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_update_work, kvmclock_update_fn);
8185 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_sync_work, kvmclock_sync_fn);
8186
8187 kvm_page_track_init(kvm);
8188 kvm_mmu_init_vm(kvm);
8189
8190 if (kvm_x86_ops->vm_init)
8191 return kvm_x86_ops->vm_init(kvm);
8192
8193 return 0;
8194}
8195
8196static void kvm_unload_vcpu_mmu(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8197{
8198 int r;
8199 r = vcpu_load(vcpu);
8200 BUG_ON(r);
8201 kvm_mmu_unload(vcpu);
8202 vcpu_put(vcpu);
8203}
8204
8205static void kvm_free_vcpus(struct kvm *kvm)
8206{
8207 unsigned int i;
8208 struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu;
8209
8210 /*
8211 * Unpin any mmu pages first.
8212 */
8213 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm) {
8214 kvm_clear_async_pf_completion_queue(vcpu);
8215 kvm_unload_vcpu_mmu(vcpu);
8216 }
8217 kvm_for_each_vcpu(i, vcpu, kvm)
8218 kvm_arch_vcpu_free(vcpu);
8219
8220 mutex_lock(&kvm->lock);
8221 for (i = 0; i < atomic_read(&kvm->online_vcpus); i++)
8222 kvm->vcpus[i] = NULL;
8223
8224 atomic_set(&kvm->online_vcpus, 0);
8225 mutex_unlock(&kvm->lock);
8226}
8227
8228void kvm_arch_sync_events(struct kvm *kvm)
8229{
8230 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_sync_work);
8231 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&kvm->arch.kvmclock_update_work);
8232 kvm_free_pit(kvm);
8233}
8234
8235int __x86_set_memory_region(struct kvm *kvm, int id, gpa_t gpa, u32 size)
8236{
8237 int i, r;
8238 unsigned long hva;
8239 struct kvm_memslots *slots = kvm_memslots(kvm);
8240 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot, old;
8241
8242 /* Called with kvm->slots_lock held. */
8243 if (WARN_ON(id >= KVM_MEM_SLOTS_NUM))
8244 return -EINVAL;
8245
8246 slot = id_to_memslot(slots, id);
8247 if (size) {
8248 if (slot->npages)
8249 return -EEXIST;
8250
8251 /*
8252 * MAP_SHARED to prevent internal slot pages from being moved
8253 * by fork()/COW.
8254 */
8255 hva = vm_mmap(NULL, 0, size, PROT_READ | PROT_WRITE,
8256 MAP_SHARED | MAP_ANONYMOUS, 0);
8257 if (IS_ERR((void *)hva))
8258 return PTR_ERR((void *)hva);
8259 } else {
8260 if (!slot->npages)
8261 return 0;
8262
8263 hva = 0;
8264 }
8265
8266 old = *slot;
8267 for (i = 0; i < KVM_ADDRESS_SPACE_NUM; i++) {
