8268 struct kvm_userspace_memory_region m;
8269
8270 m.slot = id | (i << 16);
8271 m.flags = 0;
8272 m.guest_phys_addr = gpa;
8273 m.userspace_addr = hva;
8274 m.memory_size = size;
8275 r = __kvm_set_memory_region(kvm, &m);
8276 if (r < 0)
8277 return r;
8278 }
8279
8280 if (!size)
8281 vm_munmap(old.userspace_addr, old.npages * PAGE_SIZE);
8282
8283 return 0;
8284}
8285EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(__x86_set_memory_region);
8286
8287int x86_set_memory_region(struct kvm *kvm, int id, gpa_t gpa, u32 size)
8288{
8289 int r;
8290
8291 mutex_lock(&kvm->slots_lock);
8292 r = __x86_set_memory_region(kvm, id, gpa, size);
8293 mutex_unlock(&kvm->slots_lock);
8294
8295 return r;
8296}
8297EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(x86_set_memory_region);
8298
8299void kvm_arch_destroy_vm(struct kvm *kvm)
8300{
8301 if (current->mm == kvm->mm) {
8302 /*
8303 * Free memory regions allocated on behalf of userspace,
8304 * unless the the memory map has changed due to process exit
8305 * or fd copying.
8306 */
8307 x86_set_memory_region(kvm, APIC_ACCESS_PAGE_PRIVATE_MEMSLOT, 0, 0);
8308 x86_set_memory_region(kvm, IDENTITY_PAGETABLE_PRIVATE_MEMSLOT, 0, 0);
8309 x86_set_memory_region(kvm, TSS_PRIVATE_MEMSLOT, 0, 0);
8310 }
8311 if (kvm_x86_ops->vm_destroy)
8312 kvm_x86_ops->vm_destroy(kvm);
8313 kvm_pic_destroy(kvm);
8314 kvm_ioapic_destroy(kvm);
8315 kvm_free_vcpus(kvm);
8316 kvfree(rcu_dereference_check(kvm->arch.apic_map, 1));
8317 kvm_mmu_uninit_vm(kvm);
8318 kvm_page_track_cleanup(kvm);
8319}
8320
8321void kvm_arch_free_memslot(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *free,
8322 struct kvm_memory_slot *dont)
8323{
8324 int i;
8325
8326 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_PAGE_SIZES; ++i) {
8327 if (!dont || free->arch.rmap[i] != dont->arch.rmap[i]) {
8328 kvfree(free->arch.rmap[i]);
8329 free->arch.rmap[i] = NULL;
8330 }
8331 if (i == 0)
8332 continue;
8333
8334 if (!dont || free->arch.lpage_info[i - 1] !=
8335 dont->arch.lpage_info[i - 1]) {
8336 kvfree(free->arch.lpage_info[i - 1]);
8337 free->arch.lpage_info[i - 1] = NULL;
8338 }
8339 }
8340
8341 kvm_page_track_free_memslot(free, dont);
8342}
8343
8344int kvm_arch_create_memslot(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memory_slot *slot,
8345 unsigned long npages)
8346{
8347 int i;
8348
8349 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_PAGE_SIZES; ++i) {
8350 struct kvm_lpage_info *linfo;
8351 unsigned long ugfn;
8352 int lpages;
8353 int level = i + 1;
8354
8355 lpages = gfn_to_index(slot->base_gfn + npages - 1,
8356 slot->base_gfn, level) + 1;
8357
8358 slot->arch.rmap[i] =
8359 kvzalloc(lpages * sizeof(*slot->arch.rmap[i]), GFP_KERNEL);
8360 if (!slot->arch.rmap[i])
8361 goto out_free;
8362 if (i == 0)
8363 continue;
8364
8365 linfo = kvzalloc(lpages * sizeof(*linfo), GFP_KERNEL);
8366 if (!linfo)
8367 goto out_free;
8368
8369 slot->arch.lpage_info[i - 1] = linfo;
8370
8371 if (slot->base_gfn & (KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1))
8372 linfo[0].disallow_lpage = 1;
8373 if ((slot->base_gfn + npages) & (KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1))
8374 linfo[lpages - 1].disallow_lpage = 1;
8375 ugfn = slot->userspace_addr >> PAGE_SHIFT;
8376 /*
8377 * If the gfn and userspace address are not aligned wrt each
8378 * other, or if explicitly asked to, disable large page
8379 * support for this slot
8380 */
8381 if ((slot->base_gfn ^ ugfn) & (KVM_PAGES_PER_HPAGE(level) - 1) ||
8382 !kvm_largepages_enabled()) {
8383 unsigned long j;
8384
8385 for (j = 0; j < lpages; ++j)
8386 linfo[j].disallow_lpage = 1;
8387 }
8388 }
8389
8390 if (kvm_page_track_create_memslot(slot, npages))
8391 goto out_free;
8392
8393 return 0;
8394
8395out_free:
8396 for (i = 0; i < KVM_NR_PAGE_SIZES; ++i) {
8397 kvfree(slot->arch.rmap[i]);
8398 slot->arch.rmap[i] = NULL;
8399 if (i == 0)
8400 continue;
8401
8402 kvfree(slot->arch.lpage_info[i - 1]);
8403 slot->arch.lpage_info[i - 1] = NULL;
8404 }
8405 return -ENOMEM;
8406}
8407
8408void kvm_arch_memslots_updated(struct kvm *kvm, struct kvm_memslots *slots)
8409{
8410 /*
8411 * memslots->generation has been incremented.
8412 * mmio generation may have reached its maximum value.
8413 */
8414 kvm_mmu_invalidate_mmio_sptes(kvm, slots);
8415}
8416
8417int kvm_arch_prepare_memory_region(struct kvm *kvm,
8418 struct kvm_memory_slot *memslot,
8419 const struct kvm_userspace_memory_region *mem,
8420 enum kvm_mr_change change)
8421{
8422 return 0;
8423}
8424
8425static void kvm_mmu_slot_apply_flags(struct kvm *kvm,
8426 struct kvm_memory_slot *new)
8427{
8428 /* Still write protect RO slot */
8429 if (new->flags & KVM_MEM_READONLY) {
8430 kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access(kvm, new);
8431 return;
8432 }
8433
8434 /*
8435 * Call kvm_x86_ops dirty logging hooks when they are valid.
8436 *
8437 * kvm_x86_ops->slot_disable_log_dirty is called when:
8438 *
8439 * - KVM_MR_CREATE with dirty logging is disabled
8440 * - KVM_MR_FLAGS_ONLY with dirty logging is disabled in new flag
8441 *
8442 * The reason is, in case of PML, we need to set D-bit for any slots
8443 * with dirty logging disabled in order to eliminate unnecessary GPA
8444 * logging in PML buffer (and potential PML buffer full VMEXT). This
8445 * guarantees leaving PML enabled during guest's lifetime won't have
8446 * any additonal overhead from PML when guest is running with dirty
8447 * logging disabled for memory slots.
8448 *
8449 * kvm_x86_ops->slot_enable_log_dirty is called when switching new slot
8450 * to dirty logging mode.
8451 *
8452 * If kvm_x86_ops dirty logging hooks are invalid, use write protect.
8453 *
8454 * In case of write protect:
8455 *
8456 * Write protect all pages for dirty logging.
8457 *
8458 * All the sptes including the large sptes which point to this
8459 * slot are set to readonly. We can not create any new large
8460 * spte on this slot until the end of the logging.
8461 *
8462 * See the comments in fast_page_fault().
8463 */
8464 if (new->flags & KVM_MEM_LOG_DIRTY_PAGES) {
8465 if (kvm_x86_ops->slot_enable_log_dirty)
8466 kvm_x86_ops->slot_enable_log_dirty(kvm, new);
8467 else
8468 kvm_mmu_slot_remove_write_access(kvm, new);
8469 } else {
8470 if (kvm_x86_ops->slot_disable_log_dirty)
8471 kvm_x86_ops->slot_disable_log_dirty(kvm, new);
8472 }
8473}
8474
8475void kvm_arch_commit_memory_region(struct kvm *kvm,
8476 const struct kvm_userspace_memory_region *mem,
8477 const struct kvm_memory_slot *old,
8478 const struct kvm_memory_slot *new,
8479 enum kvm_mr_change change)
8480{
8481 int nr_mmu_pages = 0;
8482
8483 if (!kvm->arch.n_requested_mmu_pages)
8484 nr_mmu_pages = kvm_mmu_calculate_mmu_pages(kvm);
8485
8486 if (nr_mmu_pages)
8487 kvm_mmu_change_mmu_pages(kvm, nr_mmu_pages);
8488
8489 /*
8490 * Dirty logging tracks sptes in 4k granularity, meaning that large
8491 * sptes have to be split. If live migration is successful, the guest
8492 * in the source machine will be destroyed and large sptes will be
8493 * created in the destination. However, if the guest continues to run
8494 * in the source machine (for example if live migration fails), small
8495 * sptes will remain around and cause bad performance.
8496 *
8497 * Scan sptes if dirty logging has been stopped, dropping those
8498 * which can be collapsed into a single large-page spte. Later
8499 * page faults will create the large-page sptes.
8500 */
8501 if ((change != KVM_MR_DELETE) &&
8502 (old->flags & KVM_MEM_LOG_DIRTY_PAGES) &&
8503 !(new->flags & KVM_MEM_LOG_DIRTY_PAGES))
8504 kvm_mmu_zap_collapsible_sptes(kvm, new);
8505
8506 /*
8507 * Set up write protection and/or dirty logging for the new slot.
8508 *
8509 * For KVM_MR_DELETE and KVM_MR_MOVE, the shadow pages of old slot have
8510 * been zapped so no dirty logging staff is needed for old slot. For
8511 * KVM_MR_FLAGS_ONLY, the old slot is essentially the same one as the
8512 * new and it's also covered when dealing with the new slot.
8513 *
8514 * FIXME: const-ify all uses of struct kvm_memory_slot.
8515 */
8516 if (change != KVM_MR_DELETE)
8517 kvm_mmu_slot_apply_flags(kvm, (struct kvm_memory_slot *) new);
8518}
8519
8520void kvm_arch_flush_shadow_all(struct kvm *kvm)
8521{
8522 kvm_mmu_invalidate_zap_all_pages(kvm);
8523}
8524
8525void kvm_arch_flush_shadow_memslot(struct kvm *kvm,
8526 struct kvm_memory_slot *slot)
8527{
8528 kvm_page_track_flush_slot(kvm, slot);
8529}
8530
8531static inline bool kvm_vcpu_has_events(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8532{
8533 if (!list_empty_careful(&vcpu->async_pf.done))
8534 return true;
8535
8536 if (kvm_apic_has_events(vcpu))
8537 return true;
8538
8539 if (vcpu->arch.pv.pv_unhalted)
8540 return true;
8541
8542 if (vcpu->arch.exception.pending)
8543 return true;
8544
8545 if (kvm_test_request(KVM_REQ_NMI, vcpu) ||
8546 (vcpu->arch.nmi_pending &&
8547 kvm_x86_ops->nmi_allowed(vcpu)))
8548 return true;
8549
8550 if (kvm_test_request(KVM_REQ_SMI, vcpu) ||
8551 (vcpu->arch.smi_pending && !is_smm(vcpu)))
8552 return true;
8553
8554 if (kvm_arch_interrupt_allowed(vcpu) &&
8555 kvm_cpu_has_interrupt(vcpu))
8556 return true;
8557
8558 if (kvm_hv_has_stimer_pending(vcpu))
8559 return true;
8560
8561 return false;
8562}
8563
8564int kvm_arch_vcpu_runnable(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8565{
8566 return kvm_vcpu_running(vcpu) || kvm_vcpu_has_events(vcpu);
8567}
8568
8569bool kvm_arch_vcpu_in_kernel(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8570{
8571 return vcpu->arch.preempted_in_kernel;
8572}
8573
8574int kvm_arch_vcpu_should_kick(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8575{
8576 return kvm_vcpu_exiting_guest_mode(vcpu) == IN_GUEST_MODE;
8577}
8578
8579int kvm_arch_interrupt_allowed(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8580{
8581 return kvm_x86_ops->interrupt_allowed(vcpu);
8582}
8583
8584unsigned long kvm_get_linear_rip(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8585{
8586 if (is_64_bit_mode(vcpu))
8587 return kvm_rip_read(vcpu);
8588 return (u32)(get_segment_base(vcpu, VCPU_SREG_CS) +
8589 kvm_rip_read(vcpu));
8590}
8591EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_linear_rip);
8592
8593bool kvm_is_linear_rip(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long linear_rip)
8594{
8595 return kvm_get_linear_rip(vcpu) == linear_rip;
8596}
8597EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_is_linear_rip);
8598
8599unsigned long kvm_get_rflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8600{
8601 unsigned long rflags;
8602
8603 rflags = kvm_x86_ops->get_rflags(vcpu);
8604 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP)
8605 rflags &= ~X86_EFLAGS_TF;
8606 return rflags;
8607}
8608EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_get_rflags);
8609
8610static void __kvm_set_rflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long rflags)
8611{
8612 if (vcpu->guest_debug & KVM_GUESTDBG_SINGLESTEP &&
8613 kvm_is_linear_rip(vcpu, vcpu->arch.singlestep_rip))
8614 rflags |= X86_EFLAGS_TF;
8615 kvm_x86_ops->set_rflags(vcpu, rflags);
8616}
8617
8618void kvm_set_rflags(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, unsigned long rflags)
8619{
8620 __kvm_set_rflags(vcpu, rflags);
8621 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_EVENT, vcpu);
8622}
8623EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_set_rflags);
8624
8625void kvm_arch_async_page_ready(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, struct kvm_async_pf *work)
8626{
8627 int r;
8628
8629 if ((vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map != work->arch.direct_map) ||
8630 work->wakeup_all)
8631 return;
8632
8633 r = kvm_mmu_reload(vcpu);
8634 if (unlikely(r))
8635 return;
8636
8637 if (!vcpu->arch.mmu.direct_map &&
8638 work->arch.cr3 != vcpu->arch.mmu.get_cr3(vcpu))
8639 return;
8640
8641 vcpu->arch.mmu.page_fault(vcpu, work->gva, 0, true);
8642}
8643
8644static inline u32 kvm_async_pf_hash_fn(gfn_t gfn)
8645{
8646 return hash_32(gfn & 0xffffffff, order_base_2(ASYNC_PF_PER_VCPU));
8647}
8648
8649static inline u32 kvm_async_pf_next_probe(u32 key)
8650{
8651 return (key + 1) & (roundup_pow_of_two(ASYNC_PF_PER_VCPU) - 1);
8652}
8653
8654static void kvm_add_async_pf_gfn(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn)
8655{
8656 u32 key = kvm_async_pf_hash_fn(gfn);
8657
8658 while (vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[key] != ~0)
8659 key = kvm_async_pf_next_probe(key);
8660
8661 vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[key] = gfn;
8662}
8663
8664static u32 kvm_async_pf_gfn_slot(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn)
8665{
8666 int i;
8667 u32 key = kvm_async_pf_hash_fn(gfn);
8668
8669 for (i = 0; i < roundup_pow_of_two(ASYNC_PF_PER_VCPU) &&
8670 (vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[key] != gfn &&
8671 vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[key] != ~0); i++)
8672 key = kvm_async_pf_next_probe(key);
8673
8674 return key;
8675}
8676
8677bool kvm_find_async_pf_gfn(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn)
8678{
8679 return vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[kvm_async_pf_gfn_slot(vcpu, gfn)] == gfn;
8680}
8681
8682static void kvm_del_async_pf_gfn(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, gfn_t gfn)
8683{
8684 u32 i, j, k;
8685
8686 i = j = kvm_async_pf_gfn_slot(vcpu, gfn);
8687 while (true) {
8688 vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[i] = ~0;
8689 do {
8690 j = kvm_async_pf_next_probe(j);
8691 if (vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[j] == ~0)
8692 return;
8693 k = kvm_async_pf_hash_fn(vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[j]);
8694 /*
8695 * k lies cyclically in ]i,j]
8696 * | i.k.j |
8697 * |....j i.k.| or |.k..j i...|
8698 */
8699 } while ((i <= j) ? (i < k && k <= j) : (i < k || k <= j));
8700 vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[i] = vcpu->arch.apf.gfns[j];
8701 i = j;
8702 }
8703}
8704
8705static int apf_put_user(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 val)
8706{
8707
8708 return kvm_write_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.apf.data, &val,
8709 sizeof(val));
8710}
8711
8712static int apf_get_user(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu, u32 *val)
8713{
8714
8715 return kvm_read_guest_cached(vcpu->kvm, &vcpu->arch.apf.data, val,
8716 sizeof(u32));
8717}
8718
8719void kvm_arch_async_page_not_present(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
8720 struct kvm_async_pf *work)
8721{
8722 struct x86_exception fault;
8723
8724 trace_kvm_async_pf_not_present(work->arch.token, work->gva);
8725 kvm_add_async_pf_gfn(vcpu, work->arch.gfn);
8726
8727 if (!(vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val & KVM_ASYNC_PF_ENABLED) ||
8728 (vcpu->arch.apf.send_user_only &&
8729 kvm_x86_ops->get_cpl(vcpu) == 0))
8730 kvm_make_request(KVM_REQ_APF_HALT, vcpu);
8731 else if (!apf_put_user(vcpu, KVM_PV_REASON_PAGE_NOT_PRESENT)) {
8732 fault.vector = PF_VECTOR;
8733 fault.error_code_valid = true;
8734 fault.error_code = 0;
8735 fault.nested_page_fault = false;
8736 fault.address = work->arch.token;
8737 fault.async_page_fault = true;
8738 kvm_inject_page_fault(vcpu, &fault);
8739 }
8740}
8741
8742void kvm_arch_async_page_present(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu,
8743 struct kvm_async_pf *work)
8744{
8745 struct x86_exception fault;
8746 u32 val;
8747
8748 if (work->wakeup_all)
8749 work->arch.token = ~0; /* broadcast wakeup */
8750 else
8751 kvm_del_async_pf_gfn(vcpu, work->arch.gfn);
8752 trace_kvm_async_pf_ready(work->arch.token, work->gva);
8753
8754 if (vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val & KVM_ASYNC_PF_ENABLED &&
8755 !apf_get_user(vcpu, &val)) {
8756 if (val == KVM_PV_REASON_PAGE_NOT_PRESENT &&
8757 vcpu->arch.exception.pending &&
8758 vcpu->arch.exception.nr == PF_VECTOR &&
8759 !apf_put_user(vcpu, 0)) {
8760 vcpu->arch.exception.injected = false;
8761 vcpu->arch.exception.pending = false;
8762 vcpu->arch.exception.nr = 0;
8763 vcpu->arch.exception.has_error_code = false;
8764 vcpu->arch.exception.error_code = 0;
8765 } else if (!apf_put_user(vcpu, KVM_PV_REASON_PAGE_READY)) {
8766 fault.vector = PF_VECTOR;
8767 fault.error_code_valid = true;
8768 fault.error_code = 0;
8769 fault.nested_page_fault = false;
8770 fault.address = work->arch.token;
8771 fault.async_page_fault = true;
8772 kvm_inject_page_fault(vcpu, &fault);
8773 }
8774 }
8775 vcpu->arch.apf.halted = false;
8776 vcpu->arch.mp_state = KVM_MP_STATE_RUNNABLE;
8777}
8778
8779bool kvm_arch_can_inject_async_page_present(struct kvm_vcpu *vcpu)
8780{
8781 if (!(vcpu->arch.apf.msr_val & KVM_ASYNC_PF_ENABLED))
8782 return true;
8783 else
8784 return kvm_can_do_async_pf(vcpu);
8785}
8786
8787void kvm_arch_start_assignment(struct kvm *kvm)
8788{
8789 atomic_inc(&kvm->arch.assigned_device_count);
8790}
8791EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_start_assignment);
8792
8793void kvm_arch_end_assignment(struct kvm *kvm)
8794{
8795 atomic_dec(&kvm->arch.assigned_device_count);
8796}
8797EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_end_assignment);
8798
8799bool kvm_arch_has_assigned_device(struct kvm *kvm)
8800{
8801 return atomic_read(&kvm->arch.assigned_device_count);
8802}
8803EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_has_assigned_device);
8804
8805void kvm_arch_register_noncoherent_dma(struct kvm *kvm)
8806{
8807 atomic_inc(&kvm->arch.noncoherent_dma_count);
8808}
8809EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_register_noncoherent_dma);
8810
8811void kvm_arch_unregister_noncoherent_dma(struct kvm *kvm)
8812{
8813 atomic_dec(&kvm->arch.noncoherent_dma_count);
8814}
8815EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_unregister_noncoherent_dma);
8816
8817bool kvm_arch_has_noncoherent_dma(struct kvm *kvm)
8818{
8819 return atomic_read(&kvm->arch.noncoherent_dma_count);
8820}
8821EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_arch_has_noncoherent_dma);
8822
8823bool kvm_arch_has_irq_bypass(void)
8824{
8825 return kvm_x86_ops->update_pi_irte != NULL;
8826}
8827
8828int kvm_arch_irq_bypass_add_producer(struct irq_bypass_consumer *cons,
8829 struct irq_bypass_producer *prod)
8830{
8831 struct kvm_kernel_irqfd *irqfd =
8832 container_of(cons, struct kvm_kernel_irqfd, consumer);
8833
8834 irqfd->producer = prod;
8835
8836 return kvm_x86_ops->update_pi_irte(irqfd->kvm,
8837 prod->irq, irqfd->gsi, 1);
8838}
8839
8840void kvm_arch_irq_bypass_del_producer(struct irq_bypass_consumer *cons,
8841 struct irq_bypass_producer *prod)
8842{
8843 int ret;
8844 struct kvm_kernel_irqfd *irqfd =
8845 container_of(cons, struct kvm_kernel_irqfd, consumer);
8846
8847 WARN_ON(irqfd->producer != prod);
8848 irqfd->producer = NULL;
8849
8850 /*
8851 * When producer of consumer is unregistered, we change back to
8852 * remapped mode, so we can re-use the current implementation
8853 * when the irq is masked/disabled or the consumer side (KVM
8854 * int this case doesn't want to receive the interrupts.
8855 */
8856 ret = kvm_x86_ops->update_pi_irte(irqfd->kvm, prod->irq, irqfd->gsi, 0);
8857 if (ret)
8858 printk(KERN_INFO "irq bypass consumer (token %p) unregistration"
8859 " fails: %d\n", irqfd->consumer.token, ret);
8860}
8861
8862int kvm_arch_update_irqfd_routing(struct kvm *kvm, unsigned int host_irq,
8863 uint32_t guest_irq, bool set)
8864{
8865 if (!kvm_x86_ops->update_pi_irte)
8866 return -EINVAL;
8867
8868 return kvm_x86_ops->update_pi_irte(kvm, host_irq, guest_irq, set);
8869}
8870
8871bool kvm_vector_hashing_enabled(void)
8872{
8873 return vector_hashing;
8874}
8875EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_vector_hashing_enabled);

8881EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_msr);
8882EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_cr);
8883EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_nested_vmrun);
8884EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_nested_vmexit);
8885EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_nested_vmexit_inject);
8886EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_nested_intr_vmexit);
8887EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_invlpga);
8888EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_skinit);
8889EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_nested_intercepts);
8890EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_write_tsc_offset);
8891EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_ple_window);
8892EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_pml_full);
8893EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_pi_irte_update);
8894EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_avic_unaccelerated_access);
8895EXPORT_TRACEPOINT_SYMBOL_GPL(kvm_avic_incomplete_ipi);
